story:
Roman Wawrzak lives in Bristol, PA.  On June 2, 2013 his life changed forever, he had an accident while jumping to the swimming pool.  He broke his spine, vertebrae c6, c7 and t1 and damaged his nerves.  So, far he had two surgeries, that went well, as they could in that kind of accident, but now Roman has a long way ahead of him to be able to walk again.  He needs physical therapy, but does not have health insurance.  He needs our help to be able afford this kind of therapy and give him chance to normal life.  

No amount is to small.  Please help us contribute to his cause.

Roman has a long road ahead of him.  He will need a lot of physical therapy to be able to walk again, to perform daily functions, to move his hands.

If we help him financially, Roman, might be able to live a regular life.  If you are unable to contribute make everyone around you aware about the spinal cord injury.

 June 11, 2013 Update

Roman had a good day today, he was able to walk the length of hospital hallway.  This is really good news.  Right after his two surgeries doctors did know if he was going to walk again.  He still has trouble with his hands, not able to hold spoon or anything, but hopefully it will improve with time and with physical therapy.

story:
Hi!

 

My name is Zhanna and I am an artist, translator as well as part-time writer living in New York. I started painting and drawing around 5 years ago. 5 1/2 months ago a miracle happened in my life - I gave birth to the cutest girl out there - Sofia. Sofia has definitely inspired me in many various ways. She was the source of inspiration for this particular project too. 

I have lots of friends that form non-traditional unions with same gender partners. Two of them recently adopted a little girl from Ukraine. At the moment the girl`s world still spins exclusively around her two dads. But what will happen in several years? When she goes to a pre-school, then school? How much tolerance from the other children growing up in traditional families will she experience? And what will be her path to realization of the fact that she has two dads and no mom, which is not a very common occurence? The same-sex parents and children raised in same-sex families still face a lot of prejudice and unequal treatment.

This short (12-15 pages max) fairy tale narrates a story of a cute panda-bear girl named Sonia adopted by two male New York bears. It is recommended for children aged 3 to 7 but anybody will enjoy reading it. There will be cute illustrations done by me and one of my friends who is also an artist. The fairy tale will describe Sonia`s adventures in New York and will talk in an implied way about the need to be understanding and accepting of the same gender families.

Your contributions will help us pay for the supplies needed, preparation of the publication (creating of illustrations, design of the cover) as well as for the very publishing process.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will help us pay for the supplies needed,  preparation of the publication (creating of illustrations, design of the cover) as well as for the very publishing process.

If we don`t reach our funding goal, we are still going to finish the illustrative process and put the book together in order to pitch it to publishers.

The Impact

This project is very valuable to everyone because it is directed at educating our little ones and molding them into highly understanding and fair human beings. If children realize that everybody deserves a right to create a family and live a fulfilling life, then perhaps when they grow up they will not act disrespectfully towards the minority representatives as it often happens these days in various countries around the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Make some noise, people - this book is worth it!

And do not forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Have a sunny day!

 

Zhanna & Sofia

 

EXCERPTS from the BOOK:

....Once upon a time, there was a town, a small town with no tall buildings. And in that town lived... nope - not people, as you could think, my little pumpkins, - but Bears. It was called Bear York. Lots of time passed and the town grew - other animals came to live there: giraffes, elephants, mice, dogs, monkeys, cats, cows, porcupines, donkeys, lizards, wolves... And lots of tall buildings appeared with time. But the name remained the same - Bear York.

 

....Sonia loved exploring the city with Claude and Bob (you can pick your own names for these two characters if you choose the reward allowing you to do so). When the spring came, they went to the Evergreen Park. There were lots and lots of trees with green leaves, many of which Sonia tried to get into her mouth and eat. But her papa-bears stopped her: "Don`t eat unwashed food outside". In a short while Sonia noticed the ice-cream stand. She ran up to it and started pulling Claude`s sleeve - "I want ice-cream"... Bob, who was the strict dad, said: "No, Sonia, first you eat lunch and then a dessert". "But I want dessert first and then lunch" - the girl pouted her lips in such a cute way that could melt even the strictest dad`s heart. And well, can you guess who won? Yes, Sonia did - she got her two coins for the ice-cream...

story:
Hullo! Miranda Innaimo here. Writing is my consuming-passion. It is my every-day pursuit. To write is to share emotions in images, experience through characters, and knowledge within rhyme. For as long as I am alive, I will write, and to write well is my dream.

The Whidbey Island Writer's Conference (WIWC) of 2013 will be held this year from October 25-27th off the coast of Washington state.

http://www.nila.edu/wiwc/

It is my greatest aspiration to attend the WIWC.

Your contribution will grant me a life-altering experience; to learn techniques, to understand the market, and to meet successful authors.

What I Need & What You Get

I have estimated the need for $2200. This will cover the cost of the conference, room and board, airfare, and other travel expenses.

Several unique perks await once you make your contribution.  You could receive a hand-written poem or original work composed specifically on your behalf.

The Impact

This conference is a gateway to my flourishing future. Your financial resources will offer me an incredible opportunity to excel within my career.

They way I see it is simple: if I am going to spend day in and day out writing, I should at least strive to write well, especially on topics of glorious significance, such as spreading the Gospel and building the Kingdom of GOD. The more effectively I write, the greater chance I have of reaching the lost and spreading the Good News. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you cannot donate at this time. Still, there are ways you can help my cause.

  • Follow this cause on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/DreamBigWriteWell
  • Follow me on twitter: https://twitter.com/mirandainnaimo

 

Thank you for your interest. I hope to hear from you soon. Cheers.

story:
Support the Detroit Youth Poetry Slam Team's journey to the Brave New Voices International Youth Poetry Festival in Chicago, IL.

On August 7th, the Detroit youth poetry slam team is going to Brave New Voices (BNV), the international youth poetry slam festival, held this year in Chicago, IL. Team members Briana Sanders, Samuel Taylor, Annalise Bissa, Terrell Morrow, and Victor Shaw will compete in the international competition and attend workshops and dialogues facilitated by some of the foremost artists in the youth spoken word community. The team will join over 750 youth from across the United States and places as far away as Leeds, UK, Guam, Trinidad and Tobago, and India.

Team members are participants in InsideOut Literary Arts Projects' Citywide Poets afterschool program and have spent years of work preparing for this opportunity. The slam team has been developing poems and performances that represent the experiences, insights, and struggles of young people in their city. They will share this work with a global audience at BNV (which has received international media coverage, including two HBO specials).

In this way, the slam team hopes to tell a different story of Detroit than the way the city is portrayed by the mainstream media. Instead of only focusing on the abandonment and poverty that much of the city faces, these poets also speak to the legacy of Detroit as a source of immense cultural and intellectual power. The voices of these young people will represent Detroit to the world and then bring that energy back to their community through a series of workshops/report-backs throughout Detroit in Fall 2013 where they will then share their experience at BNV with other youth/youth organizations.

All of the money raised through this this campaign will go toward paying for travel, registration fees, housing, and food for the five team members and their three coaches, Ben Alfaro, Francine Harris, and Justin Rogers. Every donation makes a difference towards making this trip possible. We also have some awesome rewards for everyone who donates! So please check those out, donate what you can, and spread the word to others who might be interested.

This project will not only have a major impact on the lives of these young people but also on all of the people – young and old alike – who they will inspire, uplift, and transform through their written and spoken words. Thank you sincerely for your support.

+ + +

MORE ABOUT INSIDEOUT LITERARY ARTS PROJECT

InsideOut is a non-profit arts organization that has been fostering literary arts among Detroit youth since 1995. By immersing students in the joy and power of poetry and literary self-expression, InsideOut inspires them to think broadly, create bravely and share their voices with the wider world. Guided by professional writers and celebrated by publications and performances, youth learn that their stories and ideas matter and that their pens can launch them off the page into extraordinary lives.

>> www.insideoutdetroit.org <<


MORE ABOUT BRAVE NEW VOICES

The 16th Annual Brave New Voices International Youth Poetry Slam Festival is taking place in Chicago August 7-11, 2013. This year's festival is brought to you by Youth Speaks, Inc., in partnership with Young Chicago Authors, The University of Chicago Logan Center and a host of other collaborating organizations. CWP/BNV team members will be part of this life changing festival that features youth poets from across the globe. Brave New Voices is a safe place for young people to speak their minds, share their hearts and empower their voices as agents of change.

>> www.bravenewvoices.org <<

Why crowfunding?

Many companies make new products,  but only crowfinding give powerfull and fast feedback.

We plan to make many designs so i need your (community) opinion.

Our technology:

We use Envisiontec printer for print KT.

This printer designed for medical and jevelery printing. 15 micon accuracy.

Very fast and the best quality you can dream.

So good that we can send it for rapidly printing without any casting.

This is not only one figure.

We plan to make future world, approx 2020 year.

We always think: why robots made from lot of metal, bolts lot of wire? they look like scrap now in 2014 3d printers can print many materials.

That will be in future?

Our concept of future robot is: body printed by carbon fiber(This printer already exist) all wire and electronics integrated, they use flexible batteries(already produced) for movement the use artificial muscles( invented and tested), not hydraulics like in old tractors


For what you can use K.T.?

For painting, posing, diorama making, for customisation.

Very easy to add putty  and make additional complements.

And also K.T great 3d printing sample!

You can check that 3d printers can produce now and use our service in future for your designs.

When you ship?

7 days after proyect finish ! :-)

We can produce more then 100 per week.



How many sizes availables? 


1/32 and 1/24 scale


Reward Goals

Attachable options for medic , recon, engeneer, heavy troop .

New Gear, complements.

1 male figure.

We need your feedback to create more options for K.T.!

For start:

If we reach 1.200 new weapon for K.T.

If we reach 2.000 Male figure.

Thanks for your help!

story:
Douglas Anderson Writers’ Festival 2014 

Saturday, March 8th, 2014


Short Summary

  • The Douglas Anderson Writers' Festival began as an idea in the humble halls of a high school Creative Writing program 29 years ago. The festival developed from the dream of one day bringing aspiring students and renowned authors together in an inspirational atmosphere to educate, inspire, and help them hone their love of writing. 
  • Now, the festival has spread from the halls of public schools to the collegiate in a partnership with the University of North Florida, creating a unique literary tradition that can be shared by students of all generations throughout the community. Every year the festival has grown immensely in its mission to spread the love of writing in new and creative ways so future students may be even more inspired. 
  • The Alumni, Family, and Friends Campaign is our way of maintaining a relationship with our former writing community that has experienced, loved, and helped improve this unique event. From former students and their parents, to the friends who have witnessed the effects of this festival, you are the community that has helped us expand from those school desks to the larger community.
  • This year our fundraising is focused on bringing more nationally recognized poets than ever before, such as Sarah Kay, Patricia Smith, Dorianne Laux, and Joseph Millar. Whether your donation is $50 or a few dollars, this support is instrumental in helping bring these fantastic writers to our festival.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our Goal: $3,000
  • Our goal is a small percentage of the greater cost of this festival; however, that also makes the support from our Alumni, Family, and Friends Community all the more personal because it connects our past experiences to this years writers.
  • Every donor's name will be listed on the Douglas Anderson Writers’ Festival website (douglasandersonwritersfest.com) and recognized in one of three donation tiers ($.01-$25, $26-$75, $76 and above).
  • The twenty top contributing donors will be offered an optional seat to a closed performance by Sarah Kay prior to the festival.  
  • Even if we don’t reach our goal, all the funds will go to bringing these poets to the Writers’ Festival.

The Impact

  • We understand you are bombarded with causes, demands, and simply busy schedules that absorb your time. By taking just a few minutes and donating to our campaign, you will help spread the love and inspiration that you or your loved one have once experienced. Your donation will help sew the seeds for the love for writing, education, passion, dreams, and talent in order to better tomorrow through the written word.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you cannot financially contribute, we would still deeply appreciate your support by “liking” the Alumni, Family, and Friends page https://www.facebook.com/AlumniFamilyFriendsDAWritersFest2014 and participating through pictures of past festivals, comments, or experiences. Even simply following our progress and being a part of our community would make a huge difference.
  • We welcome you to share this page using indiegogo share tools and our facebook page to spread the word about our campaign!

story:
"With these books, Pythia Peay is on the verge of sharing huge psycho-spiritual-literary riches with the world." Buddhist teacher and bestselling author Tara Brach.

My name is Pythia Peay. I’m an author and depth journalist for the Huffington Post and Psychology Today. Over the past thirty years, I’ve interviewed religious and spiritual teachers, academics and activists, psychologists and Jungian analysts. I've written feature stories on dream work, death and dying, politics and psychology, and the soul of a city.  But when it came to understanding the regular Joe who happened to be my father, Joe Carroll, I was at a loss. 

Driven from home at a young age by my dad’s alcoholism and abusive temper, I let our painful father-daughter relationship sink into forgetfulness. This all changed when my father was diagnosed in 1994 with terminal cancer. As my father lay dying, the unexpected happened: His soul woke up. Seeking reconciliation, he called me, and the rest of his estranged family, to his bedside. We drew close once again.

After my father’s death I began wrestling with unanswered questions: Why had he been the way he was? Why had the bad overtaken the good in him? Stepping into Joe’s shoes I set out to experience his youth and all the events that had befallen him along the way. From Altoona and the Pennsylvania Railroad, to the Air Transport Command during World War II, TWA and 1950s Missouri and the cultural upheavals of the sixties that would drive us apart, American Icarus tells his story of the people and places who made him, the country, and the times he lived in. America on the Couch is an inspiring and enlightening collection of interviews with some of the world's leading psychologists on the deep historical, archetypal and psychological background of such enduring issues as immigration, war and violence, addiction, the presidency, and the classic myths of independence and individuality that shaped my father and his homeland.

These books have been twenty years in the making. By pre-ordering one or both of these books, you'll enable their design, editing, production, printing, and shipment to your home. I'm working with my editor and publisher, Martin Rowe of Lantern Books, who nearly 15 years ago, inspired me to tell the story of my father's life in the shadow of the American psyche. Through this campaign, you can help us bring these books into print. Through them, we hope you'll be inspired to read the text of your own parents’ lives, for all the ways they shaped you, for the lessons you can learn from the times they lived through, their failures and mistakes, the suffering they endured, and for the talents, strengths, and virtues that are your (and America's) inheritance.

psychologists and Jungian analysts. I've written feature stories on dream work, death and dying, politics and psychology, and the soul of a city.  But when it came to understanding the
regular Joe who happened to be my father, Joe Carroll, I was at a loss. 
Driven
from home at a young age by my dad’s alcoholism and abusive temper, I let our painful father-daughter relationship
sink into forgetfulness. This all changed when my father was diagnosed in 1994 with
terminal cancer. As my father lay dying, the
unexpected happened: His soul woke up. Seeking reconciliation, he called me, and the rest of his
estranged family, to his bedside. We drew close once again.
After my father’s death I began wrestling with unanswered
questions: Why had he been the way he was? Why had the bad overtaken the good
in him? Stepping into Joe’s shoes I set out to experience his youth and all the events
that had befallen him along the way. From Altoona and the Pennsylvania Railroad, to the Air Transport Command during World War II, TWA and 1950s Missouri and the cultural upheavals of the sixties that would drive us apart, American Icarus tells his story of the people and places who made him, the country, and the times he lived in. America on the Couch is an inspiring and enlightening collection of interviews with some of the world's leading psychologists on the deep historical, archetypal and psychological background of such enduring issues as immigration, war and violence, addiction, the presidency, and the classic myths of independence and individuality that shaped my father and his homeland.
These books have been twenty years in the making. By pre-ordering one or both of these books, you'll enable their design, editing, production, printing, and shipment to your home. I'm working with my editor and publisher, Martin Rowe of Lantern Books, who nearly 15 years ago, inspired me to tell the story of my father's life in the shadow of the American psyche. Through this campaign, you can help us bring these books into print. Through them, we hope you'll be inspired to read the text of
your own parents’ lives, for all the ways they shaped you, for the lessons you
can learn from the times they lived through, their failures and mistakes, the
suffering they endured, and for the talents, strengths, and virtues that are
your (and America's) inheritance.

story:
Short Summary

As the video pointed out, I used to have a part time retail job. It wasn't the most stimulating work, nor was it all that interesting, but it was easy and it paid me enough to scrape by while I pursued my dream of writing about 60 hours out of every week.

At the beginning of March, my employment ended quite suddenly and not on the best of terms. 

I have been unemployed (save for my books, which don't yet generate enough for me to live off of) since then. I've plastered my resume on craigslist and other job sites, I've filled out application after application, but I can't help but wonder what it must be like for those writers who've got the luxury of staying home and doing their craft without worrying about their next meal, their next gas fill up or their rent?

I've got severe Depression and am closely monitored by my doctor for it. This also makes it difficult for me to find and keep a brick and mortar job.

$1500 will keep me afloat until I've got my next three books finished. My next three books will be the second, third, and fourth books in the Cedarcrest Series. I'm already about a quarter of the way through Corporeal, the second book of the series.

Cedarcrest is a young adult urban fantasy series based around a fictional town called Cedarcrest that's located between the Twin Cities and Duluth in Minnesota. The town has a colorful past and the happenings there have a tendency to verge on the outrageous. 

It can aptly be described as a cross between Fear Street, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and Saw.

story:
Our Story

We are 14 Northwestern students, all of different faiths, joining together for the same purpose: to help rebuild New Orleans. Going into this trip, most of us are strangers. Coming out of it, we hope to have new best friends at the very most and a deeper understanding and appreciation of other religions at the very least. And most importantly, a great love for the city of New Orleans. This trip is in its third year and it keeps getting bigger and better as each year passes.

The Impact

While we are in New Orleans we live in the Lower Ninth Ward, in the heart of the destruction left by Hurricane Katrina. We volunteer with Common Ground Relief (http://www.commongroundrelief.org/) and rebuild homes in the area. We do anything from painting to insulation to roof repairs. From a physical standpoint, we are rebuilding houses with our bare hands. But we are doing so much more than that. We are rebuilding a family's home, their life. We are giving them the chance to live their lives with one less thing to worry about. Interacting with the families and citizens of New Orleans is the most rewarding experience of all, seeing how happy they are to know someone still cares about them.


What We Need & What You Get

What We Need: This campaign is meant to help offset the cost of our trip. In order to get 14 people to New Orleans from Chicago, we have to drive 2 minivans, each 927 miles round trip. This means the biggest section of our budget is gas. Our estimated cost at the pump is $700 round trip (courtesy of AAA Fuel Cost Calculator).


What You Get: The satisfaction of knowing you helped a group of students safely reach their destination to achieve their goal of rebuilding New Orleans. You are indirectly helping a family in New Orleans feel at home again and get their community back. And we will be in your debt forever and ever.


Other Ways You Can Help

Send this on to your friends, families, relatives, anyone who is a Saints fan, anyone who loves alternative spring break trips, or just anyone who loves New Orleans and wants to see it returned to its beautiful, thriving state.


We honestly appreciate anything you can donate. Every little bit counts.

story:
FREE GIFT FOR ALL ORDERS

TODAY ONLY!!
Last day to order a book.

Everyone who contributes any amount today will receive a free eBook version of the story and a coloring book of all of the illustrations from the story. These will be sent to you in email.

Thank you and many blessings,

Dustin e

Quiet as the Breeze, Still as the Trees, and Fast as Lightning.

A story about following your heart and being awesome.


Inspiring kids to connect with nature.

It’s a BOOK and an interactive story APP. You can get either or both, you choose :)

THE STORY

When my son was younger, I would make up stories for bedtime. We had a lot of fun, and many great stories came out of that experience together. This is one of our favorites.


The story follows the life of a young great blue heron and his journey of learning to fly and how to become a good fisherman. In the process he learns about following his heart and being an awesome person. The story is full of fun, wisdom, and love.

Here is an excerpt from the story:

Then, one fine summer day, just as the sun was rising over the magical Sacred Mountain. Daffy sat on the edge of the big branch, dangling his feet above the river. But this time he felt something change deep inside his heart. Somehow, this time he knew that he was ready. This time he could do it. He just knew it! This was something new! He felt good inside. He felt light all over. He pushed himself a little farther out on the branch.
Whoa, it’s so far down,  he thought.  But the feeling in his heart became even stronger.  He felt so excited. He just knew he could fly. In fact, he couldn’t wait another minute! He held his breath, gave one big push, and fell off the branch, plummeting into the wide open air.
“AAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!!!!” he screamed. “What do I do? What do I do ? What do I doooooo?!!!”


I wonder what happens :)


I love nature. The book is illustrated with photographs of nature. I have a collection of nature texture images that I have taken over the years. The colors and textures make for visually beautiful and unique illustrations. First I draw the illustrations, then I fill in the sections using photographs. My son helps me choose the perfect image, we have a lot of fun doing it together. The illustrations are so vibrant, joyful, and beautiful.

I hope to inspire kids to get out into nature and look for all the amazing textures and life that exists there. The beauty of the natural world is so amazing and connects us with a deeper part of ourselves. I think it can help everyone to see nature in everything, and everything in nature.


INSPIRING KIDS TO LOVE NATURE

THE APP

The APP will be a story with pages you can flip through, just like the real book. But, you will also be able to click on each of the illustration sections to see the full image that was used. With the popup image there will also be some fun nature tips about the image.

The APP will also include an audio version of the story. Each page will have a play button so you can listen to me telling the story while viewing the artwork and images. I think this is so great for kids who do not have someone to read for them. You will also be able to read the story, and just view the images.


TECHNICAL DETAILS

The books will be professionally printed in full color on quality paper.
There are 15 illustrations and 32 pages.

The APP will be available for iOS and Android mobile phones, and tablets.

*** Once the app has been developed you will be sent a promo code so you can access the app.

WHY AM I ASKING FOR YOUR ENCOURAGEMENT

I have the story, I have the vision, and the illustrations are in progress, right now. With your help I can focus more energy on this project and bring it into full realization in the world. The funds will be used for:

   •   Completing the Illustrations
   •   Layout of the book and publishing
   •   Development of the mobile App
   •   Website development and marketing

Thank you so much for your consideration and encouragement.  



PLEASE SHARE THIS WITH OTHERS,
IT MAKES A HUGE DIFFERENCE!

story:
I am struggling writer trying  to complete a novel based in 1980s Kashmir that looks at the final resistance movement of the people of Kashmir for equality and referendum before it erupted into sectarian violence and terrorism. the story follows the life of two childhood friends, Vidya and Daria who grew up in the peaceful valley of Kashmir, enjoying the same amusements and parental care, but forced to make different choices as adults for the sake of the very land which they loved and which is now torn apart in the name of religion.

The story is attempt to bring forth the struggle and the desolation that the common man faced before the Valley erupted into violence and give a voice to those forces which wanted their stories to be heard and were forced to choose violence as the only alternative to make their needs fulfilled. While this is a political novel, the idea is not to blame anyone, but put down honestly the events that led to the escalated terrorism in the valley and showcase the dilemmas and choices that the Kashmiri population had to make everyday to do what was right and yet survive.

I do not offer any perks or any other incentives for contributing to this project, expect my heart felt thanks for your generosity and kindness. I do appreciate any amount that you can spare and I understand that you may be sacrificing some of your other needs to make this happen. I am humbled by your efforts and kindness. 

The only thing I will further state is that this novel is about a marginalized people and their lives away from the sensationalist news that grace your CNN/BBC and other new papers and tries to tell the story of surviving in a land of unmitigated violence and hatred.

story:
Stories Survive.

As a writer, I believe in building bridges to and from places where stories go unseen. I believe in words as evidence that we have the power to set ripples through humanity. It's that deep.



I believe in you too, in us. We should all have the opportunity to create; to build and produce work that ensures that our stories, our lives survive.

Straight up I need $4000 to offset the costs of a 4-week writing residency at the Vermont Studio Center (Nov. 23-Dec 20 2014). You will be powering the formation of an anthology, the completion of a novel, a treatment for a next book, a community-curriculum for a past book and if I'm lucky, my lights.

Here's a budget breakdown (UPDATED!!!):
  • $1500 to Vermont Studio Center (I got a partial fellowship)
  • $2100 for bills (To do this I will have to lose TWO months pay and that's just...crucial.)
  • $400 Travel to/from Vermont (via plane...or bus...depends on y'alls love!)


Perks!

Hugs! Laughter! Goodwill! I kid, I kid. If you do support me I'll happily spend my holiday season sending you perks for your kindness. Here are some things you may find yourself with:

  • A personalized haiku on a Detroit postcard. (Whew!)
  • Art for your wall.
  • Consulting services (including resume/cv development, training the trainers and more!)
  • Bartending services  + more!


Risks & Challenges

Uh, asking you for this much money is both a risk and a challenge.

In the case that I don't get this money--or even enough to get me partially there, I'll cry. No, I'm joking, I won't (yes I will). I'll basically just thank the universe for this lesson and find other ways to create, just not in this volume at this time.

Regardless, I will not lose. [;

Tell people! Vouch for me! Spread me like butta!

If you don't have bread, don't sweat it. Tell a friend. Share me.

  • Tell people to watch my super high-tech video and consider donating.
  • Pray for me! Light a candle!
  • Offer to write with me/read with me.
  • Email people and simply ask them to consider donating.

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you wonderful people. This is already worth it.

Love,

mo

story:
The purpose of this campaign is to realize the most important thing I will do in my existence, to give my ideas and knowledge to the world. In my opinion there is no greater task, no greater mission than to publish the writing I have been creating for the last 10 years. Over this period of time I have poured every ounce of happiness, joy, anger, sadness, envy, curiosity, love, hate, jealousy, despair, loneliness, spirituality or the lack there of, guilt, arrogance, and pity into the thousands and thousands, possibly millions of words that I have written. There was times when I would lock myself in my room and would not stop writing for days, trying so desperately to articulate the ideas that were screaming through my skull. Sometimes it was psychotic, sometimes it was serene but something that it always was, and is, is genuine. Authentic, I have never censored myself or curbed my words to suit anyone or anything, they are pure. I take writing very seriously I believe it is a spiritual communion with the soul, you are drawing upon something intangible to weave a story or idea, that you are sharing with anyone willing to read or listen.

I have been so passionate about this that at one point in my life I was going to pursue it full time and quit my day-job and become what some people lovingly call a starving artist, which in reality is called being homeless, cold and hungry. And this is why you are currently reading this, I unfortunately had to keep my day-job so I could pay the bills and put food on the table, and the money I make does exactly that, no more, no less. So from the deepest part in my heart I am asking you to please help me in this calling, obligation that I feel is absolutely neccesary to the fulfillment of my life. This is not some hobby or after school activity that I engage in, this is what I believe to be what I as a human being can contribute to humanity, how I can put my footprint upon history and I know that if the right people read the right pieces I will indeed do that and I will indeed be considered a valuable literary contribution to the art of writing. So please if you can find it in yourself to help a man who is pursuing his ultimate dream in this short and fleeting existence I would forever be grateful to you, anything would be welcomed with open and loving arms. Thank you.

-EMP

story:
What if Atlantis existed, why did it fail?

If there was a prehistoric civilization, what would it be like? Why wouldn't we know about it? Where is the proof of its existence?


All valid questions. We have myths talking about civilization before massive flooding. How a great catastrophe destroyed much of humanity and only a few survivors made it to carry on civilization.

We know during the Ice Age that the seas were a lot lower and that exposed lands were fertile over thousands of years of exposure. We know there was a land bridge between Asia and North America, that there was a massive landmass connecting most of Southeast Asia, that the Persian Gulf was a large river valley and that the Gulf of Mexico was a lot smaller.


Picture of Sundaland from wikipedia


Picture Gulf of Mexico from US Govt, EPA website.

What if there were cities along the coasts of these now underwater continental shelves?

Man likes to build near oceans and rivers. If there was a civilization 10,000+ BC, more than likely they would build their cities near the shoreline of 10,000+ BC, not where it is today.

Picture of Ice Age Gibraltar Straight, BBC 2001 article.


 Hello, my name is James Grimm and I am the author of the fictional tale, Wall of Destruction. Until recently, I was a long time IT network engineer working in Japan. I had always wanted to write a book but never really found the time to do it. Always something came up that stopped me. Well, for better or worse, that is no longer an issue.

Wall of Destruction, a When Atlantis Fell novel, came about from my love for ancient history and fantasy. I loved to read about ancient civilizations and imagine what it was like to live back then. Why did they build these monuments or how did they discover certain things.

This book and the follow up series of stories will explore my imagination of how these things came about in adventure stories set at the end of Atlantis' reign. This particular one is a story about a man named Risor, a citizen of Atlantis, and how he survives the catastrophes that brought about the end of Atlantis. 

I want to have a successful career as a writer and I believe that presenting a well written story with eye catching artwork is my best chance. I ask for your help in giving me a chance to realize this dream. Those that contribute will always be remembered for helping me get started in this career.

Could I be successful? Always a possibility but not guaranteed. Please consider it not just an investment in the book, which I hope to make truly enjoyable, but in the author as well.  Please look at the last section on this campaign to read additional passages from what I have already completed. Also on my blog (http://jegrimm.wordpress.com/2014/06/10/wall-of...), I have the first 20+ pages of the book that provides  a lot of set up.


Donation usage.

Have you ever read a book that had numerous grammar mistakes or the story didn't flow? Not enjoyable, right? You might not give the author a second chance or a negative review.

Mistakes are natural, everyone makes them. Having another person check your work helps identify things that you don't see. Hiring professional copy editors to review my manuscript should significantly reduce the mistakes. Make the reading, for you, a more enjoyable experience.

Same for cover art. On most on-line stores, each book has a second or two to catch the attention of a casual browser. The old saying "Don't judge a book by its cover" is wrong when it comes to on-line buyers. A good story, with a lousy cover, would be passed over most of the time. In this campaign, the only art work that I need, is the cover art. All other art in the book will be paid for if the right level of perks are selected.


Item needed      Cost per item          
Total expected cost
copy edit 0.02-3 per word 1,600-3,600 USD
development edit     0.02-3 per word 1,600-3,600 USD
cover art n/a $500-1200 USD

These costs are estimates as the book is not complete. Currently at 60,000 words (170 pages) and not quite two-thirds complete. Top end number is assuming 120,000 words.

Other costs include taxes, Indiegogo's fee and any financial transfer fees.

If the goal is not met, I will use whatever funds are available; first for copy editing and then cover art.

As described below in the perks section, this book can really be enhanced if the higher level perks are chosen and numerous stretch goals are met. All obligations to the primary funding goals and perks will be met first. Additional funding can help me concentrate on producing this book as my primary job.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge to completing this book is my time. Being unemployed, for the last few months, I have had plenty of time to work on this and I believe I have used my time wisely. If I need to find a job, then I can not guarantee this book will be finished, this year, as the new job must be my first priority.

I will continue to work on the book and any funds donated will still be used for the act of publishing this book. If not this year, then I should have it complete by mid-2015.

All contributors will be kept apprised of the book's status via Email or my blog. (http://jegrimm.wordpress.com)


What you are investing in.

Part of a career, as an author, is that you need to have more than one book idea pending. I have planned that this book will be the foundation for up to five short stories/novellas that I will then group into an anthology. These shorts will deal with situations or characters that are briefly encountered in Wall of Destruction. For example, in the preview, on my blog, you encounter Rogat.

Rogat is in the Atlantean infantry, while Risor could be considered air force. Rogat is fighting, in what is now Eastern Europe, and is also affected by the floods but in a different way. He does not play a big part in Wall of Destruction, but he will have a story of his own.

After this book and the anthology, I plan on writing another full novel on the Raman Empire, Atlantis' foe. An anthology of events from that novel, will follow as well.

A future novel and anthology could follow, if the series is really popular or I could start one of my other fantasy worlds in a series of books/anthologies.


Let's talk about Perks

I thought pretty hard on what could I do to motivate and reward those that contribute. We could have went for the little flashy light, noise makers but then I thought who would want that? Kids might, ya they would. They like flashy noise makers that drive parents crazy. Problem is kids don't normally do the contributing and most parents are not into buying things that will torture them. Relatives might do that and send it to you. But I digress.

So I thought let's try to make it something you can use or if I get lucky and become famous, you can appreciate what you have. So taking this tack, the perks graduate up to collector quality and rarity. Please realize that, at least now, my thinking is to just publish on-line. In the future, if you want a physical book, it will be on demand by you. I do not plan on making physical books which will also add to the rarity of this campaign's perks.

There is another value in this campaign and that will be the stretch goals. If the higher level perks are selected these will definitely pass the stated GOAL of the campaign. So I have made higher level stretch goals that really "spice" up the offerings. I believe these additions to the book and to the perks will further add value to this book and will go far in helping this being a successful book launch.

Stretch Goals

Hopefully not dreaming too much but figured I would show what we can do if we all work together.

1st Stretch goal:  50,000 USD

  • Will ensure the ebook is priced at $4.99. Will not go above this price for at least 2 years.

  • Will include 5 art pieces into the PLevel 5 hard copy edition. Art in black and white.

  • Will include one signed paperback for each of the PLevel 7 and above, to put away as another collectible item.

2nd Stretch goal: $85,000 USD

  • Will commission an additional 5 art pieces to be elected by the contributors at  PLevel 6.

3rd Stretch goal: $150,000 USD

  • Will have the book translated into one additional language. I will select a number of languages (between 5-10) and the contributors of PLevel 5 and above will get to vote for 3. The top one will be selected.

  • Will send eBooks of the first 2 short stories in the anthology (which will follow this novel) for free to each contributor.

  • Will include 5 art pieces in paperback book (black and white)

4th Stretch goal: $200,000 USD

  • Will include the second language in the list.

  • Will include 5 art pieces from paperback in the ebook as black and white art.

  • Will take all the art and put into an eBook with summaries for each piece. Will send this free to each contributor of PLevel 2 and above. Also publish to public for $4.99.

5th Stretch goal: $300,000 USD (Yes I know I am dreaming but why not!)

  • Art eBook will go to all contributors free.

  • Will reduce the eBook price to $3.99 for at least two years.

  • Will include an additional 3 art pieces into the paperback and 5 more into the PLevel 5 black and white edition. All selected by PLevel 9 contributors.

  • Will commission another 5 pieces of art that will go into the PLevel 6 edition and art eBook.

6th Stretch goal: $450,000 USD (Last one because it gets crazy after this)

  • Will reduce the eBook price to $3.50 for at least two years.

  • Will commission another 5 pieces of art and produce a hard back copy of the art eBook that will be a signed and numbered limited edition. Each PLevel 7 and above will get the book for free. A new perk  at $75 will be created for anyone else that wants a copy.

  • All art will go into the PLevel 5 edition in black and white

  • A signed paperback will go to all PLevel 5 and above.


Other ways you can help

Some people just can't contribute, completely understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • While I would love your contribution, I would also ask that you help me get the word out. Please tweet or post this campaign to your friends. They might wish to contribute.
  • Provide input to help keep the campaign active and moving. Add comments here or to my blog. I will create a blog entry talking about this that you can add comments to.

And that's all there is to it.

Flee for your lives!

Risor awakens to the tolling of the bells and yelling coming from the streets below. Racing to the hallway, he meets other family members and servants. Everyone is demanding to know what is going on, with servants charging off in all directions to try and get some answers. Rosan orders everyone back to dress and prepare a few changes of clothes.

Maybe the Ramans have finally decided to strike the Atlantean colonies on this side of the world. Risor quickly dressed and went down to the house courtyard below. Servants were hustling back and forth with his father directing actions. A small stack of bags and such were already gathered in the courtyard.

“What is going on father?” cried Risor.

“We do not know yet but the order is to evacuate to the hills.”

In moments, an officer of the town guard comes through the front gate with one of the servants sent to find out what is going on.

“My lords, Sub-commander Ruland. We are ordering an evacuation of the city. There is a great flood coming from the north and it will be here in one to two hours. Please gather what you can easily carry and head out the Morning Gate. It will be the quickest way to the hills.” turning to Rosan. “Elder Councilman Tarnor, Councilman Zailor advises the council should meet at Sun's Farewell bluff as soon as possible. We will maintain that as our headquarters until the crisis is over.”

“Sub-commander, what of the vailixi? I have some of my unit here.” Risor asked.

“All of the vailixi are in the air going north or to Sun's Farewell bluff as part of the command hub. I believe that means your craft as well, sir.”

Rosan put his hand on Risor's shoulder. “Son, I need you here to help me with our household.”

“I will stay father, but I need to make sure that my people are okay. Thank you sub-commander.” As the guardsman saluted and then left.

“Flood eh?” Risor remembered what Tolen said. “Father if this is related to what Tolen told us before, it could be very bad.”

“Yes he told us too. We need to get everyone moving.”

Within fifteen minutes, the family, servants and baggage was on the move. While not running, especially since it was still a long distance, the group moved quickly. Along with hundreds of other fleeing residents.

Within the city proper, the streets are well lit and it was easy to see dropped items that someone before them had second thoughts about taking. The streets were strewn with debris from those fleeing. Luckily for the Tarnors, their home opened onto one of the main thoroughfares and they quickly exited the city gate.

The road was lit for a ways but soon the city lights were no longer available. Hundreds were on the road to the hills with all manner of wagons or animals as beasts of burden. Risor would not mind having one of the aether wagons at this time, that would allow them to pretty much run along side the road a few feet off the ground. They couldn't stay on the road with all the other people but as long as the ground near the road was flat they could use that.

With only star light, the occasional torch or aether light to light their way it was pretty scary for those fleeing. They moved on pretty much in silence so they can hear when the waters are coming. The silence was broken by vailixi occasionally flying overhead with their aether lights beaming along the road. The light showed how much junk was already thrown to the sides as people feared not making it and threw their belongings away to move quicker.

Risor believes they were half way to the hills when up ahead an animal bellowed and then an aether spear shot the beast. Many of the animals near Risor's family were getting skittish, which Risor thought meant the flood is getting closer. He had heard Tolen say that animals have a sense, like those who control the use of aether, to detect when danger is coming.

When they got to where the beast was killed, they saw a group trying to remove it from the road.

“Citizens, leave it, it is to one side and there is little time. Pick up your gear and move on.” Said Rosan to the crowd.

The people didn't seem to need much convincing, they dropped their holds on the beast and moved on.

“Father, the beast will still block any larger wagons coming up the road.” Rina finally spoke, she seemed in a state of shock since leaving their home.

“Honey, any wagon that big will not move quickly with all these people in the way and if it did, it would more than likely run people over.” When she didn't say anything, he added, “Better that one wagon be left than many people harmed in the driver's attempt to reach safety.” Again no response.

......

When civilizations fall...

....

The first thing Risor wanted to do is head towards the city of Neptius. So they banked left and went along the coastline. Large sections of the coastline were washed away. Where before there was a distinct coastline with little swamp, now the coastline has become a maze of islets and vast marshes. A lot of debris was littering the coastline. This resulted in the beach no longer considered the best path for travel, any travel would have to be further inland.

As the land started to turn south,  what will become the Florida peninsula, the coastline continued to look the same. The flood was already raising sea levels in the Gulf enough to pour into low lying areas just behind the coastlines further creating barrier islands. Large sections were now underwater. It will only get worse, Risor thought.

On the other side of the peninsula, facing the Home Ocean, further south was the city of Neptius, almost the same size as Altai and older than Altai by about two thousand years. Long ages ago when the Atlanteans only had sailing ships, Neptius was their first colony. From there they discovered the rest of the smaller landmass, founded colonies or traded with the natives. There were no large kingdoms in this new world like there are in the old world.

Risor's vailixi crossed the peninsula to the Home Ocean side and then turned south. The Home Ocean coast was also wiped out from the tsunami coming from the north. Half of the beaches that used to grace the shore line were gone or covered in debris.

Near the bottom of the peninsula there was three straits that separated the mainland from two large islands; that will become Cuba and Greater Bahama. Where the three straits converged is where Neptius was founded. The city boasted a large lighthouse, largest in the world for incoming ships. The tower was larger than the temple mounts of the city, they had three; one for Poseidon, another for Zeus and the last for Athena. The land to the southwest of Neptius was a swamp while some farming was done to the north and on the islands. The port of Neptius was the busiest in the world. Smaller ships would sail to Neptius from the other colonies, including Altai, and then larger aether enabled ships would ship the freight to Atlantis or ports from the other side of the world. Aether enabled ships have been in use for the last thousand years and rarely ever sink due to the use of aether. This method of transport ensures no loss of life would occur anymore.

As they got closer to Neptius, Risor was worried. They have not received any communications from anyone at Neptius, even the aether-enabled ships and that did not bode well for the people of Neptius. As the vailixi reached the northern end of the northern strait, Risor knew what happened. The strait was not quite a strait anymore.

The Gulf connected to the Home Ocean through these straits and a tiny strait to the southwest on the other side of Cuba. With the flood and the force of water entering the Gulf it poured out these narrow paths at much higher pressure than normal. The northern end of this strait was just a sample of what high pressured flow can do to land. What was normally a twenty mile strait was now more than a hundred miles wide. The flow out of the Gulf was eating away at the Florida pennisula and the islands.

As the vailixi got closer to Neptius, from a distance Risor saw two of the temples still standing but not the other nor the lighthouse. The power of the water pouring through the straits made the water in the straits brown. Half of the city had already disappeared below the waves, the rest was smashed, apparently from the tsunami, with almost no building undamaged.

Even as Risor and team flew over them, some buildings were finally surrendering to the powerful currents that engulfed them. Falling apart to disappear beneath the waters. Large stones from the two surviving temple mounts were tumbling away. It would be only a matter of time, maybe just hours, before both temples to Poseidon and Athena were completely destroyed and joined the temple of Zeus beneath the waves. The temple mount to Poseidon still had an active Mother Stone as the blue lights of aether shown through the damaged entrance.

The Mother Stone would have been a blessing to have but it would require a few of his people to go in there to retrieve it. Reluctantly the temple mount didn't look very stable with one side already being eaten away by the water. With the debris up near the entrance, it could also be under water making the task of removal even more difficult. No, his people would have to get a Mother Stone another way.

Risor was not sure but he believed Neptius had over six hundred large buildings and covered a few square miles. Now there were only a few dozen left and debris was strewn through the streets around them or they were partially destroyed. As the vailixi came to the aeroport, they saw two vailixi smashed against a wall. Neither looked flyable. One was at the edge of the water and looked like it would slide away at any moment the other was on dry land for the moment.

Risor landed next to the dry land one while his other vailixi continued to circle the city in the vain hope to find some survivors. As Risor and Milo left the vailixi the sound of the water was deafening. Creaks and snapping sounds of the buildings was heard everywhere. They walked to the damaged craft when the smell of rotting corpses hit them. The vailixi was on its side with its top facing the wall it was pushed up against. The access ramp was partially open and as they got closer to it, they saw arm wedged under the ramp. The birds and other scavengers have not found this site yet it seems.

The slightly open access ramp was forming a nice barricade to entry with the wall. It seemed the only way for them to gain access or at least to see inside was to climb the access ramp to enter from the top.

“Milo give me a boost. I want to see inside to see if there is any chance of salvaging something from inside.”

Milo was a tough man but looked uneasy as he was looking at the almost severed arm below the ramp.

“Don't worry Milo, that poor soul won't feel a thing.” So they moved some of the debris away from the ramp so they can get close to the ramp.

“Uh, that smell is bad, I don't think there is just one here sir.”

“Probably the crew never got this far.” As Risor put his foot in Milo's clasped hands and sprung up. He grasped the edge then pulled himself up.

The smell really hit him and a flock of ravens sped past him, surprising him enough that he almost lost his handholds on the ramp. Once the flock fled, he saw what they were about. The vailixi was filled with bodies, three to four deep. All with black bloated faces and bodies. Children and adults.

Risor fell down as he gasped for air while puking his guts out. A few ravens angrily cawed from the top of the wall at the humans for interrupting their feast. A few of the braver or hungrier ones already were flying back into the doomed vailixi.

Once he could control his retching, “The Gods help us, they tried to use it to escape. Maybe thirty or forty men, women and children. I think...” As he started to retch again at the visual of their faces.

“Never mind sir, I think I know what happened.”

Milo stood up and looked back at the vailixi. Without turning, “Should we fire the insides?”

When Risor could get back to a semblance of normality, “That isn't a bad idea. Not so much for the dead, animals need to eat too, but the explosion might get any survivors to pop their head up.”

What if Atlantis existed, why did it fail?

If there was a prehistoric civilization, what would it be like? Why wouldn't we know about it? Where is the proof of its existence? 


All valid questions. We have myths talking about civilization before massive flooding. How a great catastrophe destroyed much of humanity and only a few survivors made it to carry on civilization.
We know during the Ice Age that the seas were a lot lower and that exposed lands were fertile over thousands of years of exposure. We know there was a land bridge between Asia and North America, that there was a massive landmass connecting most of Southeast Asia, that the Persian Gulf was a large river valley and that the Gulf of Mexico was a lot smaller.



Picture of Sundaland from wikipedia



Picture Gulf of Mexico from US Govt, EPA website.

What if there were cities along the coasts of these now underwater continental shelves?

Man likes to build near oceans and rivers. If there was a civilization 10,000+ BC, more than likely they would build their cities near the shoreline of 10,000+ BC, not where it is today.


Picture of Ice Age Gibraltar Straight, BBC 2001 article.


 Hello, my name is James Grimm and I am the author of the fictional tale, Wall of Destruction. Until recently, I was a long time IT network engineer working in Japan. I had always wanted to write a book but never really found the time to do it. Always something came up that stopped me. Well, for better or worse, that is no longer an issue.
Wall of Destruction, a When Atlantis Fell novel, came about from my love for ancient history and fantasy. I loved to read about ancient civilizations and imagine what it was like to live back then. Why did they build these monuments or how did they discover certain things. 
This book and the follow up series of stories will explore my imagination of how these things came about in adventure stories set at the end of Atlantis' reign. This particular one is a story about a man named Risor, a citizen of Atlantis, and how he survives the catastrophes that brought about the end of Atlantis.  
 
I want to have a successful career as a writer and I believe that presenting a well written story with eye catching artwork is my best chance. taking. The streets were strewn with debris from those fleeing.
Luckily for the Tarnors, their home opened onto one of the main
thoroughfares and they quickly exited the city gate.
	The
road was lit for a ways but soon the city lights were no longer
available.  Hundreds were on the road to the hills with all manner of
wagons or animals as beasts of burden. Risor would not mind having
one of the aether wagons at this time, that would allow them to
pretty much run along side the road a few feet off the ground. They
couldn't stay on the road with all the other people but as long as
the ground near the road was flat they could use that.
	With
only star light, the occasional torch or aether light to light their
way it was pretty scary for those fleeing. They moved on pretty much
in silence so they can hear when the waters are coming.  The silence
was broken by vailixi occasionally flying overhead with their aether
lights beaming along the road. The light showed how much junk was
already thrown to the sides as people feared not making it and threw
their belongings away to move quicker.
	Risor
believes they were half way to the hills when up ahead an animal
bellowed and then an aether spear shot the beast. Many of the animals
near Risor's family were getting skittish, which Risor thought meant
the flood is getting closer. He had heard Tolen say that animals have
a sense, like those who control the use of aether, to detect when
danger is coming.
	When
they got to where the beast was killed, they saw a group trying to
remove it from the road.
	“Citizens,
leave it, it is to one side and there is little time.  Pick up your
gear and move on.” Said Rosan to the crowd. 

	The
people didn't seem to need much convincing, they dropped their holds
on the beast and moved on.
	“Father,
the beast will still block any larger wagons coming up the road.”
Rina finally spoke, she seemed in a state of shock since leaving
their home.
	“Honey,
any wagon that big will not move quickly with all these people in the
way and if it did, it would more than likely run people over.” When
she didn't say anything, he added, “Better that one wagon be left
than many people harmed in the driver's attempt to reach safety.”
Again no response.
......
When
civilizations fall...
....
	The first thing
Risor wanted to do is head towards the city of Neptius. So they
banked left and went along the coastline. Large sections of the
coastline were washed away. Where before there was a distinct
coastline with little swamp, now the coastline has become a maze of islets and vast marshes. A lot of debris was
littering the coastline. This resulted in the beach no longer considered the best path for travel, any travel would have to be further inland.
	As the land
started to turn south,  what will become the Florida peninsula,
the coastline continued to look the same. The flood was already
raising sea levels in the Gulf enough to pour into low lying areas
just behind the coastlines further creating barrier islands. Large sections were now underwater. It will
only get worse, Risor thought. 

	On the other side
of the peninsula, facing the Home Ocean, further south was the city
of Neptius, almost the same size as Altai and older than Altai by
about two thousand years. Long ages ago when the Atlanteans only had
sailing ships, Neptius was their first colony. From there they
discovered the rest of the smaller landmass, founded colonies or
traded with the natives. There were no large kingdoms in this new
world like there are in the old world.
	Risor's vailixi
crossed the peninsula to the Home Ocean side and then turned south.
The Home Ocean coast was also wiped out from the tsunami coming from
the north. Half of the beaches that used to grace the shore line were
gone or covered in debris. 

	Near the bottom
of the peninsula there was three straits that separated the mainland
from two large islands; that will become Cuba and Greater Bahama.
Where the three straits converged is where Neptius was founded. The
city boasted a large lighthouse, largest in the world for incoming
ships. The tower was larger than the temple mounts of the city, they
had three; one for Poseidon, another for Zeus and the last for
Athena. The land to the southwest of Neptius was a swamp while some
farming was done to the north and on the islands. The port of Neptius
was the busiest in the world. Smaller ships would sail to Neptius
from the other colonies, including Altai, and then larger aether
enabled ships would ship the freight to Atlantis or ports from the
other side of the world. Aether enabled ships have been in use for
the last thousand years and rarely ever sink due to the use of
aether. This method of transport ensures no loss of life would occur
anymore.
	As they got
closer to Neptius, Risor was worried. They have not received any
communications from anyone at Neptius, even the aether-enabled ships
and that did not bode well for the people of Neptius. As the vailixi
reached the northern end of the northern strait, Risor knew what
happened. The strait was not quite a strait anymore. 

	The Gulf
connected to the Home Ocean through these straits and a tiny strait
to the southwest on the other side of Cuba. With the flood and the
force of water entering the Gulf it poured out these narrow paths at
much higher pressure than normal. The northern end of this strait was
just a sample of what high pressured flow can do to land. What was
normally a twenty mile strait was now more than a hundred miles wide.
The flow out of the Gulf was eating away at the Florida pennisula and
the islands. 

	As the vailixi
got closer to Neptius, from a distance Risor saw two of the temples
still standing but not the other nor the lighthouse. The power of the
water pouring through the straits made the water in the straits
brown. Half of the city had already disappeared below the waves, the
rest was smashed, apparently from the tsunami, with almost no
building undamaged. 

	Even as Risor and
team flew over them, some buildings were finally surrendering to the
powerful currents that engulfed them. Falling apart to disappear
beneath the waters. Large stones from the two surviving temple mounts
were tumbling away. It would be only a matter of time, maybe just
hours, before both temples to Poseidon and Athena were completely
destroyed and joined the temple of Zeus beneath the waves. The temple
mount to Poseidon still had an active Mother Stone as the blue lights
of aether shown through the damaged entrance. 

	The Mother Stone
would have been a blessing to have but it would require a few of his
people to go in there to retrieve it. Reluctantly the temple mount
didn't look very stable with one side already being eaten away by the
water. With the debris up near the entrance, it could also be under
water making the task of removal even more difficult. No, his people
would have to get a Mother Stone another way.
	Risor was not
sure but he believed Neptius had over six hundred large buildings and
covered a few square miles. Now there were only a few dozen left and
debris was strewn through the streets around them or they were
partially destroyed. As the vailixi came to the aeroport, they saw
two vailixi smashed against a wall. Neither looked flyable. One was
at the edge of the water and looked like it would slide away at any
moment the other was on dry land for the moment. 

	Risor landed next
to the dry land one while his other vailixi continued to circle the
city in the vain hope to find some survivors. As Risor and Milo left
the vailixi the sound of the water was deafening. Creaks and snapping
sounds of the buildings was heard everywhere. They walked to the
damaged craft when the smell of rotting corpses hit them. The vailixi
was on its side with its top facing the wall it was pushed up
against. The access ramp was partially open and as they got closer to
it, they saw arm wedged under the ramp. The birds and other
scavengers have not found this site yet it seems.
	The slightly open
access ramp was forming a nice barricade to entry with the wall. It
seemed the only way for them to gain access or at least to see inside
was to climb the access ramp to enter from the top. 

	“Milo give me a
boost. I want to see inside to see if there is any chance of
salvaging something from inside.”
	Milo was a tough
man but looked uneasy as he was looking at the almost severed arm
below the ramp.
	“Don't worry
Milo, that poor soul won't feel a thing.” So they moved some of the
debris away from the ramp so they can get close to the ramp. 

	“Uh, that smell
is bad, I don't think there is just one here sir.”
	“Probably the
crew never got this far.” As Risor put his foot in Milo's clasped
hands and sprung up. He grasped the edge then pulled himself up.
	The smell really
hit him and a flock of ravens sped past him, surprising him enough
that he almost lost his handholds on the ramp. Once the flock fled,
he saw what they were about. The vailixi was filled with bodies,
three to four deep. All with black bloated faces and bodies. Children
and adults.
	Risor fell down
as he gasped for air while puking his guts out. A few ravens angrily
cawed from the top of the wall at the humans for interrupting their
feast. A few of the braver or hungrier ones already were flying back
into the doomed vailixi.
	Once he could
control his retching, “The Gods help us, they tried to use it to
escape. Maybe thirty or forty men, women and children. I think...”
As he started to retch again at the visual of their faces.
	“Never mind
sir, I think I know what happened.”
	Milo stood up and
looked back at the vailixi. Without turning, “Should we fire the
insides?”
	When Risor could
get back to a semblance of normality, “That isn't a bad idea. Not
so much for the dead, animals need to eat too, but the explosion
might get any survivors to pop their head up.” 

...

story:
Story of My Book

Outside of Your Head explores a different way of looking at mental illness. This book denies the traditional idea of looking at mental illness as something that you “cure”. It recognizes that, what we view as mental illness, is a part of who you are. The focus shouldn’t be on getting rid of that part of you, but rather, it should be on how to best manage the symptoms that come out of it. This book follows my experiences with not only accepting this different view, but also embracing this disposition in a positive way. A book about mental illness and the overall human experience, Outside of Your Headproves to aim that mental illness is more than just “in your head”.

My name is Nikolina Kosanovic and I am the author of Outside of Your Head. I wrote this book because mental illness is a very near and dear topic to my heart. I’ve dealt with my diagnosis of bipolar disorder, and I’ve also seen it affect the lives of many people I love. 

My diagnosis is something that has had a lot of stigma around it, and for the longest time, I was really private about it. When I finally started opening up to people, they doubted me. They told me that I didn’t have a mental illness, I just had an attitude problem, or that I needed to be more grateful for what I had. Some people couldn’t believe that it was true because of how happy and successful I seemed to them. The worst part was that I felt like a failure for feeling like I was taking every step to cure it and always coming up short. 

When I finally realized that there was no cure, and it would always be a part of me, I felt free. I started to enjoy how the tools for managing the symptoms made me feel, rather than being disappointed by them for not meeting my expectations of curing me. This journey of reflecting on, accepting, and embracing mental illness was something I wanted to share with others in hopes of getting that weight off their shoulders. It’s a very human book that not only applies to those who are bipolar but every single one of us.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover lessons, reflections, and skills that can aid in your journey of managing your symptoms, or understanding the loved ones in your life who are affected by mental illness. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for self-development and personal growth in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you use your emotions and experiences in productive ways.

This book is broken down into 3 sections:
  • Accept - Lessons that, once accepted, can make managing your emotions easier
  • Reflect - Stories and lessons on how I tackled different themes with managing my mental illness
  • Embrace - The skills I developed from successfully managing my symptoms
You will love this book if you like slightly sarcastic candor and relatable life experiences.

Outside of Your Head is a non-fiction book that speaks to those who deal with depression, anxiety, bipolar disorder, and the people in their lives who would like to better understand them. 

 

The Book - Outside of Your Head

The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part 1- Introduction + background chapters. This part of the book is focused on defining terms, giving technical information on mental illness, and introducing my story to set up the rest of the sections.

Part 2- Accept. As mentioned, the Accept section is all based on lessons I learned about my place in this world, and how accepting them helped me change the way I framed the support systems in my life.

Part 3- Reflect.Reflect is more personal, and it deals with topics like context, anger, forgiveness, and all the different human experiences that my mental illness has been closely related to in life.

Part 4- Embrace. Embrace is the wrap-up, and it shows how the symptoms manifesting into certain behaviors have fueled a lot of my success. Symptoms suck, so it’s nice to know that we can get something out of dealing with them.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book NOW:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Nikolina Kosanovic is a Regional Strategic Communications Consultant that specializes in Employee Benefits, and she is also currently pursuing her graduate degree in Communications online with Purdue University.

Nikolina is someone who’s personally dealt with symptoms of her bipolar disorder but has felt an intense amount of stigma surrounding it, despite hiding it well. Tired of the shame and stigma, she has a passion for educating others on the idea that it’s more than just “in her head” and that it’s something that will always be a part of her. She also has a passion for helping others. She hopes that sharing her experiences of managing her symptoms and embracing the skills she’s learned can help others do the same, and help them accept even the darkest parts of their minds.

She volunteers with her alma mater mentoring first-generation college students and likes to be involved in service projects through her employer and networking organization. She is also a Guardian ad Litem for children in the dependency system. But don’t worry, she enjoys drinking and playing with her dog just as much as the rest of us do, and the mistakes and experiences she recounts in her book will show you how first impressions can be deceiving.

For more information you can connect with Nikolina at kosanovicn520@gmail.com and her instagram (@nikkatinee), Facebook (/Nikolina.kosanovic.92), and Twitter (@authornikka) accounts.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Outsideofyourhead and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nikolina Kosanovic
