story:
Get a full-length preview of The Gift of Invitation (PDF)

Get a full-length preview of Reading the Catholic Classics (PDF)

Lots of Catholic women want to deepen their knowledge of the faith and their relationship with Christ, but may not know where to start or feel they have the time.

And small, weekly faith-sharing groups need readings that are substantial in content, but short enough for members to successfully complete during or in between sessions.

That’s why Allison Gingras (of Reconciled to You and A Seeking Heart) came up with the idea for the Stay Connected series of journals for Catholic women, and teamed up with other popular Catholic bloggers and authors to produce them. Each journal in the series addresses a different path to spiritual growth. Features include:

  • An exploration of the topic through each author’s personal stories, Scripture, the teaching of the Catholic Church, the wisdom of the saints, and prompts to personal prayer and reflection.
  • Plenty of space for journal writing, so that readers can make a personal response to Christ’s invitation to a life of grace…and so that members of small faith-sharing groups can come to meetings better prepared for a great discussion.
  • Seven short chapters (between 10 and 20 pages each).
  • Beautiful graphic design by Agape Studios.

The first three journals are already in production with Gracewatch Media, which expects to release them early this fall:

  • The Gift of Invitation: 7 Ways Jesus Invites You to a Life of Grace, by Allison Gingras (Reconciled to You blog, A Seeking Heart with Allison Gingras video podcast);
  • Exploring the Catholic Classics: How Spiritual Reading Can Help You Grow in Wisdom, by Tiffany Walsh (monthly contributor at CatholicMom.com, contributing writer for The Catholic Hipster Handbook);
  • Invite the Holy Spirit into Your Life: Growing in Love, Joy, Peace, Patience, Kindness, Goodness, Faithfulness, Gentleness, and Self-Control, by Deanna G. Bartalini (DeannaBartalini.com, contributor to CatholicMom.com, Amazing Catechists, and New Evangelizers).

 

How Your Journal Pre-Order Helps

Producing high-quality books for a specialty market costs money, which is why we’re offering this opportunity to pre-order your Stay Connected journals (at a deep discount). By ordering now, you’re helping us to cover the cost of professional copy editing, graphic design, and printing. And that, in turn, will help us continue to produce the series.  But to be clear, the books you order today are in publication, and will be received by you!

 

Yes, We've Got Discounts

In return for your help, we’re happy to offer you the journals at a special discount. (Pre-ordering allows us to plan larger one-time printings, which lowers our costs compared to printing in small batches.) See the “Perks” section of our campaign for details on pre-order discounts:

  • Get single copies of any of the first three Stay Connected journals for $9...25% off the retail price.
  • Get single copies of all three of the journals, or three copies of any single title, for $25...30% off the retail price.
  • Get five copies of any of the journals for $37...38% off the retail price.
  • Or kick-start a faith-sharing group by getting ten journals for $60...50% off the retail price.

Ready to step up your support another notch? Our authors would love to join one of your small-group meetings (or meet with you individually) by live streaming video. This opportunity is only available during our pre-order crowdfunding campaign.

 

Women of Faith Can Change the World

Allison Gingras and her collaborators believe that the Stay Connected Journals for Catholic Women can make a real difference in women’s lives…because they know from personal experience how opening your heart to God changes everything.

Moreover, they believe that women who know, love, and live their faith not only strengthen the Church, but can change the world.

 

Stuff You Should Know

This crowdfunding campaign is run by Gracewatch Media, the really small Catholic publishing company behind Peanut Butter & Grace books and digital resources for Catholic families. We have a history of successful crowdfunding campaigns on IndieGoGo; you can check out our track record at our account profile.

We expect to begin shipping pre-ordered journals by September 14 (or earlier). All three journals have been copy edited and are in typesetting, and the whole project is on schedule with some wiggle room to spare, so we expect to hit that mark.

Having said that, stuff happens; we’re depending on our vendors to keep to their schedule, but unforeseen problems could affect the final ship date. As is our usual practice, we’ll keep you updated on our progress on our IndieGoGo campaign blog.

 

Please Pass It On!

If you’re enthusiastic about what we’re trying to do here, we’d really appreciate your help spreading the word to your social networks, or even to your parish staff. Check out the social sharing buttons on our campaign.

And, as always, your prayers are appreciated—not only for the success of this project, but for the hearts of the women who will be using these journals.

 

About Stay Connected #1-3

Looking for more details about the journals? They're still in production, so we don't have full-book previews yet, but you can view sample pages by clicking on the thumbnail images at the top of this story (under the main image). These are from an early design concept; expect a few details to change in the final print versions.

The books are soft cover, 6x9 inches, and will run between 120-150 pages each.

And here's the back cover copy for each of the first three journals.

 

The Gift of Invitation: 7 Ways Jesus Invites You to a Life of Grace

 

Though at times it may feel like we go through intermittent spurts of growth and focus in our spiritual life, it is daily faithfulness that results in spiritual maturity. If you’re involved in bible studies, book clubs, or faith-sharing groups with friends or members of your parish, you have to consider what you are going to do regarding your walk with Christ between the studies. In this brilliant series, Allison Gingras invites you to a more profound encounter with Jesus in those moments when there seems to be a lull in the journey. That quiet time is a particularly good time to nourish your relationship with both the Lord and your sisters in Christ, which will undoubtedly energize you to scale the next peak. You will return to your scheduled studies rejuvenated and with more to share as a result of your faithfulness while “staying connected.” This series is a blessing to all women’s faith sharing groups! Just think, your faithfulness in the offseason may end up being the key to others spiritual growth when you get back in the game.

— Kelly Wahlquist, founder of WINE: Women In the New Evangelization, author of Created to Relate: God’s Design for Peace and Joy and editor of Walk In Her Sandals: Experiencing Christ’s Passion through the Eyes of Women and Gaze Upon Jesus: Experiencing Christ Childhood through the Eyes of Women.

 

Accept Allison Gingras' invitation to journey ever deeper into the gift of Sacred Scripture and find your heart longing for more!

—Lisa M. Hendey, founder of CatholicMom.com and author of The Grace of Yes

Listen to Allison's Interview with Lisa here:  https://lisahendey.com/podcast/2018/08/06/allis...

 

You are being invited to something extraordinary, something that's truly a gift and an opportunity.

—Sarah Reinhard, editor of Word by Word: Slowing Down with the Hail Mary

 

In The Gift of Invitation, you will:

  • discover seven powerful invitations Jesus extends to you, including the invitation to follow him, forgive from your heart, and know his Father’s many gifts;
  • explore the Bible to build a closer relationship with Jesus;
  • examine how each invitation plays out in your own life;
  • reflect on how you can be better prepared to accept Jesus’ invitations.

Jesus is constantly inviting each of us to a more abundant life—but in order to receive that gift, we need to accept his invitations. In The Gift of Invitation, Allison Gingras explores Jesus’s invitation through her own story, Sacred Scripture, and the beautiful traditions of the Church. You can record your own responses to these insights right in the journal, then bring those thoughts to your small faith-sharing group for further discussion. And as with all the Stay Connected journals, guided prayers and space to journal what is on your heart helps you forge a deeper, living connection with Jesus.

Allison Gingras is the founder of the blog ReconciledToYou.com, as well as a Catholic author, speaker, retreat leader, and media geek—with a very unique, practical, and humorous way of sharing a grace-filled Catholic life with Christ. Her podcast video series, A Seeking Heart with Allison Gingras, discusses faith in the context of everyday, ordinary life. Allison facilitates social media for WINE: Women in the New Evangelization, including the WINE Online Book Club; she also contributes to CatholicMom.com. Allison is the creator and series editor of the Stay Connected Journals for Catholic Women.

 

Exploring the Catholic Classics: How Spiritual Reading Can Help You Grow in Wisdom

This easy to follow but rich introduction to the spiritual classics encourages me to go deeper with my spiritual reading. Informative, insightful, and definitely a must-read!

—Maria Morera Johnson, author of My Badass Book of Saints: Courageous Women Who Taught Me How to Live and Super Girls and Halos: My Companions on the Quest for Truth, Justice, and Heroic Virtue

 

Tiffany Walsh has written a faith study that, drawing on the great figures of our faith, is filled with tremendous wisdom. It is a brief and deceptively simple text, containing elements in each section that gave me cause for deep introspection. I wholeheartedly endorse this short book!

—Fr. Darryl Millette, saskapriest.com

 

Tiffany Walsh presents an opportunity to be gently introduced to the sustainability of the “big classics,” exploring how these saints’ writings remain relatable to 21st century women today.

— Shelly Henley Kelly, Catholic blogger at Of Sound Mind and Spirit

 

In Exploring the Catholic Classics, you will:

  • learn about seven inspiring historical and modern works of Catholic literature;
  • read selected passages from the writings of St. Thérèse of Lisieux, Pope St. John Paul II; St. Francis de Sales, Thomas á Kempis, and more;
  • study these spiritual works in light of the Scriptures;
  • reflect on significant spiritual themes and chronicle your own thoughts and experiences;
  • apply the wisdom of these spiritual writers to your own life.

The Catholic classics are full of wisdom, advice, and inspiration to enrich the lives of modern women, and Exploring the Catholic Classics is a great way to access that wisdom and apply it to your life. Tiffany Walsh introduces readers to carefully selected excerpts from each spiritual classic and offers her own insights before inviting you to respond to reflection prompts. You can record your responses right in the journal, then bring those thoughts to your small faith-sharing group for further discussion. And as with all the Stay Connected journals, guided prayers and space to journal your own prayer helps you forge a deeper, living connection with Jesus.

 

Tiffany Walsh is a wife, the mother of two children, and a college librarian with a background in law. She is a cradle Catholic who rekindled her childhood faith as a law student in New York City via her love of books and rediscovery of daily Mass. She writes monthly for CatholicMom.com, and she also contributed to The Catholic Hipster Handbook, published in 2017 by Ave Maria Press. She hosts book clubs and offers weekly musings over at lifeofacatholiclibrarian.com.

 

Invite the Holy Spirit into Your Life: Growing in Love, Joy, Peace, Patience, Kindness, Goodness, Faithfulness, Gentleness, and Self-Control

This powerful study will help you open your heart to what the Holy Spirit can do in your life, and how you can share the Fruits of the Spirit with those around you.

—Barb Szyszkiewicz, editor, CatholicMom.com

 

Through her own vulnerabilities and candid witness, Deanna Bartalini shows us that growth in virtue and the cultivation of the fruits of the Spirit is a life-long work. Wherever you are today, this study will help you connect with God in prayer, and dive into his Word, so that the little lessons of the Spirit, and even the not-so-little ones, may take root and flourish in you.

—Pat Gohn, author of All In: Why Belonging to the Catholic Church Matters and Bodacious: Celebrating the Gift of Catholic Womanhood

 

In Invite the Holy Spirit into Your Life, you will:

  • learn how the Holy Spirit can change your life through the fruits of love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control;
  • explore the fruits of the Spirit through real-life stories, examples from the Old and New Testaments, and the wisdom of the Church;
  • examine how you are cultivating the fruits of the Spirit in your own life.

 

“The fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, generosity, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control,” St. Paul wrote to the Galatians. “If we live by the Spirit, let us also be guided by the Spirit” (Galatians 5:22–23, 25). Those words are just as relevant and powerful for you today as they were for the Galatians. In Invite the Holy Spirit into Your Life, Deanna G. Bartalini draws on her own story, sacred Scripture, the lives of the saints, and the wisdom of the Church to explore how to grow in each of the fruits of the Spirit. You can record your own insights right in the journal, then bring those thoughts to your small faith-sharing group for further discussion. And as with all the Stay Connected journals, guided prayers and space to journal your own prayer helps you forge a deeper, living connection with Jesus.

 

Deanna G. Bartalini, M.Ed.; M.P.A., is a Catholic writer, speaker, presenter, and educator. She and her husband, Deacon John Bartalini, have two married children. Deanna loves teaching about Catholicism and how it fits into our daily lives. She writes at DeannaBartalini.com and contributes to CatholicMom.com, AmazingCatechists.com, and NewEvangelizers.com. She also contributed to A Catholic Mom's Prayer Companion, published by Ave Maria Press.

¿Qué?

Los asesinatos de la Ruta 40 es una clara muestra de que lo mejor del género negro no es necesariamente nórdico.

San Juan, Argentina, 1980. El comisario Domínguez y el sargento Benítez pertenecen a la Policía de la provincia y encuentran a los miembros de una familia cruelmente asesinados: a quemarropa y con armas de guerra. Los casquillos hallados en la escena del crimen demuestran que se han utilizado fusiles del ejército argentino. A partir de este momento, comenzará una investigación para comprobar si realmente un miembro de esa institución perpetró esta canallada. Al poco tiempo, se incorpora para trabajar en esta pesquisa un miembro de la Policía Federal: el teniente Gustavo Gómez. 

Lo tres hombres tienen personalidades distintas y deben tratar de complementarse, pero es difícil. Domínguez es un funcionario muy capaz y el sargento Benítez es un minucioso investigador dedicado en cuerpo y alma a su trabajo, que no deja ningún detalle al azar. Sin embargo, Gómez es diferente, es un antiguo combatiente contra los insurgentes marxistas acostumbrado a emplear métodos violentos en la resolución de los casos. Por si esto fuera poco, es un vividor que no pierde ninguna oportunidad para pasarlo bien, aunque esto conlleve no cumplir las normas.

Los asesinatos continúan y la presión por resolver el caso se intensifica. Los principales sospechosos son cuatro hombres que, según un testigo, andan juntos y parecen un grupo de profesionales. ¿Tal vez militares, policías o sediciosos? La cacería progresa y poco a poco se obtienen resultados; empiezan a conocer quiénes son esos tipos. Aquí aparecen las contradicciones y las dudas: ¿para quién trabajan? ¿Qué buscan?

Una historia que perdura en el tiempo y años más tarde el abogado Matías Gutiérrez retoma la investigación y todavía se encuentra con puntos oscuros que intentará aclarar. Un caso que siempre choca de frente y con violencia contra las cuestiones políticas del país. ¿Se podrá resolver? En la Argentina las cosas nunca son como parecen.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Sabino Ardura.

Nacido en Buenos Aires, Argentina, en 1964, es Contador Público Nacional por la Universidad de la ciudad de Buenos Aires y este título ha sido convalidado al de Licenciado en Ciencias Económicas rama Empresariales por el Ministerio de Educación del Reino de España.

Su actividad profesional estuvo vinculada en una primera etapa a su profesión, trabajando en las empresas: Arthur Andersen, Corporación Gesser y Grupo Centunión. En 1997 inició su actividad como empresario hostelero, siendo actualmente miembro del Consejo de Administración de las sociedades: El Virrey de San Telmo S.L., Saguianca S.L. y Maynas Montesinos S.L.

Aficionado a la lectura de novela negra y también de la historia, También comenzó a escribir sobre estos mismos temas. Está trabajando actualmente con la publicación de un Blog sobre asuntos históricos. Esta es la primera novela que publica. Está participando actualmente en certámenes literarios con otra de sus novelas: El único testigo de mi gran pecado.  

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«―Mire, le voy a contar algo que a mí siempre me extrañó mucho, teóricamente esos grupos insurgentes estaban apoyados por el marxismo internacional, concretamente siempre se dijo que por Cuba ―explicó un reflexivo Gentiletti―. No lo voy a discutir, pero yo comprobé que las armas que utilizaban no eran soviéticas, sino estadounidenses. Ni siquiera las armas de guerra que utilizaron en Tucumán y convengamos que había armas rusas muy fiables, por ejemplo, el AK 47. Nuestros jefes nos dijeron que era así porque las obtenían en el mercado negro internacional.
          ―¡Claro ese era el motivo! ―afirmé muy convencido.
          ―Yo lo dudo ―dijo Gentiletti.
          Me sorprendió por el tono de su voz y por su mirada, tenía una mezcla extraña de decepción, amargura y abatimiento difícil de describir. A mí me dejó de piedra, lo contemplé sin saber qué decirle.
          ―No discuto de que las hayan comprado a traficantes de armas internacionales ―continuó Gentiletti―, además yo sé que en ese tipo de mercados los intermediarios se multiplican exponencialmente con el objeto de dificultar que la Policía y los servicios secretos sigan su rastro, sin embargo, ¿puede ser qué una compra de tal cantidad de armas norteamericanas se haya realizado sin el visto bueno de los Servicio Secretos de ese mismo país?
          Ahora sí, que no supe qué decirle, creo que me había quedado hasta sin voz. Él tampoco me dijo nada y comenzó un silencio inquietante.
          ―Por favor, vaya al meollo de la cuestión ―de repente le rogué.
          ―Le voy a decir lo que creo: fue todo un vil arreglo de gente de mucho poder, que no vivían en Rusia ni en Cuba ―explicó Gentiletti―. Seguramente eran élites financieras y armamentísticas de alguna potencia occidental, que hicieron un gran negocio con un enfrentamiento bélico en nuestro país. Estos desalmados propiciaron un levantamiento armado de izquierdas y les vendieron armas. No solo los grupos terroristas gastaron un dineral en pertrechos bélicos, sino que también lo hicieron las fuerzas de seguridad y, por supuesto, esos mismos asquerosos fueron los que armaron a todos. Sí, amigo, mandaron a morir a jóvenes idealistas para ganar dinero y los Servicios Secretos Americanos estaban al tanto. Luego el gobierno de Estados Unidos entrenó a nuestras fuerzas represoras en la Escuela de las Américas en Panamá para vencer a los movimientos terroristas y les vendieron armas mucho más efectivas para lograr ese objetivo. ¡Imagine el negocio financiero y bélico! ¡Descomunal! Por eso les conviene a esos poderosos de que solo se hable de la represión, ya que si se hablase de la guerra y algún husmeador investigase y averiguase algo, se destaparía un asunto de un calado tan importante que no sé si el propio sistema lo resistiría.    
          No era una cuestión descabellada, las guerras siempre fueron un gran negocio para los banqueros internacionales que se enriquecieron financiando a los dos bandos de casi todos los enfrentamientos bélicos. Si Gentiletti tenía razón, al final los tipos como Sanguinetti también estaban engañados por los que movían los hilos de ese espectáculo de titiriteros que era la política internacional.»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 960€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Los asesinatos de la Ruta 40 que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Sabino Ardura vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

Al poco tiempo, se incorpora para trabajar en esta pesquisa un miembro de la Policía Federal: el teniente Gustavo Gómez.

story:
{The Story}

Hello, my name is Maria Gomez. I'm the author of Gramita's Tortillas. This story is near and dear to my heart because not only is Gramita based on my own grandmother, but the story also demonstrates the love of a Gramita.

I grew up in Santa Rosa, NM where I enjoyed the simple pleasures of small town life - family, community, and the outdoors. After graduating from Santa Rosa High School, I moved to Albuquerque and received my bachelor’s degree from The University of New Mexico.

I majored in Journalism and Mass Communication with a concentration in Multimedia Journalism. Wanting to explore more creative writing lead me to publish my first short story with the guidance of Plot Duckies.    

For this project, I'm fortunate enough to be working with Plot Duckies, to make my story come to life as an illustrated children's book. Also, Alexa Verardo will be our illustrator for this project. With this project, I'm asking for your support to help offset the cost of our illustrator and cost of color printing  and I have plenty of cool incentives in return for your donations. 

Once the campaign is complete, all rewards will ship by December 2020. Shipping times may vary due to COVID-19, but we're focused on having everything ready for you for the perfect Christmas gift.

 

❤️ ♥️  ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ 

{About Alexa Verardo, the Artist}

Alexa Verardo is a freelance graphic designer and illustrator in Albuquerque, New Mexico.  Before she made the jump into freelancing, she worked as a chalkboard artist and graphic designer for Whole Foods Market for more than 14 years. She specializes in unique, thoughtful, eye-catching, and playful design and illustration.

Here are some examples of Alexa's work! And, she did the beautiful cover for the book.

 

❤️ ♥️  ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ 

{What We Need & What You Get}

With $2,500 we can pay our illustrator for her hard work (she's already done a beautiful job on the cover!), and get the books printed and shipped.

The rewards Include the Following:

· A 68 page soft bound or hard cover edition in both English and Spanish, perfect for ages 6-10.

· A downloadable e-book version of the book.

· An option to have your name or your child's name printed at the front of the book.

· A fun sticker.

 

These books will be ready in December, so they'll be perfect for gift giving!

 

And, if you're in Albuquerque we'll have a special event at El Vado where I will hand out books and Plot Duckies will have free coffee and hot chocolate on hand. Date TBD.

We've raised $3,300 thanks to you! That means Plot Duckies will include all the extra perks! Two coloring sheets (black and white images from the book), a fun die cut sticker, and a complete coloring book version in with all physical book orders!

And! We're leaving the campaign open to inDemand. Any orders made after Nov 16 will be shipped in late December or early January.

❤️ ♥️  ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️

{Plot Duckies}

 

Sonja Dewing is an award-winning creative writer, published author, and CEO of Plot Duckies. She started the company because she saw the need to help women publish their stories with strong female characters and also help women of color reach their publishing goals for their amazing stories. 

 

❤️ ♥️  ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ 

The Impact

We are publishing this book in both Spanish and English, which creates a bigger impact than English alone. This book will connect with Moms and Dads of both languages and help us connect all our children to language and reading.  

The University of Arizona also says that a "benefit of bilingual books is that they can be shared in families where the parents may speak only one language while the child is learning English as a second language. Children who speak only English can learn about different languages and can pick up words in other languages by reading bilingual books."

This story is also important too as a heart warming connection with family.

 

❤️ ♥️  ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ 

Risks & Challenges

There are a few risks, but I know that as a team (myself, Alexa, Sonja, and Casey) we can overcome these risks and get you a beautifully finished book. 

Plot Duckies has fronted the first payment to Alexa so she can get to work and they've published many times before, so I know this book will happen.

 

❤️ ♥️  ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ ♥️ ❤️ 

Other Ways You Can Help

I, along with Plot Duckies, understand that not everyone can contribute during these trying times, but if you would be willing to do one or more of the following we would be elated.

  • If you know of someone who would be willing to buy a book please share this link with them
  • If you would share our campaign on any social media outlets you are apart of
  • If you would be willing to spread this campaign by word of mouth to friends and family members.

We would be grateful! And thanks for sharing.

story:
What is Perspektif Magazine?

Perspektif Magazine is a non-profit, free, student-run print publication that aims to showcase young Indonesian talents, ideas, and initiatives and stories. This is achieved through the production of a visually appealing, intellectually engaging, and thought-provoking magazine. The magazine addresses a wide range of topics related to arts, culture, education, lifestyle, politics, business, and economics. It features contributions from artists, photographers, authors, and designers from across the globe.

Perspektif is the Indonesian word for 'perspective', and it represents our aim: to act as a platform by which students can engage a wide audience by sharing their perspectives on contemporary issues.

 

 

Who Are We?

Although initially founded by members of Melbourne University's Indonesian Students Society, we seek to be inclusive. Perspektif can be read and enjoyed by everyone.  Our committee and contributors consist primarily of students from different backgrounds who specialize in writing, designing, editing and publishing, and includes students and non-students alike.

 

 

Your Perspektif

Our contributors are based all over the world, and range from experienced writers to students who have never written for a publication before. We want to feature new and emerging talents in writing, art, and design a platform to showcase their work.

Perspektif Magazine is a free magazine that everyone can enjoy - and we'd like to keep it that way. We want to get fresh and engaging content out there and into people's hands - not just in their digitalized screens.

So far, Perspektif Magazine is mainly distributed around the University of Melbourne campus, Indonesian Students' Society events, and around Melbourne and Jakarta's cafes and coffee shops. With each volume, there are individuals who have shown interest in Perspektif Magazine but could not receive a copy, due to the limited number of copies we are able to print for each volume.  

Why Do We Need Your Support?

We print 500 copies of every volume, which launches at the start of each semester. Since we are a free magazine, we rely on sponsors and advertisers to generate enough funds to send our magazine for printing.

Our challenge is that some advertisers do not want to buy advertising spaces unless we print (way) more than 500 copies. Unfortunately, we cannot do that unless we get more funding, and that becomes a chicken-and-the-egg situation for us as a small and relatively new magazine.

What we want to do is eventually break that threshold - we want to get Perspektif Magazine out there and into the right hands. With increased awareness, our hope is that more people will support our vision. But most importantly, we want to be sustainable. 

 

Where Will Your Money Go?

Your money will go directly into the costs of production and printing. However, if we reach over the initial target, your generous outpouring of support would give us the chance for a broader growth and sustainable development in the future to create a better magazine, and gather and showcase more young Indonesian talents.

For instance, if we exceed 100 AUD than the initial target money, we would be able to improve the printing quality and further accessibility to the magazine. Exceeding 200 AUD would further improve future sustainability as we have more funds for printing, overall magazine content, and the possibility of lowering costs for subscription. Exceeding 300-500 AUD will allow us to develop our website further and possibly set up an online store where small merchandises are sold.

 

Other Ways You Can Help Us

We greatly appreciate any kind of support, so whether you decide to pledge, or share this project and spread the word to everyone, it would be a significant help for us. Follow and share our social media to help us spread young talents and ideas to everybody, and you might discover new perspective.

Don't forget to keep your eyes peeled for Perspektif Magazine launch party. We've got plenty of surprises and are looking forward to see you there.

 

Thank you!

The Perspektif Team

story:
Story of Unglamored

Unglamored is about a Chinese-American singer who struggles secretly with an eating disorder in an industry that demands perfection and glorifies thinness.

My name is Jessie Cheng, and I am the author of Unglamored, a Young Adult novel. I wrote this novel to shine light on mental health, especially eating disorders, within the entertainment industry and to create an emotional connection between us and those in the public eye.

In reading this novel, my hope is that you will discover the strength and freedom that vulnerability brings. Though fictional, many of this story’s scenes and interactions reflect true, ongoing experiences. I’m excited for you to meet my protagonist, and, by extension, me.

75% of all proceeds above my campaign goal  ($6,000 for a hardcover book) will be donated to Project Heal & Asian Mental Health Collective.

  • Project Heal: an organization dedicated to eliminating financial & social barriers to eating disorder treatment, especially within minority/marginalized communities
  • Asian Mental Health Collective: an organization that actively addresses hate crimes against Asians/Asian-Americans and provides reduced-fee therapy & support to the Asian community

Customized sticker packs and bookmarks are designed by Madeline, the owner of Notebeans Stationery (@notebeansstationery). 70% of all Notebeans Stationery profits are donated to Global Giving. 

Nineteen-year-old Rose B.D. is the nation’s top star, a famous Chinese-American singer who appears to have it all: a large fan base, a glamorous career in Shanghai, the perfect body. But behind the camera is a girl the public does not recognize, a girl who fights daily with the monsters in her head. Join Rose B.D. as she navigates the pressures of celebrity life, experiencing love, friendship, betrayal, and everything in between.

You will love this book if you are passionate about mental health and music, enjoy romance novels, and want to meet characters undergoing relatable experiences. Ultimately, I hope that Unglamored inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into questions like:

  • How can I experience healing through vulnerability and authenticity?
  • How does society promote the thinness ideal and affect one’s mental health?
  • Why is mental health neglect the norm for those in the public eye?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing mental health, eating disorders, and authenticity will change us all for the better. 

What I Need & What You Get!

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my book cover.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About The Author

Jessie Cheng celebrates music, knowledge, and creative storytelling. She wants to work in Shanghai one day to promote music, a vehicle she believes builds a culture of empathy and connection where division currently exists. She enjoys putting on her own 1-person concerts at 2 AM, is obsessed with Avatar, and loves the color rose gold. 

Jessie wrote Unglamored because she loves people, and she believes that celebrities must be treated as human beings, not commodities. She has poured her heart into this novel, and she hopes it creates a lasting positive impact on your life. 

For more information, you can connect with Jessie at chengxy@bc.edu and follow @unglamored on Instagram. 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #unglamored and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support! :)

Sincerely,

Jessie Cheng

story:
What Is "Bye Bye, Billionaires"?

Bye Bye Billionaires is an illustrated book about capitalism, and what's wrong with capitalism. It is written in plain language so readers of any age or background can understand it.

In the book, readers learn about the tremendous wealth inequality in the world, and how it came to be. Understand capital, profit, labor and exploitation, the free market, the attention economy, and disaster capitalism . Understand how capitalism isn't the only way to do business, or to live, and learn about some alternatives.

Bye Bye Billionaires is written and illustrated by Heydon Pickering, a designer and technical writer. Heydon studied art, and his reading critical theory and semiotics informed his work. Since then he became a designer and coder for the web, specializing in web accessibility: making web interfaces usable for people with disabilities.

What Needs Funding?

Bye Bye Billionaires is intended as a print book. I want it to be a high quality production: full color, perfect binding, heavy grade paper. Funding will pay for the following:

  • Editing and proof-reading using a professional editor
  • Purchase of ISBN number
  • Formatting and submission to a print-on-demand service (including ebook production where available)
  • Multiple bulk print runs (100 books is approximately £500) for sale, as well as gifting to book clubs, schools, libraries, etc.
  • Creation of stickers, and other promotional materials and gifts

Why?

There are two kinds of information around capitalism:

  • Misleading information, typically stemming from those who benefit from capitalism (capitalists!) and their spokespeople
  • Overcomplex information, which is aimed at adults versed in philosophy, critical theory, or the nitty gritty of economic theories

Capitalism, and the problems with it, are actually fairly easy to grasp. So are the alternatives to capitalism. I wanted to put all of this in one, easy to digest book. Bye Bye Billionaires is designed to help you, your friends, and your kids be questioning and critical about the world we live in, and one of the biggest parts of how it works (or doesn't work!).

How else can I help?

Aside from funding, it would be great if you could help get the word out. I am also available for interviews/podcast episodes if you think it's something your audience would like to hear about.

story:
Passer du monde virtuel au monde réel

À la fin avril le Collectif Subvercité a lancé RTCGratuit, une campagne pour la gratuité du transport en commun. La campagne a eu un bon succès sur Internet : plus de 5000 pages vues sur le site web, 1 200 likes sur la page Facebook. Cela a amené une certaine visibilité et des mentions dans plusieurs journaux (Le Soleil, le Journal de Québec, Droit de parole, etc.).

L'ennui c'est que maintenant, après ce «boom!» initial, nous n'avons plus d'argent pour la suite de la campagne et, en particulier, pour bien préparer la rentrée. Nous avons du matériel d'information qui ne demande qu'à être diffusé dans nos quartiers et sur les campus. Dépliants, affiches, autocollants sont prêts, il ne manque que les fonds...


Premier objectif : 10 000 autocollants

Deuxième objectif : 500 affiches couleurs


Afin de profiter au maximum des possibilités offertes par le sociofinancement, nous avions convenus, lors du lancement de la campagne, d'adopter des objectifs modestes. Nous demandions à notre réseau de nous aider à trouver 500$ pour imprimer un premier tirage d'au moins 10 000 autocollants et 500$ pour imprimer un premier tirage d'au moins 500 affiches en couleur.

Ces deux premier objectifs sont maintenant atteint! Tout l'argent récolté en plus servira à imprimer et diffuser du matériel d'information. Voici ce que nous allons faire si nous récoltons plus d'argent :

  • 500$ et + (1500$ en tout) = > on ajoute 5000 dépliants (en cours)


Prototypes d'autocollants (ça peut s'améliorer)


Des tarifs qui nous révoltent

(texte du dépliant que nous voulons éventuellement imprimer)


Un bon système de transport en commun n’est pas un privilège, c’est un droit qui découle du droit à la mobilité. Toutes les personnes doivent pouvoir se déplacer dans la ville selon leurs besoins, entre autres pour avoir accès au travail et aux services, peu importe leurs moyens. Le développement de la ville autour de l’automobile a rendu la mobilité dépendante d’un bien de consommation particulièrement coûteux. Un transport en commun accessible est un élément clé de la liberté de circulation.

Le RTC est un service public dont la mission est de «permettre aux citoyens de mieux vivre la ville par un transport collectif de qualité, au meilleur coût pour la collectivité ». La seule façon de remplir pleinement cette mission de façon juste et équitable est d’abolir toute tarification et d’opter pour la gratuité du transport en commun. 

Lire la suite sur notre site de campagne

  • Pourquoi la gratuité du transport en commun?
  • Comment réaliser la gratuité?
  • Pour s'impliquer

  Modèles d'affiches

Voici quelques modèles d'affiches sur lesquels nous travaillons. Il s'agit évidemment d'affiche en papier sur lesquels serait imprimé les designs ci-dessous (et non de vrai panneaux de métal).



Prototypes d'affiches (ça peut s'améliorer).

Dépliants, affiches, autocollants sont prêts, il ne manque que les fonds...Premier objectif : 10 000 autocollantsDeuxième objectif : 500 affiches couleurs
Afin de profiter au maximum des
 possibilités offertes par le sociofinancement, nous avions convenus, lors du lancement de la campagne, 
d'adopter des objectifs modestes. Nous demandions à notre réseau de nous 
aider à trouver 500$ pour imprimer un premier tirage d'au moins 10 000 autocollants et 500$ pour imprimer un premier tirage d'au moins 500 affiches en couleur. Ces deux premier objectifs sont maintenant atteint! Tout l'argent récolté en plus servira à imprimer et diffuser du matériel d'information. Voici ce que nous allons faire si nous récoltons plus d'argent :500$ et + (1500$ en tout) = > on ajoute 5000 dépliants (en cours)
Prototypes d'autocollants (ça peut s'améliorer)Des tarifs qui nous révoltent
(texte du dépliant que nous voulons éventuellement imprimer)Un bon système de transport en commun n’est pas un privilège, c’est un 
droit qui découle du droit à la mobilité. Toutes les personnes doivent 
pouvoir se déplacer dans la ville selon leurs besoins, entre autres pour
 avoir accès au travail et aux services, peu importe leurs moyens. Le 
développement de la ville autour de l’automobile a rendu la mobilité 
dépendante d’un bien de consommation particulièrement coûteux.  Un 
transport en commun accessible est un élément clé de la liberté de 
circulation.

Le RTC est un service public dont la mission est de «permettre aux 
citoyens de mieux vivre la ville par un transport collectif de qualité, 
au meilleur coût pour la collectivité ». La seule façon de remplir 
pleinement cette mission de façon juste et équitable est d’abolir toute 
tarification et d’opter pour la gratuité du transport en commun. Lire la suite sur notre site de campagne

Pourquoi la gratuité du transport en commun?

Comment réaliser la gratuité? 
Pour s'impliquer 
 
Modèles d'affiches
Voici quelques modèles d'affiches sur lesquels nous travaillons. Il s'agit évidemment d'affiche en papier sur lesquels serait imprimé les designs ci-dessous (et non de vrai panneaux de métal).
Prototypes d'affiches (ça peut s'améliorer).

story:
Everyone Dreams at Night

But how do you become a skillful dreamer?  Not only remembering your dreams, but working with them and interacting with them.  Dreams are living things that respond to your attention, and my book tells you how to work with your dreams to get answers to questions, retrieve lost memories, get artistic inspiration, and more.

The technique of asking your dreams questions and getting an answer is called Dream Seeding, and this book is a poetic and lyrical instruction manual on how to achieve this skill.  I discuss the seven basic types of dreams, and share my experience of forty years of dreamwork on how to interact with your dreams and develop your skill in manipulating them.

An Artfully Made Book

There are many books out there on working with your dreams.  What makes my book unique is that it is made by a visual artist.  Besides being lavishly illustrated, it is a heavily designed book, made to look like a 17th century alchemical folio.  Oneirognosis is also written in an "antique" 19th century voice. This book was born out of an earlier project, Antarctica Dream-Dollars, and is written in the voices of two of the characters in the story. Filled with poetry and lyrical prose, this is a deep dive into an exploration not only of dreams, but of perception, reality, and the spiritual and material world.  Plus, I have researched symbolism and iconography for several decades, and I incorporate that knowledge into both the text and illustrations.  A lifelong artist, my work has been in over 70 exhibitions in galleries and museums around the world, and is in private collections in fifty countries. 

Here's a sample page.  More page images and illustrations are found in the Gallery above.
Oneirognosis, a Greek word for "dream knowledge."   The book will be around 6 x 6" square, hardbound, with a simple, black hard cover with silver foil stamp.  There are 120 pages and 25 illustrations, four of which are on this page.  The typefaces are a combination of several antique and distressed fonts.  Oneirognosis will be beautiful to look at and densely packed with iconography, symbolism and wisdom.  Be sure to check out the Gallery above for more images of illustrations and page layouts.

This is my second book.  My first book, called Capital Offenses was a book of political satire.  It is a very different subject, but it shows that I can complete projects like this and get them out into the world.  Additionally, Capital Offenses was named one of the Best Books of 2014 by Publishers Weekly, showing that I am a good author, designer and publisher.  Please help me to make a bigger splash with this book!



Down to Business

Oneirognosis is completely written, illustrated, and laid-out.  I am just putting the final touches on it.  The book will be ready to send to the printer as soon as this funding campaign is finished.

The basic financial goal is to get 250 hardbound books printed and shipped from my printer in Canada.  If I go over my goal, that money will help with placing ads and promoting the book.  The printing costs are low enough for me to sell it wholesale in stores, so I will be seeking distribution and in-store placement, which is key to a successful book.  The more money I raise, the more books I can print, and the better I can promote it!

Risks & Challenges

Oneirognosis will be published in 2015 no matter what, so there is no risk.  This is my second book, I have a successful track record of making a book happen and getting it out there.  The biggest challenge will be promotion, so raising money over and above the goal amount is very important.

Perk: Dream-Tokens

                     
These are the Dream-Tokens I designed a few years ago.  They are solid brass coins designed to help you learn the art of lucid dreaming.  One side of the coin reminds you to always ask yourself, "Am I dreaming?"  This is the best way to become a lucid dreamer, because if you develop a habit of constantly questioning your waking state, that habit will carry over into the dreaming state, and you will begin to ask that question while dreaming.  Soon, the answer to your question will be a "Yes!"

The other side of the coin reminds you to look at your hand within the dream to confirm your lucid state.  This technique was first popularized by Carlos Castaneda in his dream research and books.  For some reason, when you look at your hand, or any other part of your dream body, you will know that you are dreaming.  Dream-Tokens are a powerful tool in acquiring this elusive ability.

Perk: Dream-Dollars

                        

Oneirognosis was born out of a previous project of mine, Antarctica Dream-Dollars, which was the story of a 19th century utopian colony in Antarctica that worked with dreams as a community.  In that colony, they used specially designed currency, called Dream-Dollars, to help them dream more effectively.  These are some of their Dream-Dollars.  This Sampler Set contains eight currency notes, one from each of the denominations: 1, 4, 7, 13, 28, 52, 91, and 365 dollars, randomly chosen by me.  This perk is for all you Nadiria fans out there!

To find out more about Dream-Dollars and the entire story of the Lost Colony of Antarctica, please go to my site: Moneyart.biz

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give money, that's OK.  Please share this campaign to all your friends who are dreamers and doing serious dreamwork.  Use your facebook page, or spread the word on Twitter using the tag #Oneirognosis.  Your help will be greatly appreciated!

Go to stephenbarnwell.com to see all my work.

story:
Thru-Hiking Will Break Your Goddam Heart

Hello! I'm Carrot Quinn. You're probably here because you binge-read my blog posts from my PCT thru-hike last year, and you're excited about the book. I'm excited about the book too! I'm currently querying literary agents about it, in a possibly misguided attempt to get a traditional publishing contract. In the meantime I'm going to hike the PCT again, starting May 1st! And so I'm selling pre-orders of my book, called Thru-Hiking Will Break Your Heart, here, in order to make this possible.

But why would you want to hike the PCT again? 

The Pacific Crest Trail is my current singular creative obsession. Don't worry, I want to hike other trails too- Spark, Instigate and I have plans to hike the CDT in 2015. But this year I want to hike the PCT again, in order to re-immerse myself in the world that, as a narrative non-fiction writer, I'm currently so focused on. I want to gain an even deeper understanding of the trail- of its people, landscapes, history, and culture. Of the things that make it so different from anything else, anywhere.  

Basically, I want to hike the trail again, and in order to make that possible I'm selling my book at a steep discount. (The e-book is only one dollar!) Everybody wins!!

How will your hike be different this time?

I'm starting later and hiking faster; my goal is to finish in four months instead of five. I'm now an experienced thru-hiker, and I've been training this time. I won't be blogging in the same fashion as my last hike. I will, however, be documenting the hike in some as yet to be decided upon capacity. Photos of my dinner, haikus, something like that.

But why do I want you to hike the PCT again?

Because you're curious about how I'll document the trail this time. Because you're a nice person. Because you actually don't care, you just want to pre-order a signed copy of the book.

When will your book be out?

That's a good question. Right now I'm playing the waiting game. If I can't get a traditional publishing contract after a certain period of time, I'll hire an editor and cover designer and publish it myself. I know enough about that business from my experience with kindle publishing that I'm confident I can do a good job. Whatever happens, I'll keep you updated as things progress!

How can you sell copies of a book that hasn't been published yet?

Because it's the future. And because you believe in me!

You already owe me a copy of your book.

That's right! No need to order another one, you'll still get your copy. Please don't break my legs.

Where Does The Money Go And What Exactly Are You Selling?

  • The money I raise will pay for my flight to San Diego, my food on the trail, and my phone bill if there's anything left over.
  • I'm offering signed copies of the book for $15! That's less than the cover price will be once it's published! And the e-book is only ONE DOLLAR- that's basically free!
  • I'm also offering postcards from the trail and homemade raw chocolates, if you're into that kind of thing.

THANK YOU!!!

story:
Hello, I am Alan Brown – in less than 100 days I could be elected as an SNP MP in the Kilmarnock and Loudoun area.

I was born August 12th in 1970 to Eric and Irene, and until 2007 I had stayed in Newmilns (in my constituency) my whole life. Since then, I’ve lived a bit further afield – in Galston, just three miles down the road.

An SNP voter all my life, and a member since the 90’s, I could not be more proud of the route my party has taken in the last few years.

I was elected as a councillor in the May 2007 elections which brought about the area’s first SNP-led council and the area’s first SNP MSP in Willie Coffey.

Since my election, I have served on numerous committees and was the Spokesperson for Planning in my first term, and have since been moved into the Cabinet on this term. It is having this considerable wealth of political experience at a relatively young age that makes me a good candidate for the area. That, and the fact I stand with the party that opposes Trident, Austerity and more. (Unlike Labour.)

Whilst my main rival Cathy Jamieson got a great personal vote in 2010 (one we of course were gutted about) I think it is time for people to give myself and the SNP a chance to represent the area in London.

At this General Election we need as many SNP MPs elected as possible – its the only way to really keep Scotland at the forefront of the political debate.

In order to do that we need to raise as much many as possible. You can help us in two ways. Firstly by contributing tothis fundraiser. Secondly by helping us to promote this campaign through Social Media. Please share on Facebook and Tweet and retweet it on Twitter. If we can get support from as many SNP supporters as possible we will meet our fundraiser target and help elect an SNP MP for Kilmarnock and Loudoun in 2015.


*Please note - if you are kind enough to donate more than £50 to my campaign, your name and address will be checked against the electoral register to ensure that you are eligible to donate. Your name, but not your address, will be made available by the council on request after the election. If you do donate this amount please do so via our perk!*

Promoted by Wilson Kent on behalf of Alan Brown, 35 Titchfield Street, KA1 1QW

story:
What's Missing from this Picture?

Y-O-U!

At Eastern Point Lit House the goal is to have fun with words--writing them & reading them. Our table is open to anyone who is working with words and needs a quiet space to get them from brain to page. We call ourselves a "Book Incubator" and use of the space for writing is absolutely FREE.

Eastern Point Lit House also

  • hosts readings, workshops, & performances
  • is a space for community gatherings
  • offers editorial services, critiques, and mentoring
  • offers a unique selection of small press and used books, and 
  • sells some essential word nerd supplies.

Eastern Point Lit House is what we like to call a full-service literary center located on beautiful Cape Ann, in the storied town of Gloucester, Massachusetts. Since opening a little over two years ago we’ve hosted poetry and prose readings by local and nationally recognized authors, writing workshops, storytelling events for children, and much more, including the Lit House Book Club which takes place at Duckworth’s Bistrot. We even give away good books to kids who want them—for free. How cool is that? Our mission is simply: Fun with Words. So far we’ve been doing just that.

We started this odd literary project from the ground up—no bank loans, just the little cash we had in our pockets and a lot of generous contributions of time and elbow grease from our community. And it’s been great—we’ve helped many writers develop, write, and edit their books, we’ve given poets a venue to let their voices be heard, and we’ve generally elevated the literary conversation here in this beautiful place. Right now The Lit House as a sole proprietorship, with only me at the helm, with a ton of help from Jenn Monroe, and a lot of volunteerism from the people of Gloucester and beyond. But we’re bumping up against the need to grow, and this is where you come in.

Eastern Point Lit House is launching its first ever fundraising campaign to help us take this project to the next level. Here’s what we hope to do with the money:

It's time to grow! 

We want to help foster the growth of the literary arts on Cape Ann. We put pretty much every spare penny we had into getting the doors open, the walls, painted, the shelves filled. So:

  • Funds raised in this campaign will go towards keeping our doors open and the lights (and WiFi) on, no matter if we reach our goal or not. It will also help us to spread the word through advertising and other promotional materials. We plan to join arts groups on Cape Ann (seARTS, Cape Ann Television, etc.) to help spread the good words. 
  • Re-start our press. When we opened shop, we published a few chapbooks under the Lit House Press name. But printing is expensive, and while also opening a physical shop it became impossible to continue with that model. That said, we’d like to bring the printing process here, in-house. We hope to purchase new printing equipment, card stock and fine paper, paper cutting gear, and software that will allow us to do small print runs, many featuring local writers and artists. Each small run will be handcrafted—so bookmaking would also become part of our mission.
  • Make the shift from sole proprietor to a not for profit model, allowing us to access grants and donations. I’m told about once a week that we’re really acting like a non-profit, so the time has come to make that change. But I’ll need help, and from what I hear it’s not exactly cheap to do this. Your contribution would help make this happen.
  • Bring in some help. While I have been very lucky to have generous volunteers, this can only take us so far. Our long-term goal is to bring on someone at least part time to help us develop our educational programming, which is something we really want to grow.
  • Bring us piece of mind. It would be great to get a little ahead on our rent so that we can concentrate on programming. Everything over our initial, modest goal of $7,500 would do just that.

  • The future is wide open for The Lit House. Long term, we’d like to see an annual literary festival of some sort take place on Cape Ann. And we’ve got many more ideas we think you’ll be excited about.

  • When you choose to support us, we will show our sincere gratitude through perks such as our one-of-a-kind Lit House t-shirts,  "Word Nerd" & "Write by the Sea" mugs, copies of the Gloucester Haiku Project, tickets to our Book Club events, writing workshops, and more.

We are dedicated to the idea of FREE

We are writers ourselves and our Book Incubator comes very much from our own desire for the right place to get the words down. Often that is not our homes or the local coffee shop.

We also know that a special creative energy is generated when two or more writers are working in the same space.

We want to give this gift to writers living on and visiting Cape Ann. Create your own retreat at the Lit House. Write by the sea! 

What Happens after this campaign?

We know that this campaign will only help us in the short-term. Our long-term plan is to increase our educational programming to support the Book Incubator and our free events. Some examples of these programs include:

  • Unique writing workshops & classes for all ages
  • Authors' Nights
  • Themed gatherings and readings
  • Editorial services, with discounts for veterans and people in need of financial assistance
  • Using our revitalized small press to share local stories and poetry, sometimes for free
  • Work toward making Cape Ann a literary scene to be reckoned with 

We also plan to make our space available for a very reasonable price to community groups looking for a place to meet.

    Don't worry if you can't contribute

    We know most of you are like us--trying to make a living with very little to spare. You can support us by sharing our mission and our story. Use your voice. Use your computer. Use the Indiegogo share tools.

    Thank you! 

    So this is the big ask: Can you help? We’ve got some tasty gifts for those of you willing to help. Check those out on our fundraising page. And thank you. We can’t do this without you. You have my unending gratitude.

We plan to join arts groups on Cape Ann (seARTS, Cape Ann Television, etc.) to help spread the good words. 
Re-start our press. When we opened shop, we published a few chapbooks under the Lit House Press name. But printing is expensive, and while also opening a physical shop it became impossible to continue with that model. That said, we’d like to bring the printing process here, in-house. We hope to purchase new printing equipment, card stock and fine paper, paper cutting gear, and software that will allow us to do small print runs, many featuring local writers and artists. Each small run will be handcrafted—so bookmaking would also become part of our mission.
Make the shift from sole proprietor to a not for profit model, allowing us to access grants and donations. I’m told about once a week that we’re really acting like a non-profit, so the time has come to make that change. But I’ll need help, and from what I hear it’s not exactly cheap to do this. Your contribution would help make this happen.
Bring in some help. While I have been very lucky to have generous volunteers, this can only take us so far. Our long-term goal is to bring on someone at least part time to help us develop our educational programming, which is something we really want to grow.
Bring us piece of mind. It would be great to get a little ahead on our rent so that we can concentrate on programming. Everything over our initial, modest goal of $7,500 would do just that.
The future is wide open for The Lit House. Long term, we’d like to see an annual literary festival of some sort take place on Cape Ann. And we’ve got many more ideas we think you’ll be excited about.
When you choose to support us, we will show our sincere gratitude through perks such as our one-of-a-kind Lit House t-shirts,  "Word Nerd" & "Write by the Sea" mugs, copies of the Gloucester Haiku Project, tickets to our Book Club events, writing workshops, and more.


We are dedicated to the idea of FREE

We are writers ourselves and our Book Incubator comes very much from our own desire for the right place to get the words down. Often that is not our homes or the local coffee shop.
We also know that a special creative energy is generated when two or more writers are working in the same space.
We want to give this gift to writers living on and visiting Cape Ann. Create your own retreat at the Lit House. Write by the sea! 

What Happens after this campaign?
We know that this campaign will only help us in the short-term. Our long-term plan is to increase our educational programming to support the Book Incubator and our free events. Some examples of these programs include:

Unique writing workshops & classes for all ages
Authors' Nights
Themed gatherings and readings
Editorial services, with discounts for veterans and people in need of financial assistance
Using our revitalized small press to share local stories and poetry, sometimes for free
Work toward making Cape Ann a literary scene to be reckoned with 

We also plan to make our space available for a very reasonable price to community groups looking for a place to meet.


Don't worry if you can't contribute
We know most of you are like us--trying to make a living with very little to spare. You can support us by sharing our mission and our story. Use your voice. Use your computer. Use the Indiegogo share tools.
Thank you! 
So this is the big ask: Can you help? We’ve got some tasty gifts for those of you willing to help. Check those out on our fundraising page. And thank you. We can’t do this without you. You have my unending gratitude.

story:
Who am I?

I grew up in Northern Ireland listening to pop music on pirate radio stations. I'm not a musician, just a fan. In the 80s, I managed Aussie Christian hard rock band ROSANNA'S RAIDERS and organised concerts in Melbourne, Australia for groups such as Stryper, Petra and Whitecross as well as for artists like Larry Norman, Randy Stonehill and Bruce Cockburn. Recently I've been working with Steve Rowe's bands Mortification and Wonrowe Vision. In 2012, I wrote and published Rosanna---rock'n'roll believer, a biography of vocalist/guitarist Rosanna Palmer.
Why write Metal Missionary?
I believe that Steve Rowe's story is one that needs to be told.  He and I have spent almost 12 months shaping his life story from childhood to today.  In over 65,000 words and scores of photos, we explain how his life evolved from that of a healthy suburban Aussie boy to that of a cancer survivor classified as an L1 paraplegic.  Along the way from adolescence to adulthood, Steve not only fought cancer, he also created extreme Gospel/Christian metal music releasing 15 albums, various musicvideos and DVDs as well as touring the world with his band Mortification.
Metal Missionary:  The Steve Rowe Story will impact many readers throughout the world.  Not just 'metalheads', but anyone interested in a moving, emotional, inspirational story of gritty determination and unswerving dedication to  a cause.
Why run a fundraising campaign?
We don't expect to make much, if any, money from publishing and selling a hardback book.  However, any contributions to our indiegogo campaign will help us finance the design, layout and publication of Steve's story.
 We need at least $25,000 to create 1,000 books. This money will pay for the design/layout artist, scans of archival photos, all pre-press work and printing.
What can supporters get?
Perks for contributors include Mortification and Wonrowe Vision CDs, a CD/DVD package, iBook versions of Metal Missionary and my book about Rosanna, a hardback copy of Metal Missionary, a Skype session with Steve Rowe and special Mortification merch including t-shirts from Steve's stash in his home office.
If we don't reach our goal, any money raised will go towards creating sample pages to present to potential publishers.
I know how hard it is to fundraise for projects, having been part of a successful crowdfunding effort for a documentary film on the life of God's Squad CMC founder John Smith.
Not everyone is a metal music fan; not everyone is enamoured of the Christian faith. But I hope that enough people will be interested in reading Steve's remarkable story of survival and how he has spent a lifetime overcoming incredible obstacles while attempting to shine a positive light into what is generally a dark and disturbing subculture.
I trust that, if you can't contribute financially, you will help us spread the word about our indiegogo campaign and assist us in enlisting the support of as many people as possible.                                        ---Vic Campbell

story:
Hi! I'm Stacey Welsh and I'm an Aussie Indie Author.

Currently I'm working on a fantastic kids book series with a good friend and very talented illustrator, Thijis Van Sise, Called "The Es-Cow-Pades of Miss Moogooley Oogooley." 
The Series follows the misadventures of a house cow who has a sense of adventure and the horns for trouble and is aimed at children from 2 to 8 (Depending on the individual's development stages).
In book one she manages to escape the home paddock and go into the town one night. we have plans for about 15 story books in the series as well as a sub series of educational books (Colours with Moogooley, Numbers, Shapes etc)
What we are looking for is a helping hand to get Moogooley launched into the world.
We have offers to have the book series translated into Spanish and German (Possibly French as well)

Your contributions will help us with advertising, merchandising (we are hoping to get some cute little Plush Moogooley's made up, some of which will be available as rewards if we can go over our goal), getting a website set up and printing costs.
Book one is 90% complete, and we will be publishing through Amazon Createspace acting as "Far Horizons Publishing" a new publishing group that is currently being set up.

I work in the public transport sector and one thing I notice sadly is the lack of children reading, especially younger readers which our series is aimed at.
If I can get a couple of kids in the world interested in reading just from my books, then I'll be happy.
Literacy is a vitally important skill for young people to have, and it has been shown that the younger they start, the better they will be at reading and writing.
If you would like a little more info, please don't hesitate to contact us on our Moogooley Oogooley Facebook Page. https://www.facebook.com/moogooleyoogooley
If you can't help by contributing, please spread the word and give our FB page a "Like"!

    Thanks for checking us out!
