story:
National Novel Writing Month

Every November, hundreds of Bloomington, Indiana writers take on NaNoWriMo’s challenge of writing a 50,000-word novel in thirty days. It’s an anti-contest writing contest, where the judges are missing, the prizes are lousy, and writers and non-writers alike have the time of their lives bashing out surprisingly unhorrible books in an absurdly short amount of time.

What We Need

More and more writers undertaking this (not-so) death defying writing challenge in Bloomington every year.  A key part of NaNoWriMo is the chance to meet and write with other writers.

Most crucially, we need space to write and get together.  This usually costs money in some form, whether it's to rent the space itself, or to buy enough from the business that is graciously loaning us their space to thank them and keep their employees happy.

Typical writer things, like drinking too much coffee and forgetting to eat, are magnified in an intense month-long writing marathon.  I'd love to be able to offer participants snacks at the write ins, and possibly even prizes to award them for this huge accomplishment.

What You Get

We've got some awesome writers in Bloomington!  We want you to get a sample for yourselves.  To thank you for your generous contribution, we'd like to share our work with you.  Choose from books and ebooks written by our very own talented local authors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spaces for write ins
We need places to write!  Preferably, we'd like to have tables and chairs, power outlets, and a wifi connection, in a location safe and easily accessible (including parking) from both campus and downtown Bloomington.  Our write ins that we don't have locations for will be the first Friday, second Thursday, third Wednesday, fourth Tuesday, and last Monday of November, in the evening, approximately 6-9pm.  Depending on location, day, and time, in previous years we've had as many as 20 participants at time attending write-ins.

Food
Snacks and drinks at write ins are greatly appreciated.

Prizes
The only guaranteed prize for meeting the 50,000 word mark in November is a sense of accomplishment.  

Write!

If you're interested in joining us in this challenge, sign up at www.nanowrimo.org.

story:
Give Mayor Ed Lee and key city officials

an OCCUPY book report!

 

At the opening of the recent San Francisco International Poetry Festival, 

Mayor Ed Lee announced to the crowd that with all his official duties 

he had no time to read poetry. 

 

                                        NO TIME FOR POETRY? 

 

Around the world, leaders value poetry, and provide better examples 

of creative literacy to children. No wonder the Mayor has such 

little regard for the spirit and principles of the Occupy movement. 

 

Let’s help him and other city officials rise from 

dull-heartedness to poetic inspiration!

 

In honor of the first year anniversary 

of the Occupy Movement, we are launching a

book distribution campaign for

OCCUPY SF—poems from the movement

www.occupyanthology.com

 

OUR CAMPAIGN: Please purchase a copy of Occupy SF—poems from the movement to be placed in the hands of city officials for the “Give Mayor Ed Lee an Occupy Book Report” program (this is your perk). Since this is funded by members of the public for the enlightenment and literacy of their own trusted public servants, government officials will be expected to read the book, select favorite poems, and publicly comment on how they plan to address the concerns so artfully expressed throughout the book.

 

             ALL proceeds from sales of books benefit Occupy.

 

  

We will hold a public event before the November elections where city officials can personally share their book reports or provide emails to be read by contributors to the anthology. 

 

OCCUPY SF—poems from the movement

represents the genuine voice of the community’s highest political aspirations, with such inspiring contributors as Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Francisco X. Alarcón, Brenda Hillman, devorah major, Jack Hirschman and activist rock poster artists Chuck Sperry and Ron Donovan.

 

Co-editors Virginia Barrett and Bobby Coleman, plus the publishing team at Jambu Press/Studio Saraswati, are dedicated to positive social change and the power of poetry to help bring about peace and justice for all.

story:
Short Summary

I believe in giving back. I believe in sharing and encouraging one another to make positive changes in order to lead better lives. I believe that at the very least we should inspire the youth of tomorrow and teach them to make sound choices and be bold when faced with adversity in life.  To achieve this we must give guidance to the future generations.

My dream is to share with the youth of today and tomorrow, the stories of the successful young leaders that I have interacted with.  

As a teenager in Jamaica I read a book that featured a man I considered my mentor from that moment on, Warren Buffet. After reading that book, I set goals for myself, which included inspiring young leaders to follow their dreams and make them a reality.

I decided to write this book because I realized there are such talented, smart and truly inspirational young leaders in different fields that do not get the recognition and the exposure they deserve! These people that I have had the opportunity to encounter have so many stories that they have shared and inspired me. I want to share them with others who otherwise would never get a chance to learn from these amazing people.

By contributing to this campaign you are allowing others access to this elite group of people I call “Luminaries”, people of prominence and brilliant achievement. You WILL help shape the lives of people from across the globe.

A book like this is missing in the market place. We are bombarded with information about a special group of athletes or those in the entertainment industry, be it singer, performers, or actors. While their successes are to be lauded and cheered and admired, we have an obligation to expose our future leaders to other role models, other mentors, other inspirational people doing wonderful things in different fields. Whether it be philanthropic, economic advancement, invention or business, these young leaders have paved the way for future generations. I believe that this book will enrich the lives of young people around the world.

You can make this happen for all the young men and women out there who need to find a mentor to help pave their way, just as I had a chance to read a book featuring Warren Buffet that helped pave my way.

 

Luminary Ndidi Nwuneli in Africa

 

The Impact

We are actively seeking funds to make the publishing and distribution of this book a reality! I am so passionate about exposing our future leaders to those among us who accomplished great things in different arenas because that’s how I was able to figure out my path in life! I read a book on Warren Buffet and his words resonated within me at the young age of 15 and this helped me map out my path in life, where I wanted to go to school, what I wanted to study, my extracurricular activities and ultimately my career!

This book will be an invaluable asset to our future leaders. Readers will:

  • Gain access to firsthand accounts of various leaders of today who acheived success before the age of 45.
  • Read profiles of men and women around the globe who have excelled in various industries.
  • Support the dreams and ambitions of the new generation of global leaders.

The insight into these Luminaries thought processes and the advice they share will change lives forever. I am so passionate about this project and I need your help to make it happen! I am dedicated to making this book a reality with your help and support we can get this book out by graduation season! High School grads, College grads, and those needing motivation and inspiration will benefit from this book!

Luminary Kevin Lu meets with Premier Li Keqiang to discuss urbanization of China

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute we would appreciate you taking time to share our link with someone you think can. Please post this on you various social media accounts and distribute to your network. This book with change lives!

It’s easy to share this with those you believe will not only benefit for themselves but for their children, friends and family as well! Please click on the “Indiegogo share Icon”

Luminary Kate Roberts, founder and director of YouthAIDS.

story:
I'm a linguist.  I moved to Washington, DC with a dream of changing the world for the better through my language skills.  About 8 months ago, I took a job with a company based in Saudi Arabia, Education Experts.  I was misled in my impressions that it was a financially stable, growing company.  Three separate times, my paycheck has been extremely overdue.  

In the same few months, my roommate stopped paying rent and lied to me about it, even forging bank documents to convince me that he had.  By the time the truth came out, four months of unpaid rent had accrued.  

 

Due to mounting debts, my dog and I are facing eviction.  All I want to do now is make home to my family in Seattle by Christmas time.

story:
Short Summary

Why we wrote this book

As the world becomes more divided, we think it is important to try to connect with those around us. We want to build bridges using thought, help people truly get to know each other, and inspire new ideas. We also like feeling clever and writing a book is a great way to pat yourself on the back. 

A bit about the book

Yes, this is a book but we hope that readers we will use it as a tool to reach new personal intellectual heights, have a mind-gasm, if you will. It is written in a stream of conscious style, each author expressing their thoughts on a subject briefly and posing questions, most of the time leaving the discussion open ended. It is up to the reader to either pick up these ideas and come to their own conclusion or to judge us as unworthy intellectual souls and move on to the next topic. 

Why you matter

Yes, we need money to make our dream of publishing this book a reality. But we also need you as a reader, your thoughts and interactions are what make this vision become a reality. We need your intellect to further our, perhaps idealistic, goals.

What We Need & What You Get

    What you get

    • A coffee table book that has the potential to inspire new thought (based on donation level)
    • A tool to inspire meaningful conversations and connection
    • A feeling of self-satisfaction for supporting such an intellectual project

    Where the money goes

    • Editing
    • Publishing
    • Distribution 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You know how this works, share, share, share. As we want to promote open communication, we also want to hear your thoughts on how this book could spark real conversations between friends and strangers alike, for example, event ideas, social media, etc. 

    Sample Text

    Excerpt from "Sexuality" by Becky

    "If we truly had free will, would sexual orientation exist? One might argue that it is precisely because they have the illusion of free will that sexual orientation exists but if we consider it from the opposite perspective, if we were truly free to live and think without considering the views of others, if we could ignore our instincts and biological impulses, would our sexuality expand such that we would have the possibility to find humans of all gender identities attractive?"

    Excerpt from "Capitalism" by JT

    "I wonder if capitalism is rooted in our animal nature. We are hardwired to provide for ourselves and our pack and to hoard necessities for bad times. Since most of us don't seem to worry about our survival as a species, I don't think "pack" has to mean the human race but rather just the people closest to us. We constantly change and adapt in different ways but deep down, maybe our brains still tell us to get what we need or desire when we see an opportunity, and make those whom we beat to the punch a lesser priority. Does working for financial and material equality really go contrary to our natural disposition? Or have we evolved to the point where creating an equal society can be more important to us than securing a profit for ourselves?"

    A bit about us

    Becky is a lifelong geek that never made it past the childhood question "why?". Always seeking knowledge and never quite satisfied led to a passion for science and philosophy. US-born but residing in Denmark for the last decade, Becky returned to university after 10+ years in the corporate world to work on a Master's in Electronics Engineering, adding to a Bachelor's degree in Physics and Mathematics. Additionally, they are a long-time LGBT advocate and have a TEDx talk focusing on gender.

    JT is a creative person who loves to make music and other art. He has always been curious about how and why we do what we do in personal and societal contexts and loves to engage in inspiring discussion. A binational citizen, he has lived in several countries. He is a welder by trade and is planning on going back to university soon. Before welding, he studied at the Danish National Academy of Music and is regularly involved in recording and performing projects.

Short Summary
Why we wrote this book
As the world becomes more divided, we think it is important to try to connect with those around us. We want to build bridges using thought, help people truly get to know each other, and inspire new ideas. We also like feeling clever and writing a book is a great way to pat yourself on the back. 
A bit about the book
Yes, this is a book but we hope that readers we will use it as a tool to reach new personal intellectual heights, have a mind-gasm, if you will. It is written in a stream of conscious style, each author expressing their thoughts on a subject briefly and posing questions, most of the time leaving the discussion open ended. It is up to the reader to either pick up these ideas and come to their own conclusion or to judge us as unworthy intellectual souls and move on to the next topic. 
Why you matter
Yes, we need money to make our dream of publishing this book a reality. But we also need you as a reader, your thoughts and interactions are what make this vision become a reality. We need your intellect to further our, perhaps idealistic, goals.

What We Need & What You Get

What you get

A coffee table book that has the potential to inspire new thought (based on donation level)
A tool to inspire meaningful conversations and connection
A feeling of self-satisfaction for supporting such an intellectual project

Where the money goes

Editing
Publishing
Distribution 


Other Ways You Can Help
You know how this works, share, share, share. As we want to promote open communication, we also want to hear your thoughts on how this book could spark real conversations between friends and strangers alike, for example, event ideas, social media, etc. 
Sample Text
Excerpt from "Sexuality" by Becky
"If we truly had free will, would sexual orientation exist? One might argue that it is precisely because they have the illusion of free will that sexual orientation exists but if we consider it from the opposite perspective, if we were truly free to live and think without considering the views of others, if we could ignore our instincts and biological impulses, would our sexuality expand such that we would have the possibility to find humans of all gender identities attractive?"
Excerpt from "Capitalism" by JT
"I wonder if capitalism is rooted in our animal nature. We are hardwired to provide for ourselves and our pack and to hoard necessities for bad times. Since most of us don't seem to worry about our survival as a species, I don't think "pack" has to mean the human race but rather just the people closest to us. We constantly change and adapt in different ways but deep down, maybe our brains still tell us to get what we need or desire when we see an opportunity, and make those whom we beat to the punch a lesser priority. Does working for financial and material equality really go contrary to our natural disposition? Or have we evolved to the point where creating an equal society can be more important to us than securing a profit for ourselves?"
A bit about us
Becky is a lifelong geek that never made it past the childhood question "why?". Always seeking knowledge and never quite satisfied led to a passion for science and philosophy. US-born but residing in Denmark for the last decade, Becky returned to university after 10+ years in the corporate world to work on a Master's in Electronics Engineering, adding to a Bachelor's degree in Physics and Mathematics. Additionally, they are a long-time LGBT advocate and have a TEDx talk focusing on gender.

JT is a creative person who loves to make music and other art. He has always been curious about how and why we do what we do in personal and societal contexts and loves to engage in inspiring discussion. A binational citizen, he has lived in several countries. He is a welder by trade and is planning on going back to university soon. Before welding, he studied at the Danish National Academy of Music and is regularly involved in recording and performing projects.

story:
Why this Project is Important:

Mommy, Tell Me Why I Am Radiant is our proactive response to addressing a “word poverty” that exists particularly in communities of color. Basically, this gap in words is what early literacy experts refer to when describing the disparity between the number of words that children from families of disadvantaged economic backgrounds hear compared to children from families of more affluent economic backgrounds. Reading experts say that young children who hear new and interesting words are better prepared to succeed when they enter school. This exposure to words also promotes a desire to read books and awakens a love of language that helps children become stronger readers.

We promote the message that ALL parents, regardless of financial circumstance, are wealthy with words! They have the power to introduce their children to a variety of words because, for the most part, they already own these words in English and/or Spanish!  Poverty, inequity, and failing school systems are a sad reality communities face. Ending ‘word poverty” is not a panacea that will solve all of society’s injustices. However, through collective efforts that empower communities of high needs, disparities can be narrowed because families can obtain resources to create better learning experiences and opportunities for their children. And for us, we strongly believe that’s heading in the right direction.

This project also addresses the need to increase the number of English/Spanish bilingual children’s books that are published by Latino authors.

This is the first of four books in the  Mommy Tell Me Series that is co-authored by a Mother-Daughter Team.

About this Bilingual Picture Book:

Mommy, Tell Me Why I Am Radiant is about a charming conversation between a mother and daughter regarding the little girl’s qualities that make her unique.  The positive words used in the text support little girls’ self-confidence and self-worth (and perhaps moms’ too!). The lovely ending will remind moms that their children often grow up to be just like them. When moms live a joyful and radiant life, their children learn to live equally as joyful and radiant. Mommy, Tell Me Why I Am Radiant helps moms teach their daughters a sophisticated vocabulary in English and Spanish.

Included on the last page, is a child-friendly definition of each fancy word used in the book as explained by co-author, Julia Rae Rodriguez.

The book was created for children roughly from preschool-age to about third-grade. Like all picture books, this book is meant to be read to a child. Adults are encouraged to engage the child in conversation by asking lots of questions about the words, illustrations, or anything else that is of interest to the child.

Moms will enjoy bonding and reading this book with their young daughters beyond the school-age years. Another important aspect of the book (that we are especially proud of) is the use of the awe-inspiring similes that encourage a family’s deeper appreciation of nature and our amazing Mother Earth.

Mommy, Tell Me Why I Am Radiant will be a 32-page paperback and hardcover book in full color. If we totally surpass our goal, we will explore ways to develop an interactive e-book where the readers can click on the fancy word to hear the child-friendly definition as they are reading the book.

Note to Moms Inside the Book:

Why We Want to Publish Books:

We are advocates of community well-being through social responsibility. We are agents of social change by aligning our skills and talents to supporting the needs of our communities. For us, publishing this first book is about the proud expression of culture, the celebration of language, and appreciation of Mother Earth. We wish to be totally transparent with our contributors, so in full disclosure…for us, publishing this book is also a political and social movement to shift stuff that simply isn’t right! As advocates for equity, we are fighting to make sure that all children, regardless of their socio-economic status, have opportunities to learn and understand the meaning of new words that enrich their lexicon and life experience. We hope that you will join us in this movement. To learn more about our reasons to publish books, check out an interview that was published by award-winning author and activist, Maya Gonzalez: http://www.mayagonzalez.com/blog/

Publishing this book will support two specific community efforts that we are passionate about because of the positive impact that these efforts have on community:

  1. Parent-Child Learning through Family Literacy
  2. Art and Culture Integration in Community Organizations

We have made a family commitment to share the profits made from all our self-published books. Therefore, Skillful and Soulful Press will donate a percentage of the proceeds made from Mommy, Tell Me Why I Am Radiant to two community-based organizations:

  1. South Central LAMP – whose mission is to provide a supportive, nurturing environment for economically poor women and their families by offering educational programs that empower women and their families to reach their full potential, build self-esteem, and strengthen mutual interdependent relations. Learn more about this fantastic organization at: http://www.southcentrallamp.org/
  2. Centro Cultural Oaxaca – is a non-profit organization whose mission is to provide communities with a series of activities that focus on arts, culture, and human development. Like them on Facebook at: Centro-Cultural-Oaxaca-USA

What We Have:

  • We have a final manuscript that has been translated, edited, and proofread. And proofread again. And proofread one last time for good measure….by 5 people, maybe 10.
  • We have established our own indie press. All licenses, permits, and paperwork have been filed and paid. Yay!
  • We have an illustrator! The extraordinary Reynaldo Mora has brought his talent and skill to this project creating rich illustrations that appeal to children and adults alike. Learn more about our illustrator here: https://www.reymorafineart.com/

Most importantly, we have the community: You! Which brings us to…

What We Need from You:

  1. Pre-order your copy of the book by contributing to our campaign.
  2. Pre-order copies that you wish to give to those you love by contributing to our campaign.
  3. Help us Build Buzz around our project, book, and movement to let ALL parents know that they are RICH with WORD$.

Important Campaign Details:

The funds raised through this crowdfunding campaign will offset the costs of:     

  • A book designer who will design the front cover, back cover, and layout of the book; in addition to creating the required final files that will be uploaded to the printer.
  • The first print run of books; including shipping costs to deliver the book to you!
  • Outreach and promotional material to promote the book.
  • Donating books to non-profit organizations that work with young children and their parents.

The following timeline is what we (over-achievers) are striving to accomplish:

  • Early November 2017 - Crowdfunding campaign kicks off
  • Mid November 2017 – Finalize book design and upload files to printer
  • Late November 2017 – Proof printed book and place order for (a gazillion) books; Crowdfunding campaign ends
  • Early December 2017 – Celebrate Book Launch! 
  • Early – Mid December – Deliver or send book to you
  • January 2018 and beyond – Take this show on the road!

Some Pretty Perks:

We have some fabulous perks as our way of saying Thank You, Thank YOU, THANK YOU!

The Inspiring Impact:

With your help we will be able to get this book out into the world! Just imagine the positive impact on the lives of little girls whose self-esteem is raised because they know the meaning of more fancy words that help them feel more radiant. Or the increase in engaging conversations between mothers and daughters that nurture both their wonder and amazement.

When it comes to language, culture, and experiences, families are NOT poor!

Researchers say that if we close the word gap, we might be able to close the academic achievement gap that exists between white students and students of color. And maybe we can even disrupt the cycle of poverty in some communities. Imagine how wonderful that would be!

Every contribution, no matter the amount, will help us reach our goal! Can’t contribute financially? Not a problem at all - We are grateful if you share our campaign with others on your social media platforms or simply talk to others about it because that raises the energetic frequency around this important topic and that's when the magic happens!

 We also accept prayers, positive vibes, well wishes, happy thoughts, kisses blown our way, candles lit, good juju, energy work, lucky charms, talismans, ….

As you can see, we’ll humbly take it ALL. :)

In Case You’re Wondering:  

The other Mommy Tell Me Books are:

  • Mommy, Tell Me Where I Will Travel - A bilingual picture book for moms and their young daughters. The use of intriguing vocabulary words to describe the wonders of the world help elevate a child’s interest in geography and world travel. Parents will be proud to raise a xenophile – a person who loves foreign people and foreign things!
  • Mommy, Tell Me How I Am A Leader - A bilingual picture book for moms and their young daughters. The vigorous vocabulary words used in this book inspire, empower, and galvanize families to raise strong daughters who speak their truth by being bold, courageous, and fearless.
  • Mommy, Tell Me About My Brother - A bilingual picture book for moms and their young daughters. The sophisticated vocabulary words used in this compassionate conversation between a mother and daughter uplift dads, brothers, and all the men that enrich a girl’s life.

story:
¿Qué?

Sadhila, la princesa maldita es la historia de una joven luchando contra el destino, en un mundo de magia y fantasía.

En el reino de Margot, bajo una apariencia de felicidad, permanece latente el odio de la malvada bruja Oira; la cual no dudará en sacrificar todo cuanto posee con tal de llevar a cabo su venganza.

Una princesa que ignora que lo es, maldita desde su nacimiento, decidirá el destino del reino. Un destino que le vino marcado por una joven hechizada y un muchacho que se rebeló contra todo lo que le habían enseñado.

¿Logrará escapar Sadhila de su destino? Y lo que es mas importante... ¿querrá hacerlo?
¿Tendrá este cuento de hadas un final feliz?

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Elena Baca.

Nació en Jerez de la Frontera (Cádiz) en 1969. Después de pasar su infancia y adolescencia viviendo en diversas ciudades de España, decidió asentarse en su ciudad natal, donde actualmente vive con su marido, sus dos hijos y sus cuatro tortugas.
Desde muy joven sintió pasión por la lectura, descubriendo autores fascinantes como Mary Higgins Clark, J.R.R.Tolkien, Stephen King y George R.R. Martin. Siempre le gustó escribir, así que pronto empezaron las incursiones por la literatura con cuentos y relatos breves, pero siempre como hobby, ya que nunca se atrevió a publicar nada.

Licenciada en Derecho y Diplomada en Relaciones Públicas y Márketing, ahora ha decidido que ha llegado el momento de cumplir su sueño de ser escritora.
Con su primera novela "Sadhila, la princesa maldita" pretende introducirse de lleno en el mundo literario, haciendose un hueco en el mismo.

Elena Baca es, sin duda, un valor a tener en cuenta.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 750€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Sadhila, la princesa maldita que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Elena Baca vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS BEEN CANCELED.

Thank you for your interest in this project and please still be on the look out for The Devil Inside the Beltway out September 24th.

RALLY AROUND MIKE AS HE SHOWS THE WORLD HOW THE GOVERNMENT HAS BEEN WATCHING YOUR WORKSTATION LONGER THAN YOU THINK.

Why am I Raising These Funds?

Bringing this story to the world is an expensive endeavor. The $50,000 goal I set will help cover the costs of not only printing the book, but also to spread the word about it. Travel costs, publicity, marketing and social media consultants, and operations all have astronomical costs. However, I believe it's well worth it to make sure every American knows what the government is doing behind closed doors. 

It isn't so much a donation as it is buying the book early. But even if you can't get involved financially, please spread the word about the book, follow me on Twitter, or subscribe to my blog. I need ambassadors just as much as I need funds. People to get out there, buy the book, and to tell everyone about this story. 

More About the Story

Small business owner Michael J. Daugherty is fighting back against US Government's sinister surveillance tactics with his upcoming book,
The Devil Inside the Beltway: The Shocking Expose of the US Government’s Surveillance and Overreach into Cybersecurity, Medicine, and Small Business.

During the past decade the US Government has teamed with private enterprise and academia to attack American small business by surveilling networks and picking up Americans’ files they considered to be “shared” and "vulnerable". They used that information to expand and grow more than one government agency. 

Michael J. Daugherty, the small business owner who created LabMD, a cancer
detection center in Atlanta, Georgia, became a victim of these governmental
practices. What began with the unauthorized but government-funded procurement of medical data for 9000+ patients from his medical laboratory turned into a government supported, financially draining, extortion attempt.

This enterprise, in association with a prestigious American university, conducted an illegal conversion of medical files and then used their findings to motivate the US Government to ride the wave of cybersecurity investigations and witchhunts. 

Through acts of conversion, then extortion, the government, in this case specifically the FTC, is trying to control the Internet and cybersecurity through illegal methods, without standards, stretching laws way past their intent. This is textbook government practice--overreaching now, asking for forgiveness later, and hoping we all will forget.

Daugherty started writing this book long before the scandals involving the NSA, IRS, the Associated Press, James Rosen, and Benghazi became household discussions. He has engaged in an exhaustive effort to protect his company, one that saves lives, to repair and protect his reputation, and to ensure that this does not happen to any other American citizen, business, or media outlet.

Taking you inside his five-year journey of government power grabs and intimidation tactics, Daugherty backs his riveting true story with engaging detail, including Congressional testimony, press releases, e-mails, letters and FOIA documents. But for the fact that everything in the book really happened, it reads like a brilliant political thriller. The cronies, lawyers, politicians and bullies...they are all right here in this stinging indictment.

Bringing this story to the world is an expensive endeavor. The $50,000 goal I set will help cover the costs of not only printing the book, but also to spread the word about it. Travel costs, publicity, marketing and social media consultants, and operations all have astronomical costs. However, I believe it's well worth it to make sure every American knows what the government is doing behind closed doors. 
It isn't so much a donation as it is buying the book early. But even if you can't get involved financially, please spread the word about the book, follow me on Twitter, or subscribe to my blog. I need ambassadors just as much as I need funds. People to get out there, buy the book, and to tell everyone about this story. 
More About the Story
Small business owner Michael J. Daugherty is fighting back against US Government's sinister surveillance tactics with his upcoming book,The Devil Inside the Beltway: The Shocking Expose of the US Government’s Surveillance and Overreach into Cybersecurity, Medicine, and Small Business.
During the past decade the US Government has teamed with private enterprise and academia to attack American small business by surveilling networks and picking up Americans’ files they considered to be “shared” and "vulnerable". They used that information to expand and grow more than one government agency. 
Michael J. Daugherty, the small business owner who created LabMD, a cancerdetection center in Atlanta, Georgia, became a victim of these governmentalpractices. What began with the unauthorized but government-funded procurement of medical data for 9000+ patients from his medical laboratory turned into a government supported, financially draining, extortion attempt.
This enterprise, in association with a prestigious American university, conducted an illegal conversion of medical files and then used their findings to motivate the US Government to ride the wave of cybersecurity investigations and witchhunts. 
Through acts of conversion, then extortion, the government, in this case specifically the FTC, is trying to control the Internet and cybersecurity through illegal methods, without standards, stretching laws way past their intent. This is textbook government practice--overreaching now, asking for forgiveness later, and hoping we all will forget.
Daugherty started writing this book long before the scandals involving the NSA, IRS, the Associated Press, James Rosen, and Benghazi became household discussions. He has engaged in an exhaustive effort to protect his company, one that saves lives, to repair and protect his reputation, and to ensure that this does not happen to any other American citizen, business, or media outlet.
Taking you inside his five-year journey of government power grabs and intimidation tactics, Daugherty backs his riveting true story with engaging detail, including Congressional testimony, press releases, e-mails, letters and FOIA documents. But for the fact that everything in the book really happened, it reads like a brilliant political thriller. The cronies, lawyers, politicians and bullies...they are all right here in this stinging indictment.

story:
A brother and I are trying to raise funds to be able to go to Wheaton College's Correctional Ministry Summit May 30-June 1. http://www.cmcainternational.org/2013-conference

We have both been a part of Celebrate Recovery for several years and desire to start a true prison/re-entry ministry at our church. I have been a mentor at a maximum security prison and lead communion and church services at a state run, drug/alcohol facility for parole violators and he has mentored at prisons in Mexico. Our desire is that those incarcerated, change their ways and come to know the Lord. We are passionate about prison/recovery/re-entry ministry. 

Wheaton College runs the only true prison ministry training program taught by a college, in the country. For years, I have wanted take their classes, but being a single dad, have not been able to afford them. The conference would be a great alternative for now and they have several good lecture sessions planned. The total cost to travel roundtrip to Wheaton, including lodging for two nights at the college would be about $1300 total or $650/person. We are looking for individuals who can help financially.  Your prayers are also greatly appreciated. 

God Bless,

Peter and Dave

Any money raised beyond what is needed will go to Real Life Ministries's, Real Life Recovery group at the Coeur d'Alene campus.

http://www.rlmcda.com/ministries/recovery

story:
What is the Automated Poetry Project?

WORD Vancouver, the West Coast’s largest free book and magazine event, is excited to introduce an innovative new festival event: the Automated Poetry Project. Through this project, WORD Vancouver will transform ordinary vending machines into poetry dispensers! The poems of BC and Canadian poets will be placed in vending machine capsules and dispensed for just a toonie each. The machines will be in multiple locations in downtown Vancouver during the month of September 2013.

Who are we?

Since 1995, WORD Vancouver has celebrated writing and the importance of literacy in an annual festival held at the Vancouver Public Library. Each year, upwards of 25,000 readers and writers of all ages enjoy established and emerging authors reading from new titles, a bustling marketplace, informative panel discussions, workshops, demonstrations, performances, and live music. WORD Vancouver is one of Vancouver’s major cultural events and is not to be missed! The Automated Poetry Project is consistent with WORD Vancouver’s mandate to foster Vancouver’s poetry community and is a fun, innovative, and inexpensive way to support local poets. With your help, we will be able to keep the festival free to all members of the public and will help keep Vancouver’s vibrant literary culture alive.

How can you help?

We need your support to launch the Automated Poetry Project. To purchase five vending machines, we need to raise $2000. All proceeds from vending machine sales will support local poets involved in the WORD Vancouver festival. If we do not reach our fundraising goal, WORD Vancouver will use all the donated funds to purchase as many vending machines as possible. 

Choose your support level today!

Perks:

In return for the listed donation amounts, you will receive the following perks:

  • Up to $19: Acknowledgment on the WORD Vancouver website
  • $20-$49: One free book bag from a previous WORD festival (to be picked up at WORD Vancouver this upcoming September or festival office); acknowledgment on the WORD Vancouver website
  • $50-$99: One free volume of poetry; one free book bag from a previous WORD festival (to be picked up at WORD Vancouver this upcoming September or festival office); acknowledgment on the WORD Vancouver website
  • $100-$499: Your name on one of five poetry dispensers; public acknowledgment at an Automated Poetry Reading event; one free volume of poetry; one free book bag from a previous WORD festival (to be picked up at WORD Vancouver this upcoming September or festival office); acknowledgment on the WORD Vancouver website
  • $500+: $500 worth of free books; your name on one of five poetry dispensers; public acknowledgment at an Automated Poetry Reading event; one free volume of poetry; one free book bag from a previous WORD festival (to be picked up at WORD Vancouver this upcoming September or festival office); acknowledgment on the WORD Vancouver website

Impact of the Automated Poetry Project:

The Automated Poetry Project will help raise the profiles of Vancouver poets and bring excellent poetry to every day locations such as coffee shops.  As a supporter, you will make a meaningful contribution to Vancouver’s literary community and will participate in an important aspect of Canada’s diverse, unique artistic culture.

Other ways to get involved:

If you would like to support the Automated Poetry Project but cannot make a donation at this time, please consider visiting the WORD Vancouver website at www.wordvancouver.ca to find out more information about volunteering at our event. Please also use Indiegogo’s share tools to spread the word about our project to your circles!

story:
Buckey Bronco & the Abominable Snowman! 

is an original Clemens children's story on file with the Library of Congress (U.S.).

In this charming story Cornelius dares Buckey to pull one hair from the Abominable Snowman's head.  If Buckey can pull it off, Cornelius will pay him all the money in the world.. $10,010!  As Buckey pursues the Abominable Snowman he finds out not only does he want that hair from the Abominable one's head, he happens to like him too! 

..Meanwhile, down below in the snow covered cobblestone town, Corneilus sells tickets to the upcoming spectacle.. with no intention of losing his bet --

***

The author (Clemens portfolio 2013) will use the money to hire real illustrators to paint BB & the Abominable Snowman, as well as Cornelius, Scorpico and Varmoosh (domestic or foreign as work-for-hire).  Author will hire attorney, accountant, programmer, editor, independent marketing as well as license software from cloud providers (Adobe Creative Suite) for artists to convene.  Security will be tested on Author's computer and several cell phones in order to pre-test application publishing. Author will also pay for a pre-recorded actor (I pity the fool!) to read Buckey Bronco & the Abominable Snowman into text readers for children with low vision as read-along. 

Buckey's Abominable Snowman theme will have a Far East Asian look.  Once the illustrations are ready, a marketing blast will circulate to home/working parent volunteers or potential business associates.  Parents who are interested in test loading Buckey's downloadable book for safety, will be given free access to Buckey's full color publication before it's uploaded onto servers.  Parent volunteers may also establish security pools in social media and watch for content counterfeit. 

Buckey's holiday book will be a free, downloadable, color illustrated book available for all children to access.  Advertisers, or retailers will be sought for the dust jacket cover.

Please donate whatever you can!

**I am a real American Author, and Buckey Bronco and the Abominable Snowman is an original Clemens literary creation! The draft pencils you see are traces of various images, in preparation of Buckey's holiday book. 

(Clemens Research and Trunk Show is searching for a host country to sponsor its first Trunk Show.)  All rights reserved.

 

Author's Technical Skills:

Typist: Standard typist.
Systems: from DOS 4.0 to Microsoft OS8.
Software: Microsoft Word, Outlook, Power Point, Corel Word Perfect, Apple Mini Mac. (novice), Adobe Dreamweaver CS6, Photoshop, big data iManage, MACPAC.  
Code: HTML, CSS3.
Research:  Westlaw, LexisNexis, Pacer.
Paralegal: 6450 Declaration Compliant, ABA Dec. 2013
AA Degree, Spring 2013
Computer Sciences

Author's Writing Credits:

Screenwriter:  Liberty and Bash ( Chippawa Productions 1988), The Girl Gets Moe (Goldbar Entertainment 1997)

Lyrics: for Jefferson Starship (1979 (not credited), 1981 (credited))

story:
We need your help to keep Run to the Roundhouse, Nellie technologically vibrant!

Run to the Roundhouse, Nellie (www.run-to-the-roundhouse-nellie.com) is an online literary journal about memoir, launched 1 year ago. We wanted a journal that would highlight memoirs that may not have rocketed to the top of the charts but which had unusual merit, an engaging story, and fine writing. We are also interested in writers who experiment with the form.

And we wanted to talk with the authors. Memoir writing is a deeply personal genre; a good memoir brings the reader into someone else’s world, with a remarkable intimacy. We wanted to know more about these authors.

In the past year, we have evolved from interviewing 2 authors each month to a seasonal publication schedule, and interviews with 4 authors in each issue. 

We have 16 artists represented in our permanent gallery of self-portraits, and each artist has his or her own artist’s page.

We have an essay each issue written by a writer engaged in some manner with the process of Writing a Memoir.

And our Readers’ House section solicits short-memoir responses from readers to a topic in each issue. This has proved to be an exciting feature, and has drawn submissions from across the country, and even abroad.

Finally, also in Readers’ House, we run the occasional photographic free-for-all. In the Fall 2013 issue, we had a wonderful bulletin board display of 25 photographers and their self-portraits. We have another call planned for the Spring 2014 issue.

Run to the Roundhouse, Nellie has been successful well beyond our expectations!


Why we need funding

A year ago, Ben Rosenblum designed the journal’s clean aesthetics as well as the broad functionality of the site. Dolly Li was responsible for the detailed, micro-level functionality. 

After the launch, on our own and without professional assistance, we tried to master the website machinations. It was a nightmare—until we found Leonardo Souza, who is a magician with WordPress. He has helped us through many crises. We need Leo as our on-call Ace-in-the-Hole going forward, and we need to hire him to fix a few immediate problems, such as a glitch in the archiving. These hours of work will require funding.

Run, Nellie has been a labor of love for those involved: Susan T. Landry, the managing editor, Melissa Shook, contributing editor, and the people who step in each issue as guest writers and editors, as well as the artists. No one is paid—and there are no submission or subscription fees.


What you will receive if you can help us with funding

The writers and artists who have been affiliated with Run, Nellie thus far have been incredibly generous in supporting our effort to solicit funding. 

We have piles of books, all signed, some handmade; we have artwork; 

and we have a real treasure, an archival signed print by the photographer Patt Blue, of her mother, a pivotal character in Patt's memoir, Living On A Dream: A Marriage Tale.

Plus: a limited supply of Run to the Roundhouse, Nellie book tote bags! 

(Visuals of all perks are available. E-mail stlandry@run-to-the-roundhouse-nellie-com, state which level you are interested in, and a Word doc with description & image(s) will be e-mailed immediately.)

Please see the brief descriptions at each level. When there are multiple offerings at a specific premium level, please choose 1 of the offerings. Thank you!


Other ways you can help

If you cannot donate at a specified level, please give what you can.

If you cannot donate at all, please help us spread the word to others. Use any and all social media tools that you have at your disposal. If you have a blog or any media platform, please help us publicize Run to the  Roundhouse, Nellie. We need all the help—technological and otherwise—we can get!

 

Thank you so much!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Nikala Asante, a writer, educator, and activist from Houston, Texas. 

The genres within the book range from love to politics to speculative fiction.  It's a pretty awesome book, if I say so myself.  Others say so too.

“The collection of poems and short stories run the gamut of emotions and genres. It’s all thoroughly thought out and extremely well done. In a time, when so much work is dumbed down, it’s good to see someone challenging us to smarten up.” - Jon Goode, HBO Def Poet

Cola Rum, internationally renowned spoken word artist describes Asante’s writing style as “phenomenal, talented, and smart”.

My road to get here was one of triumph over tribulations.  I've been in all of the situations that society says would turn me into a statistic - growing up with a father in prison, molestation, domestic abuse, poverty, and so on.  Yet, by the grace of God and hard work, I am a Creative Writing student at University of Houston, I volunteer, tutor, and mentor in my community,  and advocate for better education standards for youth and international human rights, while I raise my 9 year old son.

I wouldn't take back any of my experiences, even the painful ones. They all made me into who I am today.  Re-Divining Self, my first full length collection of poetry and short stories, lyrically snapshots that process of becoming.

But I have to tell you, self-publishing online is tough.  When people meet me and hear me at a reading, they are eager to get their copies.  This is why I need your help.

I want to print 500 copies of Re-Divining Self to sell at readings throughout the year of 2014 in Houston, Dallas, Austin, San Antonio, New Orleans, Memphis, and Atlanta.  If I get enough support, I would of course be totally willing to expand this tour.  I really believe that the work within the book, such as Never Again, a poem about breaking the pattern of domestic violence, can help a lot of people.  (Preview the book Re-Divining Self Preview.)

What We Need 

  • Printing costs for 500 books
  • Costs for car rental, gas, food and hotel rooms while on tour.  As you may know, I'm still a struggling college student!

What You Get

  • Remember, no donation is too small or too large.  Everything helps.  Everyone who donates will receive a thank you card.
    o  $10: E-Copy of Re-Divining Self!  Super awesome for your PC or e-reader.

    o  $25: Physical Copy of Re-Divining Self!  You can take it with you anywhere. J

    o  $50: Physical Copy plus e-copy!  Now, you’ll never leave home without it.

    o  $100: Signed Copy plus e-copy.  Your book will contain a special handwritten message (about how awesome you are and how thankful I am).

    o  $1000: A Reading in your City plus previous gifts.  I will come to your city, within the United States, and hold a reading.

The Impact

  • Because I want to see Re-Divining Self really make change in the world, I will be donating 10% of all sales to the Houston Area Women's Center, an organization that helps individuals affected by domestic and sexual violence in their efforts to move their lives forward with shelter, counseling, and advocacy.
  • I hope to exceed my goal, so that I can do an even larger tour!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends!

And that’s all there is to it.

Thank you!

story:
'Madam President' making waves!

The project has been recognized by:

  • Geena Davis Institute on Gender in the Media
  • Indiegogo's International Women's Day Partnerships
  • Lipstick & Politics
  • Your Sorority Sister

--

(Breakdown of funds requested & why is below!)

About the Book:

Little girls can't be what they can't see. I've searched the internet to find a single children's book that depicts a grownup female president of the United States (as well as a first gentleman), and have been extremely hard pressed to find one among the endless pool of princess and fairy tale books.

My goal is to create a children's book titled 'Madam President,' that depicts a day in the life of the President, who is a strong and intelligent woman, and who is also a loving and dedicated mother and wife. I want nothing more than for girls to see what they can become, and I believe this needs to happen at a very young age. Before most girls can even speak, they are often exposed to princess films, and by the time they are two or three years old, they want nothing more than to own crowns and "pretty dresses." But the thing is, there are already countless books and movies about princess and princes, which is why most girls grow up searching for prince charming to complete their own fairy tale, rather than fully pursuing their own passions. 

I want young girls to know that they can have it all--they can be smart, funny, hardworking, and have fun all at the same time. My vision is to create a book that will inspire young girls to dream about wanting to be active leaders of our country, and know that there is power in the way they think and how they treat others, rather than the way they look.

I found an incredible Children's book production package through Createspace.com that would help me through the entire process of creating the book. For the exact price I'm aiming to raise for this project, Createspace will provide copy editing, cover design and production, and illustrations--all under my artistic direction. The best part is that they will also grant the book an ISBN number, and place it on the Amazon marketplace for sale around the world!

Once the book is completed, I want to partner with nonprofit organizations to spread the word and sell it to schools and libraries across the country. I fully intend to give every penny of the proceeds to select nonprofit organizations that support and empower young girls, to ensure that together we can build a better future for our country's daughters.

I believe with all of my heart that a book like this can shape our country's future, by inspiring young girls to want to be the next leaders of our towns, cities, states, and our country. I'm asking, wholeheartedly, for you to be a part of molding young minds toward leadership and intellect, and ensuring that each and every girl knows she can one day grow up to become Madam President.

Even a dollar can help to accomplish this goal, and it would be incredibly appreciated. Thank you for your time!

(Source for costs: Createspace.com)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Darren Sigler and I'm from Cleveland, Ohio. GO CAVS! I've been working on different stories for fictional heroes since I was just a boy. Gridlock is the final result of just a few of my ideas and hopefully it will be the first book of a series. 

My campaign is to help me receive professional editing services, and to cover promotional cost. Complete professional editing for a novel can cost about $2500 or more. Now if you're poor (like me) raising that much money in order to put out a quality product seems very bleak. That's why it's very important for me to at least raise enough funds to get the story edited. Also, I have a passion for fiction writing and after writing about sixty thousand words, I would really like to see people read and enjoy my work. 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm requesting $6000. $2500+ will be used to get the book edited from dla editors & proofreaders. I will use their 'complete editing w/comments' service. The rest of the funds will go toward promoting the book. If a raise enough funds I will purchase lulu.com's press release service which cost about $1400. 

If you want to check out my book before contributing email me at djs97491@gmail.com or send me a message here and I'll send you a PDF of the first four chapters. For everyone that contributes $25 or more I will immediately(or as soon as possible) send a PDF of the entire book(unedited). There's no waiting to receive that perk! I'm also giving away Tee Shirts or earrings, signed paperback and hardcover copies of the edited book and an audio book read by Morgan Freeman! Ok... the audio book is a lie, but the other perks are pretty cool.  

If I don't reach my goal, then I'll use whatever funds I receive to go toward editing the book. Editing comes first so that I can have a quality product. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? No problem! If you request on I'll still give you the PDF of the first four chapters and if you like what you read, then tell your friends about my campaign and my book. Heck if your friend contributes and gets the full PDF then steal his computer and read the whole thing. 

Someone who doesn't contribute, but tell 5 people about my campaign helps me more than a contributor that doesn't tell anyone. So if you can't contribute, but you think your friends and co-workers/classmates will like my book then tell them about it, it is much appreciated. 

Don't forget that Indiegogo offers lots of options to share my campaign through social media.

story:
Direction, Motivation, Courage: The Inspirational Life Story of Olympian Equestrian Darren M Chiacchia

Direction, Motivation, Courage is the working title of the inspirational autobiography of Olympian Darren M Chiacchia.

Darren's tremendous life-story has all the elements of a compelling book: poignant storytelling, passion, tragedy, transformation, courage, and hope.  

From a young age, Darren Chiacchia was struck by the dream of achieving Olympic glory. The title of the book is based on his guiding mantra since age 10, when he scrawled these words all over his schoolbooks: â€˜Darren M Chiacchia: Direction, Motivation, Courage.â€™  Beginning as a small town boy growing up in a middle class family Darren discovers his inner passion for horses and riding. At age 14, he sets a clear goal that many only dream of: to represent his country in the Olympic Games. From this day forward, Darren applies himself vigorously, with every ounce of diligence, grit, passion, and perseverance he can muster. He initiates a rigorous regimen, boldly forging opportunities in the equestrian world, and rising to the top. Through his efforts, Darrren excels at the sport, becoming a master Equestrian with unprecedented feats. Twenty years later, he accomplishes his childhood dream: competing in the 2004 Olympic Games.

More than an Olympic dream come true, this is a story of overcoming obstacles, breaking through boundaries, and actualizing human potential.

Interwoven with his Olympic story, are also Darrenâ€™s personal struggles and anecdotes, with life-wisdom stemming from his strong spiritual foundation. Tales as a unique, unicycle-riding kid who was very different from his peers, often feeling deep loneliness and solidarity; finding solace in caring for bunnies, squirrels, and other injured animals â€¦ A teen prevailing over bullying, coming to terms with, and finally, embracing his homosexualityâ€¦ A young adult, going from â€˜rags to riches,â€™ achieving a horse-business of unprecedented successâ€¦ The journey of becoming a Master Competitor, specializing in dressage and show-jumping...Becoming  A Master Trainer, having achieved most of his success with horses often rejected by other top riders; as well as a Master Coach to many exceptional students.

 But the story does not end here...after achieving his ultimate goal, and excelling at his sport, while flourishing as a top Trainer and Coach, Darren experiences a grave wake-up call, a literal 'fall from grace,' that forever alters his destiny.  This fall happens in the form of a treacherous riding accident, which puts him on the verge of death. He is ushered into a deep coma for many weeks. His prognosis is irreparable brain damage-- if he ever wakes up. During these weeks in a comatose-state, he undergoes a series of poignant and moving near-death-experiences, which transform his life upon waking.

 After his fall, in the next 42 days, Darren slowly begins to regain consciousness, in stages. Darren again triumphs against the odds, experiencing a remarkable recovery which the doctors describe as, â€˜nothing short of a miracle.â€™ Yet, his challenges are just beginning. Darren has yet to face the most courageous battles of his life.  Challenges that summoned his deepest courage, in a way that had never been tested before. Upon fully waking, Darrenâ€™s life â€“ as he knew it-- is over. He has only a vague idea of who he was. He is stripped of his identity and stature. Memories from the past are a blur.  This man, once a living example of success, esteem, strength, and independence-- is now completely dependent on others for basic physical care.  He is struck with extreme bouts of paranoia and sheer terror; frightening visions, and utter confusion. The fall from grace continues... As Darren slowly began to regain his physical and mental health and reclaim his identity, he comes up against nearly insurmountable obstacles, such as a dire health prognosis, and the demise of his business. 

 With his signature mantra of â€˜Direction, Motivation, Courageâ€™ Darren perseveres, rebuilding his life â€˜one baby step at a time.â€™ Yet, now holding a deepened spiritual wisdom, and awareness of the preciousness of life. Putting his philosophies to the test, he continues to have the courage to believe, â€˜Adversity is God smiling down on you.â€™ As the adage goes, like a Phoenix out of the ashes, from the depths of darkness, new life emerges. He is a living example of how challenges can be transformed into opportunities....and how sometimes the deepest darkness brings forth the brightest light.


The book will be written in first-person format by Darren, with co-writer Amy Gallagher offering editorial assistance. 


The Impact

Darren now uses his past challenges as fuel for greater life purpose. Following his accident, he achieves the remarkable feat of rising to the top again as an Equestrian, with his vision set on representing his country in international competitions. But he has done more than that. Not only has he returned to being a top competitor, he is also bringing more light to the relevant subject of Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI). TBI is gaining increased awareness in our society, due to the number of athletes suffering from varying degrees of brain injury, coupled with the tremendous number of injured veterans returning from the war overseas. The book will address the traumatic impact on both TBI victims and their families. Darren brings forward an awareness of how the entire family suffers from this injury; and offers guidance through these challenges. Darren is becoming increasingly involved in programs of awareness, education, and support for victims of TBI, and their families.

Darren's teen years of discovering and embracing his homosexuality also address issues of gay awareness, and teen bullying- both extremely relevant issues today. Having lived his life as an openly gay man who also endured severe bullying as a teen, Darren's story will serve as a guide and inspiration.


Direction, Motivation, Courage will appeal to a variety of niches and individuals: anyone who has held an Olympic dream, or a dream of excelling in what they love. The book will be a source of inspiration and guidance to those driven to follow their lifeâ€™s passion. The book will appeal to horse-lovers, or anyone who has known an intimate bond with an animal. Serious competitors of any sport. Entrepreneurs striving for success in doing what they love. Seekers interested in near-death accounts and spiritual principles. This book will speak to individuals in difficult circumstances, demonstrating that any challenge can be transformed into opportunity.

Overall, Direction, Motivation, Courage will appeal to anyone seeking greater meaning and purpose in their life.


Goal to Complete Project

Through Darren's engaging storytelling abilities, along with the professional editorial assistance of co-writer Amy Gallagher, the foundation of the book has already been laid. All recorded interview material and transcription has been collected. The outline of the book is complete, along with the book proposal, and first stage of writing. The book has received positive feedback from prospective agents and publishers. Our team is opting to raise for $7,500 to complete the writing and editing process of the book, and support marketing initiatives.

story:
ETA: Wow! Over $1000 in two days! Thank you all so much. I can't edit the target on here now that the fundraiser has started, but onwards - let's raise as much money as possible. If you could donate $1, $2... whatever you can, that would be amazing. Keep spreading the word. xx 

 

Hello!

My name's Jen [hi!] and I'm a writer and bookseller living in London, UK. I also have EEC Syndrome, which is a rare form of Ectodermal Dysplasia. New research has shown that, due to a fault in the p63 gene, people with EEC Syndrome can suffer progressive sight loss because of their corneas reproducing incorrectly. At the moment there is no cure for this. I wrote a blog post about me being told this recently over here. So, I'm doing a fundraising event to raise money for the research centres who are looking for a cure, and who are are also doing research into better understanding and helping out in other areas affected by EEC Syndrome.


What I'm Doing

I'm writing 100 poems in just one weekend: 5th & 6th November. I'll be posting them online as I write them over at 100poemweekend.blogspot.com. On the run up to this weekend, I'm asking people to give me tag words. You can suggest one by dropping me an email [link over on my blog], or tweeting me @aeroplanegirl. Each of the poems will be inspired by a tag word, and the person who gave me that tag word will be credited within the blog post.

[Previous to this challenge, I've had poems published in places like The Rialto, Poetry London, The Interpreter's House and Agenda. You can read some of those, over here.]

 

Where the Money is Going

EEC International research centres are doing all kinds of wonderful science-y things to try and find a cure for degenerative eye conditions [a cure which, if found, would not only benefit people with EEC but those with a whole range of different eye diseases]. EEC International also do work on lots of other things to do with clefting, cell mutation, p63, plastics, dermatology, hearing problems, all kinds of stuff. Only the other week Moorfields eye hospital in London [which is where I go], were given the go ahead to start trials on stem cell treatment for people with Stargardt's macular dystrophy, which causes progressive sight loss. This is all to do with retinas, a different ball game to corneas [EEC Syndrome], so separate from this particular problem, but it shows what money and research and science can do: wonderful things.

 

I would really love it if you could get behind this charity and sponsor me to provide you all with many/lots/plenty of pretty words. Through this page you can donate money - however much, however little. Tell your friends; spread the word. Thank you. Lots of love xx

 

* Exchange rate is currently approx. $1.6 -> £1.

 

--

story:
Hello sweet ones!

This is a fundraiser for my first ever book, Overflow: Tales of Butch-Femme!  It is a collection of short, erotic fiction written over the course of the last seven years that I'm self-publishing through Lulu.com.  These are stories I felt compelled to tell, that speak to my desire and the way I move through the world in a way that I don't often find in the "lesbian erotica" genre.  I wrote from a place of what I know and the marginality that I live with, so many of my characters are rural, working class, from a sub-cultural background, wired on the BDSM spectrum, curvy/fat, and dealing with intense emotional realities.  Okay, so there's also a fairy-tale in there, which is not as much from my lived perspective!

Here is a write up for Lulu, and some advanced praise:

Overflow is equal parts sweet romance and a kinky, smut-filled good time. Between its covers you will find eleven stories delving into the world of butch-femme love, sex, and power dynamics. These stories are raw and vulnerable, exploring the tenderness and brutality of BDSM sex, as well as the emotional healing possible. Sacchi Green says: “Miel Rose writes with passion and intensity from deep within the world of femmes and butches. Her fiction blends strength with vulnerability, raw sex with sensitivity, and pain with joy, depicted with both earthy realism and strikingly original lyricism. My personal favorite, perhaps because it was included in my anthology Lesbian Lust, is “August Crazies,” where Miel depicts the bdsm world of power exchange in scorching detail, at the same time illuminating the underlying complexities and desires with tenderness and no less heat. Each of these pieces offers fully-realized characters, evocative settings, and down-and-deliriously-dirty sex, and all of them stir both flesh and spirit.” 

Lulu/what are we doing here

So, for those of you who don't know, Lulu is a website that helps you self-publish and prints your book to order.  This means that you don't need to order a huge amount to be printed in one go, which is great!  It does mean that I have to pay about $8 plus shipping for each copy of my book that I want to either give to folks who helped out or have on hand for readings.  I'm hoping to fundraise some extra moola to cover the cost of 50 books plus shipping for these purposes, and get the book out to all you lovelies at the same time!  If by any chance extra is raised, then more books will be purchased and/or it will help me with travel costs to do readings farther afield. 

Perk it up

So the main perk is the book, of course.  

There is a $5 option for sweethearts who want to help out, but are low on funds or pervy butch-femme smut isn't their thing.  For that I will thank you profusely in a hand-made card.

Just added: now you have the option of getting the book for a $20 donation!  $25 also get you a 3 card set of my lovely and powerful sister's greeting cards!

For $50 and $100 donations, you will receive books as well as a hand embroidered hankie art piece by yours truly.  They take me between 3 and 8 hours to make and when I sell them they're priced between $30 and $80.  They are also smokingly hot, if I do say so myself.  Folks who chose this perk will receive their books by the end of February, but the hankies may be more like April.

Help of another kind

As with any other funding campaign, spreading the word is essential and so appreciated!  Please post on social networking sites, and if there are particular folks you know who would be interested, let them know about this project!

With so much love and appreciation,

xoxoxoxo

Miel Rose

 

PS. all photos are copyright © Dara Durost 2012

story:
Testimonial From Fearless Books Publishing...

"Dear Rob,

Thanks for the opportunity to read and assess the working draft of ENLIGHTENMENT EVERYONE. Your idea for a fellowship of those seeking enlightenment, based on Twelve Step programs, is original, intriguing, and beautifully fits the principals and ideals you profess. Your idea of offering readers supplementary guidance in the form of music to listen to, books to read, and movies to watch is creative, and could work extremely well. We feel most readers will enjoy the experience of listening to music, doing additional readings, and watching movies as ways to learn and understand your teaching – we enjoyed this ourselves. Your project has the potential to be quite useful to those seeking enlightenment. We commend you on your significant efforts thus far and on your noble ambition."

- Sari Friedman and D. Patrick Miller, Fearless Books

My Story

Thanks everyone for considering this campaign! My name is Rob Bundschu. About 12 years ago, I was living through a very challenging period of my life. I was drinking way too much and smiling way too little, and was still recovering from a severe personal crisis which had occurred several years prior. Thankfully, I reached a point where I had had "enough", and saught help. It was about then that I decided to travel to Florida and check into an addictions treatment facility. Soon after, I would be introduced to a 12 Step recovery program.

After following the program successfully for 5+ years, in particular working the 12 Steps, I had such a profound experience of happiness, healing and forgiveness for both myself and all my loved ones, that the idea occured to me that everyone could benefit from a Step recovery program, not just addicts.

Thus the idea for the book and program of Enlightenment Everyone was born.

What is Enlighenment Everyone?

Enlightenment Everyone is a new 13 Step program which I was inspired to create in order to help people achieve true happiness and peace. Although it is modeled after other 12 step programs, it is something entirely different. While other step programs seek to help people overcome an addiction to a particular substance or habit, Enlightenment Everyone is intended to help people overcome suffering altogether - or to achieve enlightenment. I've come to understand it is doable! The 13 steps will do this by gently guiding a person toward finding their own unique spiritual path, which will help them remove all the blocks to love within themselves.

Enlightenment Everyone is not a new religion or a cult. It is simply a new book/organization that has been formed in order to help people who want it to find peace in a world where peace seems to have no home.

Of course, I understand this new program will not be for everyone, but I believe there are a significant number of people today who are ready and willing to be a part of a program like Enlightenment Everyone.

About the Enlightenment Everyone Campaign

The world today seems to be out of control, scary, and uncertain. Turn on the news and we are bombarded with violence, scandal, and disillusionment. With volitile economies and governenments becoming less and less reliable, many of us are searching for a place or state of mind where there is comfort and certainty and peace.

This campaign is to help fund the publication of the main textbook that will be used in the Enlightenment Everyone program. I have contributed much in terms of time and money to this project, but I need a little more help to get it done. I need your help to finish this project!

Where Enlightenment Everyone is today...

  • After 3 years of writing and preparation, there is now a completed unedited manuscript

  • I hired Fearless Books and payed over $1000 to have the manuscript assessed professionally. As the quote above suggests, they feel the manuscript is worthy and has potential, but needs further development.

  • Enlightenment Everyone meetings began in late 2012! We meet for an hour every Monday. There are only two offical EE members at this moment. Many worthy projects have started with two, including the original 12 Step recovery program and the creation of A Course in Miracles.

  • The book is inteneded as a Self-published work, and will the be published under the label 'New Ordered World'.
  • When the time is right, I intend to create an offical non-profit organization under the name "Enlightenment Everyone".

Website: www.enlightenmenteveryone.org.

 

Limited Edition Co-Creator's Poster

Funding Details

I am seeking to raise $9,000 for the publication of the book. Below is a list of where the donations are going:

Professional Editing: I have contacted a great editor, and have reserved a time periond in early June to have the manuscript professionally edited. The cost is $3200. An additional round of editing may be required which would cost approximately $1000 more.

Publication of the book: Cost of publishing services include interior formatting, custom cover design, printing, ISBN purchases, etc. I am considering seveal options, including Amazon's Createspace, Wingspan Press, and Wyatt-MacKenzie Publishing. Cost of publication estimated to be $1000 - $2500.

Cost of Perks: Cost of books and posters given as perks for this campain: $1000 - $2000

Cost of Service: Service fee for using indiegogo.com: $400 - $800, depending on whether or not I reach my goal

Extra Revenue: If I am blessed to meet or exceed my campaign goal, all extra income will be used for Enlightenment Everyone purposes. Future plans include a custom website and creation of a non-profit organization.


My Heart

Dear Friends & Family,

This project has been the central focus of my life for the past five years, never leaving my mind for long during my normal daily living. I have faith that it has the potential to help many people find a way to greater peace and happiness in their lives. I know many of you are happy with your lives, and may not have any desire for or need for a program like EE. But I believe that many people out there are looking for something like Enlightenment Everyone, even if they are not aware of it.

Certainly there was a time when I "knew" I had no need for a Step program or anything like it. Yet in deep gratitude, I would learn I didn't really know what I needed. And fate and circumstances led me to a Step program, which had a profound positive impact on my life. And I've seen these programs have profound impacts on many others lives as well.

Thank you so much for taking the time to consider making a contribution. Any contribution you can make will be greatly appreciated!

In love and peace,

Rob
