story:
The Problem

For years, AirSafe.com has provided the traveling public with vital information about confusing and inconsistent security rules, poor inflight airline service, lost baggage, mystery fees and other things that frustrate and inconvenience air travelers. But because this information is available exclusively online, it is often out of reach just when you need it most...

  • An airline damaged your luggage, and you want to make sure that you ask the right questions and get the right paperwork filled out.
  • The gate agent announces your flight is cancelled, and you need to book an alternate flight quickly.
  • On the way to the airport, you realize you left your driver's license at home, and you need to know what alternative IDs the TSA will accept.
  • A TSA agent is conducting what you think is an inappropriate search, and you don't know how to respond to the situation.

All of these situations are covered by AirSafe.com, but if you can't get online, our information won't help you. If you had the information in your smartphone or your tablet device, you could find out what you need to know quickly.

The Solution: AirSafe.com plans to take the best of its online information and put it into a series of ebooks that anyone can download for free and keep on hand at all times. A traveler in trouble just turns on a smartphone and all the information he or she needs is available in an instant.

This is a solution that's based on a proven concept. Last year, AirSafe.com published the ebook AirSafe.com Baggage and Security Guide, and it was quite popular, with over 10,000 downloads in the first six months. This new series of ebooks will be much more useful, covering issues that are of great concern to literally millions of flyers.

The Project: The goal of the project is to use the insights gained from running AirSafe.com to create several ebooks, each of which covers a specific area of common air traveler concerns:

  1. Airline Complaints Do's and Don'ts - Will cover the basic rules and requirements that passengers must follow when they file a complaint against an airline, airport, or government agency.
  2. Travel with Children - Will include many of the common concerns parents face when flying with infants or children, plus key information for parents whose children need to fly when unaccompanied. Plus a review of the pros and cons of child safety seats.
  3. Dealing with common travel issues - This ebook will give very practical advice on how to deal with problems like lost bags, cancelled flights, air rage, and inappropriate behavior by security personnel.
  4. Once all three ebooks are completed, a fourth one containing all the content from the first three ebooks will also be published.

How the Money Will Be Used: This project seeks to collect $5,000, and all of the money will be used for professional services such as editing and ebook formatting, in order to ensure that the products will work with all popular ebook devices and smartphones, including the Kindle, Nook, iPad, and iPhone.

Marketing and Distribution: This project will use the same network of web sites, podcasts, mailing lists, and other marketing tools used to promote last year's successful ebook. Like the first ebook, the new ebooks will be available as free downloads from sites in the AirSafe.com network.

Project Management: The author of all of these ebooks, Dr. Todd Curtis, has been a published author since 2000, and has managed the publication of several books.

Project Timeline: Once funded, a new ebook would be available about every six weeks, with the first one published by August 2012 and the final one available in November before the holiday travel season.

About AirSafe.com 
Since 1996, AirSafe.com has provided airline passengers and airline professionals with insights on airline issues from baggage and customer  service to safety and security. In recent years the site has focused on providing passengers with information and advice that  allow them to deal with many of the most common air travel hassles. 

More Information: Visit books.airsafe.com to find out more about this project and more about the work of AirSafe.com.

story:
Our Story

In May of 2010 I joined Facebook out of curiosity, and quickly learned that I didn't have to be a saint, guru or master to recognize, enjoy and spread the beauty, wonder and glory of God's divine love. I discovered that I had a God given gift; an ability to uplift and inspire others via the written word.

4 months later (16 hours a day, 6 days a week) I published Love's True Home; a contemporary literary gem sparkling with a unique blend of Sri Gawn Tu Fahr's (my pen name) irreverent humor, timeless wisdom, insightful prose and eloquent poetry. Hundreds of original, inspirational passages provide succor from the trials and tribulations of everyday life, elevating every heart to breathtaking worlds of adventure, love and joyous spiritual freedom.

Love's True Home can only be purchased via online bookstores; it is not available in 'physical' bookstores.

My goal is to get the attention of a 'real world publisher', and get Love's True Home into those bookstores, thereby reaching more human hearts.


The Impact

I didn’t set out to write Love’s True Home. I slowly became aware that it was writing me, so I surrendered and became the Spirit’s pen.

I have received much unsolicited praise for the words in Love's True Home, and collected more than 20,000 testimonials. I have been blessed with a God given gift; spirit uses me to uplift others, and I am grateful for the opportunity to be a channel for God's divine love. Please read hundreds of glowing reviews on my website.


What We Need & What You Get

My goal is have Love's True Home in as many bookstores as possible. Love's True Home is only available online and cannot be found in any real world bookstores.

My 35,000 friends,fans, and followers on Facebook and Twitter have made me realize that Love's True Home is destined to be a bestseller, and uplift millions of hearts worldwide. I would love to send you one or more autographed copies.

With the money that I raise, I intend to purchase copies of Love's True Home at wholesale from my online publisher, meet my obligations to those who have contributed, and then, embark on a one person promotional book tour across Canada and the USA. Eventually I will find the right publisher along the way.

Although I am looking to raise $10,000, there is in fact no limit; the more the merrier.

I am not on a mission. I am love's mission.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me reach more loving hearts by inviting your friends to lovestruehome.com.

story:
On a daily basis, we are bombarded with negativity that overwhelm us and bring us down. The news of crime, depravity, and inhumanity dominate headlines. Recently, it was reported that a group of teenagers taunted and video-recorded a drowning man rather than offer him help or even call 911. That pessimism is contagious. At Elevate Magazine, we feel we have a choice, and it is time to change that dynamic. Focusing on positive  stories and news that uplift us will cause a positive ripple effect. Watch the moving video below, "The Lord's Prayer" by Steph Carse, published in this campaign with his approval, to understand the message, then continue reading the rest of our campaign story to realized what we aim to do and the role that you will play. 

Mission

Our mission is simple: to serve God, help others, and grow together. Elevate, and its Spanish language edition, Elevar, are publications of Sotomayor Media Creations LLC. The goal of these two publications are to bring awareness of the various ministries in North Central Florida, which elevate people out of despair into hope, happiness, and fulfillment of their purpose; as well as cover faith-based topics of conversation and interest that shape our lives, our values, and most of all – our relationship with God and with one another.

Motivation

Elevate and Elevar founder, John Sotomayor, has been very open about his testimony. He is a recovering alcoholic who had tried on his own to battle alcoholism, but repeatedly failed and fallen into a repetitious cycle. He states that when he allowed God to take control, his recovery finally began. That, he says, is his first miracle. John references a second miracle. In 2008, he traveled to Pakistan on a journalism assignment. On that journey, he reluctantly accepted a haircut with a razor shave. Several months after his return to the United States, a routine medical checkup revealed he became infected with Hepatitis C. He is sure it was the shave with a razor blade that exposed him. By a twist of fate, his stay at a rehab facility prior to his trip to Pakistan tested him for any and all contaminants, including Hep C. He was negative at the time. His research afterward revealed that Hep C is epidemic in Pakistan and one of the travel warnings was to avoid razor shaves.

In 2014, news spread of a cure. For a moment, a glimmer of hope. But the cure was expensive. His insurance refused to pay for the Harvoni treatment, despite the law that required them to do so. A class action lawsuit ended in a settlement that required his insurance to treat him. They still refused. Before 2016 would come to an end, God presented more people into John’s life that would come to his aid. The Hep C specialist at Ocala Gastroenterology worked with the pharmaceutical company in Tampa and two medical foundations which enrolled John in a program that got him his Harvoni medication. By February 14, 2017, his two-month treatment was done. A month earlier, the initial tests revealed the virus was wiped out of his system. Three months later, a second test confirmed the finding and he was officially declared cured in May 2017. John testifies he saw clearly now what was happening. This was God at work, through the work of men. All glory goes to God.

“Up until a few years ago Hep C was incurable, a dead sentence. Recently, a cure became available but I had to endure a bureaucratic battle to get treatment. Harvoni treated me, but it was the people who God put in my life that saved me. My mission is to serve God by serving others.”  ~ John Sotomayor, publisher and executive editor, Elevate and Elevar Magazines 

Method

Our magazine will stand apart and revolutionize faith-based publishing by two ways.

First, Elevate and Elevar magazines apply faith in everyday life. Most faith-based publications are presented as a journal, written primarily by theologians. They read like a medical journal written by medical professionals, or a legal journal written by lawyers. Our content features faith applied to everyday situations we can all relate to.

Second, our focus is centered on faith in action, meaning people helping people. It’s in our mission statement! Our mission, as stated before, is to serve God, help others, and grow together. Our goal is to bring awareness of ministries and non-profit work done by people that elevates others out of despair into hope, happiness, and fulfillment of purpose. We are not interested in discussion on denominational differences. Or differences in religious practices. We are solely concerned with the primary message sent by God.

That message:

Our job is NOT to judge,
Our job is NOT to decide who is deserving,
Our job IS
                lift the fallen
                restore the broken
                encourage the weary
                feed the hungry

Magazine in Motion 

Elevate Magazine believes in giving back. To date, the creative team behind Elevate has sponsored the 2016 5th Annual Prayer Walk in Ocala, been a Gold Sponsor of the 2017 Habitat for Humanity of Marion County Strawberry Festival, and assisted collaborator U.N.I.T.Y Services Group distribute 15,000 lbs of food at Evergreen Elementary in Ocala. 

(video first published on our website in October 2016) 

 

Make a Statement

Having Elevate or Elevar print magazine laying on your desk, or prominently displayed in your reception area will connect with your visitors.

  1. It’s a conversation starter about faith-based ideals and action you find important.
  2. It’s an artform, lost when displayed from a screen.
  3. It says that even though you are part of the fast-paced world of digital, there is still a part of you that likes the feel of printed pages, and the look of images on a page.

Editorial Calendar

PREMIER ISSUE – October 2017
Spiritual Lifestyle – The Value of Faith in Action and upon Our Daily Life

ISSUE 2 – January 2018

Soulful Sounds – The Influence of Music on our Faithful Way of Life

ISSUE 3 – April 2018

Faith in Action – Ministries that Help Overcome Life Challenges

ISSUE 4 – July 2018

Youth Ministry – Guidance for our Next Generations

Company Overview

John Sotomayor is the president and CEO of Sotomayor Media Creations LLC, the parent company of Elevate, founded in Florida in January 2008. Sotomayor has an extensive career in media, honed as president of Sotomayor Media Creations, LLC. Clients include several Florida publications, such as: Florida Trend, Florida Travel & Life, Gainesville Today, Ocala Star Banner, and North Central Florida Business Report, and national corporations, such as Best Version Media, which he served as content coordinator for four publications: Country Club Living, Southeast Neighbors, Downtown Neighbors and Innovation Ocala. Sotomayor and his business have won numerous media awards, including Minority Business of the Year, Journalist of the Year, and the Mary Sue Rich Diversity Award by the City of Ocala. Sotomayor was a staff writer for five publications of Akers Media Group: Lake & Sumter Style, The Villages Edition Style, Healthy Living, Lake Business Magazine and Welcome to Lake. Previously, Sotomayor worked at Ocala Magazine as executive editor, which he began as associate editor. He founded, produced, and hosted a radio talk show called: Ocala Magazine Radio with John Sotomayor on WOCA 1370 AM/96.3 FM. His work won numerous awarded by the Florida Magazine Association, Florida Press Cub and Society of Professional Journalists. Sotomayor served on numerous boards/councils and led the Hispanic Business Council for two consecutive terms.

The Elevate Magazine team comprises a wealth of creative talent, beginning with multi-award winning creative director, Joe Deleon, and including photographer, Conan Segrest, graphic designer, Ashley Burdeshaw, outreach director, Crystal Jewell-Maksou, social media manager, Tai DeMaris, copy editor, Nicole Gomez, and writers: Michelle Clark, Jarod Kintz, Trisha Hiatt, Michael Simpson, Eric Skinner, Lisa Rios, D.R. De La Croix, and Bill Dodd. For complete biographies, visit our website, http://elevatemagazine.us/?page_id=13

Our advisory board is composed of some of the most influential spiritual leaders in our local area, including: Andy Haynes of The Joy FM, Tanya Walker of DayStar Radio, Pastor Joshua Sarmiento, Theresia Jackson, Rondo Fernandez, founder of Feed the Need (a project of Ocala Outreach Foundation), Pastor Louis Cherubin of Kingdom Revival Church, and David Jacola of Child Evangelism Fellowship. For their complete biographies, visit our website: http://elevatemagazine.us/?page_id=235

We Need Your Participation

Talent alone will not produce a magazine. We need to build a fellowship of  community supporters, who assist with story ideas and  financial contributions. Your financial contributions will go toward printing costs, paying our graphic designers, writers, and photographers, as well as our outreach director and other staff. We need drivers to deliver the magazines, an accountant to manage the budget, software programs to develop the magazine, and an expense budget to go out into the community and gather the stories important to you.

Cost Breakdown 

The $30,000 will be used to pay the following:

Independent contractors who provided content = $10,000
Printing ($9,000 for Elevate, $3,000 for Elevar) = $12,000
Shipping = $250
Indiegogo fees (services + processing at 8.5% of $30,000) = $2,500
Distribution of magazine copies = $1,000

Additional graphic design for any ads that come in = $400

The following are additional costs to operate Elevate and Elevar as quarterly magazines:
Insurance (Errors & Omissions) = $750
CEP membership (annual) = $600
Accountant = $2,500

Total = $30,000

To publish a digital magazine only, we would need to only cover the independent contractors who provided content: designers, photographer, writers ($10,000) + Indiegogo fees of $11,000 ($935) = $10,935

Since Indiegogo offers a flexible plan, we can raise $11,000, not $30,000 and still have something to publish, so that all the hard work done over an entire year is not lost. The work of those over the year include: our designers: Joe Deleon, Amber Laudicina, and Ashley Burdeshaw; photographer Conan Segrest; copy editor, Nicole Gomez; and our writers: Michelle Clark, Jarod Kintz, Trisha Hiatt, and Lisa Rios. Plus Crystal Jewell-Maksou, who served as our outreach director.

NO PROFIT is being made by the publisher to launch this magazine or by the crowdfunding campaign. John Sotomayor has stated it publicly he is motivated to do this to glorify God. To him, this is a labor of love. 

Please help us get the work they helped produce published, at least in digital magazine format, so that their efforts are not wasted, and Elevate and Elevar magazines could be launched, so once seen by the public in mass, it may have a fighting chance to succeed and take flight.

To show our gratitude, we developed a series of perks based on participation level. It does not matter whether you contribute a little or a lot, every level counts, and is considered a part of the Elevate fellowship.

story:
¿Qué?

La feria humana ofrece una imagen descarnada de la sociedad actual, una oda a las segundas oportunidades encabalgada sobre una trama de redención, con un estilo duro y frío.

El día en el que Charly ve cómo se cierne sobre él un cataclismo se tropieza con Mígue, un amigo de la niñez. Este encuentro le lleva a pensar que una circunstancia relacionada con él es la culpable de su desdicha, de sus adicciones. Charly quiere ser una persona normal, quiere dejar de ser lo que es, motivo por el que cree que tiene que volver a contactar con Mígue, para retomar su vida desde el punto en el que comenzó a torcerse. Y así lo hace, a sabiendas de que, si Mígue se entera de que en la adolescencia los traicionó a él y a su familia, no le quedará esperanza alguna por convertirse en una persona normal.
          Pero el día a día de Charly tiene otras aristas. La más importante, el trato al que ha llegado con su colega Nando para participar en el próximo trapicheo que El Americano, un traficante de droga, está preparando. Y también la escabrosa relación que mantiene con su madre y su padrastro. Por no hablar del trío de fantasmas que le suele acompañar a todas partes.
          Así pues, Charly se ve obligado a llevar una doble vida, ocultando sus adicciones y sus sucias costumbres a Mígue, el mejor amigo de su infancia, el único mejor amigo de su vida. Como también se ve obligado a lidiar con la ansiedad, con los traumas que arrastra desde la niñez, con los fantasmas y con nuevos sucesos y sentimientos, como el del amor hacia una mujer prohibida.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Aitor Martín.

Nacido en el punto más álgido de un invierno de los de antes, de los de las nevadas hasta las rodillas, de los de cuatro meses de cielos encapotados, de los de frío de verdad, de los oscuros. Tal vez sea el motivo por el que sus primeros escritos trataban sobre la parte más miserable del ser humano, más oscura, como, por ejemplo, el relato «Despierto» (primer premio en el I concurso de relatos de terror del Festival de las Ánimas). Hasta pasada la adolescencia vivió en un barrio en que sus calles eran castillos, donde, paradójicamente, residía gente humilde. Esas calles están reflejadas en su segunda novela, La feria humana (editorial Tandaia). Aunque no es el único caso, pues en el relato La semilla del odio (primer premio en el XII concurso El color de mi piel), muchos de los rincones descritos en esta historia contra el racismo surgen de esas mismas calles, así como en otras de sus narraciones.

Cierto es que pronto abandonó su barrio, y más tarde también su ciudad natal, para asentarse en una urbe de la costa mediterránea, hecho que influyó, no tanto por el cambio como por el contraste, en sus historias. Si bien es verdad que aquellas calles de su niñez y adolescencia siguen siendo la base donde se afincan la mayoría de sus tramas, no cabe duda de que salir de ellas le inspiró para escribir sobre nuevos temas, como el de igualdad entre mujeres y hombres, con el que ha conseguido ser finalista en dos concursos de la editorial Acen y participar en un par de sus antologías; o como el del género de la tragicomedia, con los cuentos «Quiero ser otro» (antología de relatos cortos Ulises y Penélope, relatos tejidos en red de Espacio Ulises) y «Todos satisfechos» (antología de relatos cortos Ulises en el Festival de Cannes de la editorial Playa de Ákaba).

Tras la cortina, una novela negra con la que tuvo la suerte de ser finalista en dos concursos (VI premio de novela Irreverentes y III premio Blue Bayou de novela negra), no hubiera sido posible escribirla sin vivir en una ciudad más cosmopolita de la que provenía. No obstante, ninguna experiencia es inútil, y todas dejan huella y consecuencias. Por eso, en su nueva novela, La feria humana, conjuga las calles en las que se crio con un presente más maduro, para dar a conocer una historia de superación con tintes de novela negra.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Una ráfaga de aire fresco me revolvió la melena, las mismas corrientes empujaron una colosal nube grisácea. Su sombra se proyectó sobre la gigantesca cruz de acero que coronaba el punto más alto de la montaña a la que me había trasladado. Una bolita marrón, que no era otra cosa que excremento de oveja, se deslizó sobre la roca rugosa que pisaba en una disparatada carrera hacia ninguna parte.
          Sentado en una de las crestas de la mole, junto al precipicio, el penetrante aroma del tomillo me había abierto el apetito. Engullía un bocadillo de sardinas enlatadas, a la par, admiraba un paisaje de juguete: camiones y coches tan diminutos como cajas de cerillas que atravesaban interminables franjas negras; conjuntos de casitas con apariencia de piezas del Monopoly con las fachadas blancas y los tejados anaranjados; cajas rectangulares de zapatos que en verdad eran pabellones y que formaban un polígono industrial; parches marrones, verdes o amarillos de líneas rectas que consistían en campos de labranza; y mucho más allá, casi donde se perdía la mirada, junto al horizonte, una gran mancha borrosa con una estela parda sobre ella, o lo que era lo mismo, la urbe cubierta por un inmenso techo de polución.
           Había procurado alejarme de la realidad, no sólo físicamente, como había hecho al viajar a la montaña, también mentalmente. Se podría decir que lo que intentaba era purgar mi espíritu.
           Por primera vez veía el mundo como él me veía a mí, minúsculo. Allí subido, respirando aquel aire tan distinto, me creí ridículo. Era increíble que allá abajo las personas ni siquiera existiesen, que fuesen puntos móviles y aleatorios, era como si yo fuese el único humano».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Aitor Martín vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Aitor Martín.
Nacido en el punto más álgido de un invierno de los de antes, de los de las nevadas hasta las rodillas, de los de cuatro meses de cielos encapotados, de los de frío de verdad, de los oscuros. Tal vez sea el motivo por el que sus primeros escritos trataban sobre la parte más miserable del ser humano, más oscura, como, por ejemplo, el relato «Despierto» (primer premio en el I concurso de relatos de terror del Festival de las Ánimas). Hasta pasada la adolescencia vivió en un barrio en que sus calles eran castillos, donde, paradójicamente, residía gente humilde. Esas calles están reflejadas en su segunda novela, La feria humana (editorial Tandaia). Aunque no es el único caso, pues en el relato La semilla del odio (primer premio en el XII concurso El color de mi piel), muchos de los rincones descritos en esta historia contra el racismo surgen de esas mismas calles, así como en otras de sus narraciones.
Cierto es que pronto abandonó su barrio, y más tarde también su ciudad natal, para asentarse en una urbe de la costa mediterránea, hecho que influyó, no tanto por el cambio como por el contraste, en sus historias. Si bien es verdad que aquellas calles de su niñez y adolescencia siguen siendo la base donde se afincan la mayoría de sus tramas, no cabe duda de que salir de ellas le inspiró para escribir sobre nuevos temas, como el de igualdad entre mujeres y hombres, con el que ha conseguido ser finalista en dos concursos de la editorial Acen y participar en un par de sus antologías; o como el del género de la tragicomedia, con los cuentos «Quiero ser otro» (antología de relatos cortos Ulises y Penélope, relatos tejidos en red de Espacio Ulises) y «Todos satisfechos» (antología de relatos cortos Ulises en el Festival de Cannes de la editorial Playa de Ákaba).
Tras la cortina, una novela negra con la que tuvo la suerte de ser finalista en dos concursos (VI premio de novela Irreverentes y III premio Blue Bayou de novela negra), no hubiera sido posible escribirla sin vivir en una ciudad más cosmopolita de la que provenía. No obstante, ninguna experiencia es inútil, y todas dejan huella y consecuencias. Por eso, en su nueva novela, La feria humana, conjuga las calles en las que se crio con un presente más maduro, para dar a conocer una historia de superación con tintes de novela negra.
¿Por qué?
Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:
«Una ráfaga de aire fresco me revolvió la melena, las mismas corrientes empujaron una colosal nube grisácea. Su sombra se proyectó sobre la gigantesca cruz de acero que coronaba el punto más alto de la montaña a la que me había trasladado. Una bolita marrón, que no era otra cosa que excremento de oveja, se deslizó sobre la roca rugosa que pisaba en una disparatada carrera hacia ninguna parte.          Sentado en una de las crestas de la mole, junto al precipicio, el penetrante aroma del tomillo me había abierto el apetito. Engullía un bocadillo de sardinas enlatadas, a la par, admiraba un paisaje de juguete: camiones y coches tan diminutos como cajas de cerillas que atravesaban interminables franjas negras; conjuntos de casitas con apariencia de piezas del Monopoly con las fachadas blancas y los tejados anaranjados; cajas rectangulares de zapatos que en verdad eran pabellones y que formaban un polígono industrial; parches marrones, verdes o amarillos de líneas rectas que consistían en campos de labranza; y mucho más allá, casi donde se perdía la mirada, junto al horizonte, una gran mancha borrosa con una estela parda sobre ella, o lo que era lo mismo, la urbe cubierta por un inmenso techo de polución.           Había procurado alejarme de la realidad, no sólo físicamente, como había hecho al viajar a la montaña, también mentalmente. Se podría decir que lo que intentaba era purgar mi espíritu.           Por primera vez veía el mundo como él me veía a mí, minúsculo. Allí subido, respirando aquel aire tan distinto, me creí ridículo. Era increíble que allá abajo las personas ni siquiera existiesen, que fuesen puntos móviles y aleatorios, era como si yo fuese el único humano».
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Aitor Martín vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.
Política de Privacidad

story:
THE INSPIRATION

My name is Rachel and I’m a documentary photographer. Today, I'm putting myself on the assignment I've only been able to fantasize about until now. Two years ago sitting in my overpriced apartment in Southern California I was fed up with my obsessive fixation to my smartphone and laptop rather than the people in my community. I decided to downsize-- to remove the excess in my life to discover how to really connect in our overstimulating world today.

For two years I have been living on my 27ft sailboat in Marina Del Rey and relating to an overlooked community of "off-gridders" living just like me. My boat has been more than my alternative home but my inspiration for the project, Connected Off-the-Grid. 

I was asking myself, "How do we strike a balance in our society today with the media manipulation and cost of living programming our everyday decisions? " 

THE PROJECT

Connected Off-the-Grid  is a multimedia photo project that explores a collection of people living the new "American Dream", a population that is plugged in and out of society at the same time. 

For the past year I have used my camera and audio recorder to collect stories from numerous people giving up the chase of the old American Dream and finding happiness in living creatively. Giving up the "McMansion" or extra shoe closet seems like a sacrifice to most Americans, but these people have found a real balance to life. This select group of people are living smaller and bigger at the same time-- they are connected to humanity, nature, and the internet.


The people I am meeting...


Live in nature...


Use their laptops to look up astrological charts...


Invite friends over for dinner on their iPhones...

Brush their teeth on the water...

Plant mobile gardens on their rooftop van...

Dance at sunset next to the ocean... 

Sail their homes in their very own fleet...

And create their own wood shop next to their favorite marina...


THE JOURNEY

On August 1st, 2015  I will start by traveling all throughout California, off the beaten path through high dessert, national forests, city marinas, coastal and mountain towns in search of unseen fascinating stories. Each person I meet will be engaged in their chosen livelihood using recognizable technology in innovative situations and circumstances.



YOUR CONTRIBUTION
You will help me mark a time in history by recording the stories of Americans that are paving the way of our future. 

WHERE THE MONEY GOES
Since I will be leaving my job for two months to pursue a project that is my pure passion, I will be out of work for two months. My goal for this campaign is to raise $3,000 to make up for this lost income. The funds raised by the campaign will go towards the basics of the trip.
Gas: $600
Food: $1,000
Camera equipment and other gear : $700
Regular monthly expenses: $700

THE IMPACT

This project is valuable to the entire world because if we keep moving in the direction we are we could ruin our planet and lose connection with each other. It's getting harder for anyone following their passions to afford the living expenses we are faced with today. If we educate ourselves on alternative ways of living we can see the possibilities that exist to have a balanced life in today's society.

Like with The Mirror, Mirror Project ( http://www.themirrormirrorproject.com/ ) and work from my other series', Homeless with Technology  (http://www.rachelbujalski.com/), my goal is for all people, no matter their background, to appreciate our differences and see that we are all one and the same at the basic core. This project shows the reality of people living small, staying connected to their beliefs and each other, and shows us how we don't need the excess material items to be happy. 

THE BOOK AND EXHIBIT

Upon my return from my trip, I will have enough material for a full multimedia exhibition complete with photographs and audio interviews. These works will also be included in a book titled, Connected Off-the-Grid. 


Risks & Challenges

Living out of my Toyota Corolla for two months will definitely be a challenge as it is slightly more compact than my boat. My boat has definitely prepared me for this journey but this will be a completely new experience for me. 

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign is not only helping make my trip possible but it's a great way to share what I'm doing with you. If you can spread the word in any way (repost this link on your social media) OR if you know of someone living off the grid and you think I should meet them, please email me here: rachel@rachelbujalski.com 

You can follow me along my journey on my Instagram and Facebook here: 

https://www.facebook.com/rbujalski

https://instagram.com/rachelbujalski/

The final images will be posted on my website: http://www.rachelbujalski.com/ and the official site http://connectedoffthegrid.com/

story:
From Hugh Hayes, the author:

Hi. My name is Hugh Hayes. The Friends of Finsbury Park are celebrating the 150th anniversary of the opening of Finsbury Park this summer. As part of the celebrations they’ve asked me to update the history of the park that I wrote nearly 20 years ago. This new version will come right up to the present day and be 16 pages longer. It will include more about Hornsey Wood House that was pulled down to make way for the park, more about the reservoir under the park, details about the 6 million pounds spent on the park in the 00s, and all the famous people who have visited the park from Sylvia Pankhust to Bob Dylan. Parks are such important places, and Finsbury Park with its amazing history is a very special place visited by over a million people every year. So please help the Friends celebrate the anniversary, and pre-book your copy of my revised book A Park for Finsbury. As before, there will be a limited print, and the first edition is no longer available, so grab your copy now. Any profits from the sale of the book will go to the Friends of Finsbury Park which is a registered charity. Thanking you in advance.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise over £8,000 to cover the writing, design, print and editing costs of the book. We've already been able to raise about half of that money through grants and offers from generous individuals. However, we're still several thousand short and so I'm seeking your help to cover our editing and printing costs so that we can get the book to print in time for the 150th anniversary of the park in August. We're therefore giving you the chance to pre-order copies of the book, so that you'll be the first to get it once it's off the press! 

  • Pre-order a copy of the book for just £10, including free UK delivery;
  • Pre-order a signed copy of the book, and get a ticket to the book launch in August for £15;
  • If you're kind enough to support us generously by giving £50, we'll include your name in the acknowledgements section of the book, and you'll get three signed copies and two tickets to the book launch.

We really hope we can make our £2,000 initial target towards funding this book. However, if we don't make that target, meaning we can't fund the book, all donors will be refunded, so your money will not be going to waste. If we do make our target, the money raised will be passed on to the Friends of Finsbury Park, which will be used to help cover print and editing costs.

What's going in the book?

Amongst many other new additions, there will be further images of Horsey Wood House as it changed through the 18th and 19th Century, until it was pulled down to make way for the Park and new theories about who it was who dug out the lake in the late 18th century.  There will be new memories about the Park, including the Black Shirt’s demonstration in the park in the 1930’s, and the “speakers Corner”. There will be images of the reservoir and of the old café, details of where the bombs landed in the second World War, the £600000 spent on the park in the noughties and the fight by the Friends to have the income derived from leasing the Park by Haringey Council to be spent on the Park. All profits will go to the Friends of Finsbury Park which is a registered charity.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're grateful for every pre-order of the book you make, but we also need to get the word out to as many people as possible, so please do consider tell your friends and neighbours, and sharing our campaign to social media. 

Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

This is my first book and first crowdfunding campaign. The fact that I'm doing this is a giant step for me and wouldn't be possible if I hadn't done some difficult work, this year, to break through barriers that had been holding me back for many years. I'm excited about the future, now, and getting all of my various creative projects moving forward. Thank you for helping me to get the ball rolling and publish my first book! All sales revenue will go back to my contributors until they are paid back in full, so this is really just a loan!

What We Need & What You Get

I am doing all of the layout of the pages, myself, but need to raise at least $2,500 to pay the artist for illustrations and an additional $2,500 to pay for printing and delivery of books to supporters and retailers. Anything over the $5,000 I seek will go toward the marketing of the book and the recording of my companion song, "You're a Mean One, Mr. Trump." All revenue comes back to you, so it's really just a loan.

The Impact

During dark times such these, it is important to create art that helps people to deal with the daily onslaught of bad news by lightening things up and giving them something to laugh about. 

Risks & Challenges

I'm hoping to be able to get this book out in time for the holiday shopping season, but need to move quickly, which is why I need your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help with financial support, I would be grateful if you would share this campaign with friends who might have the resources and desire to help. Thank you!!

story:
Beyond the Halls: An Insider’s Guide to Loving Museums includes a brief history of museums and explores the present nature of these institutions, while providing thought-provoking ways to interact with them. 

My name is Mackenzie Finklea and I am the author of Beyond the Halls. What's missing out there in the world right now is a book about museums for people not in the industry. I want to write something compelling that even my best engineering friend would want to read because they're interested, and not out of friendly obligation. I want this to be something that any museum, big or small, historical or scientific, would want to put in their gift shop. More importantly, I seek to change the way people think about and experience museums.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will find something that interests you. You can open the book to any section, and find something tailored to your unique personality and background. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for museums in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you have more memorable experiences inside museums, and more thought provoking discussions beyond the halls.

In this book, you'll learn about the history of museums and their current fight to thrive in the tourism industry:

  • Stories about my personal museum adventures.
  • Thought-provoking questions and interactive exercises.
  • Fascinating histories of individuals and institutions in the industry.

 

You will love this book if you are a museum professional or enthusiast. You will also love this book even if you hate museums or never go to them. 

Beyond the Halls is a non-fiction book that speaks to museum lovers and haters alike who are looking at discovering the history of museums and dynamic nature of the industry for the first time.

 

The Book - Beyond the Halls: An Insider’s Guide to Loving Museums

This book addresses three main topics; the history of museums, the present challenges, and future possibilities. In order to cater to several unique types of people that might read this book, the book is written in 7 parts.

Part 1, the Novice, contains Chapters 1-5. Part 1 explores what museums are and introduces ways for the museum novice to interact with them.

Part 2, the Historian, contains Chapters 6-10. You’ll find an introduction to various types of museums, what they are and how they came to be the respected, and the cultural phenomenon they are today.

Part 3, the Curator, contains Chapters 11-14. Curators already have gone through a great deal of formal schooling to be experts in their field. Part 3 seeks to provide a fresh perspective on curatorial practices and ideals.

Part 4, the Skeptic, contains Chapters 15-19. If you’re hesitant to buy into or hate museums, part 4 is for you. Part 4 takes an honest look at why museums exist and why they even matter. Museums are vibrant and exciting places for learning and, believe it or not, fun; now more than ever.

Part 5, the Businessman, contains Chapters 20-22. At the end of the day, museums are a business: many of them are not for profit. They live and die in the tourism industry. Part 5 examines the current state of museums as they struggle to compete in their market.

Part 6, the Activist, contains Chapters 23-26. Museums have a bit of a troubled history, but museums in the contemporary world are making changes to be more inclusive and culturally conscious. For the ones that aren’t, that’s where the activist comes in.

Part 7, the Enthusiast, contains Chapters 27 and 28. Finally, the book ends with notes about my personal experience with and enthusiasm for museums. I am already on the museum-loving bandwagon, and I want you to join me.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover art
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Mackenzie Finklea is an American Anthropologist and life-long museum enthusiast. She is a young professional who graduated from the University of Texas at Austin with a Bachelor of Arts in Anthropology, a minor in Architecture, and a certificate in Museum Studies. She was recently hired at the Bryan Museum in Galveston, Texas in the summer of 2019. In April of 2019, she was invited to speak at the TEDx conference at UT Austin about her research on Internet Memes and cyberculture. She has a long history of previous leadership roles and a vibrant fascination with displays of human culture.

Mackenzie wrote this book because she believes that museums are special part of human culture. She finds the ways that people display their lives fascinating and enriching to her life. Everywhere she goes, and every time she travels, Mackenzie finds herself off the beaten path and fully immersing herself in the local culture as well as visiting as many museums as possible along the way. Mackenzie wants people to cherish and admire museums as much as she does.

Mackenzie is a native Texan, born-and-raised. She’s lived in College Station, Houston, Austin, and now Galveston; where she enjoys vibrant sunrises and walks on the beach with her lovable shepard-mix, Reese. Even though she only recently moved to Galveston, she is a full-on local and even placed top ten two times in the Galveston Beach Revue. Mackenzie is borderline obsessed with two things in life: museums, and her three year-old tabby cat, Owen.

This book is a call to action to inspire a new perspective about museums and change the way people experience them.

If you’d like more information, you can connect with Mackenzie via email at mtfinklea@gmail.com, on LinkedIn [https://www.linkedin.com/in/mackenzie-finklea-1], and on Medium @mackenziefinklea or on Instagram and Twitter @mackfink. She also has a personal site at [https://mackenziefinklea.com].

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BeyondtheHalls and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Mackenzie Finklea
story_txt:
Beyond the Halls: An Insider’s Guide to Loving Museums includes a brief history of museums and explores the present nature of these institutions, while providing thought-provoking ways to interact with them. My name is Mackenzie Finklea and I am the author of Beyond the Halls. What's missing out there in the world right now is a book about museums for people not in the industry. I want to write something compelling that even my best engineering friend would want to read because they're interested, and not out of friendly obligation. I want this to be something that any museum, big or small, historical or scientific, would want to put in their gift shop. More importantly, I seek to change the way people think about and experience museums.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will find something that interests you. You can open the book to any section, and find something tailored to your unique personality and background. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for museums in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you have more memorable experiences inside museums, and more thought provoking discussions beyond the halls.In this book, you'll learn about the history of museums and their current fight to thrive in the tourism industry:

Stories about my personal museum adventures.
Thought-provoking questions and interactive exercises.
Fascinating histories of individuals and institutions in the industry.

 
You will love this book if you are a museum professional or enthusiast. You will also love this book even if you hate museums or never go to them. Beyond the Halls is a non-fiction book that speaks to museum lovers and haters alike who are looking at discovering the history of museums and dynamic nature of the industry for the first time.
 
The Book - Beyond the Halls: An Insider’s Guide to Loving MuseumsThis book addresses three main topics; the history of museums, the present challenges, and future possibilities. In order to cater to several unique types of people that might read this book, the book is written in 7 parts.Part 1, the Novice, contains Chapters 1-5. Part 1 explores what museums are and introduces ways for the museum novice to interact with them.Part 2, the Historian, contains Chapters 6-10. You’ll find an introduction to various types of museums, what they are and how they came to be the respected, and the cultural phenomenon they are today.Part 3, the Curator, contains Chapters 11-14. Curators already have gone through a great deal of formal schooling to be experts in their field. Part 3 seeks to provide a fresh perspective on curatorial practices and ideals.Part 4, the Skeptic, contains Chapters 15-19. If you’re hesitant to buy into or hate museums, part 4 is for you. Part 4 takes an honest look at why museums exist and why they even matter. Museums are vibrant and exciting places for learning and, believe it or not, fun; now more than ever.Part 5, the Businessman, contains Chapters 20-22. At the end of the day, museums are a business: many of them are not for profit. They live and die in the tourism industry. Part 5 examines the current state of museums as they struggle to compete in their market.Part 6, the Activist, contains Chapters 23-26. Museums have a bit of a troubled history, but museums in the contemporary world are making changes to be more inclusive and culturally conscious. For the ones that aren’t, that’s where the activist comes in.Part 7, the Enthusiast, contains Chapters 27 and 28. Finally, the book ends with notes about my personal experience with and enthusiasm for museums. I am already on the museum-loving bandwagon, and I want you to join me. 
What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019.
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

 
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover art
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

story:
Jeune journaliste: reportage au Moyen-Orient

 

English version after French version 

 

Une journaliste

 

Je m'appelle Alex. Je suis une journaliste indépendante qui vis et étudie à Montréal. Je commence tout juste ma carrière de journaliste et j'ai besoin d'un premier élan pour mener à bien mes projets à l'étranger. Je m'intéresse à l'aspect international, plus spécialement aux conflits de guerre et aux injustices sociales. 

 

Un projet

 

Liban Nord – Janvier 2013

“J’attends que mon Papa revienne, parce qu’il n’est pas mort… J’ai entendu maman dire à ma tante qu’on l’a enterré vivant !” L’incrédulité, le déni et les cauchemars noircissent le quotidien des enfants syriens. Tout récemment reçus comme réfugiés au Liban, ils s’entassent dans des logements de fortunes et dans des camps aménagés avec les moyens du bord… Il y aurait près de 500 000 réfugiés syriens enregistrés au Liban à l’heure actuelle, selon l’ONU. Or, des sources locales rapportent une population frisant les 700 000 réfugiés. Qui plus est, la moitié de cette population serait composée d’enfants. Ainsi, quelles sont les séquelles que les jeunes réfugiés portent sur leurs épaules ?

 

En me rendant dans les zones de réfugiés syriens au Liban, j’aimerais faire une série de reportages sur la condition des enfants qui s’y trouvent. J’irai directement rencontrer les enfants eux-mêmes, leurs familles, des psychologues, des ONG et des autorités locales.

J’estime qu’il est vital (et je ne fais pas de jeux de mots) de parler de la situation des enfants syriens. Ayant entendu des histoires bien sordides, j’aimerais rapporter des histoires vivantes et objectives de ce que vivent la jeunesse réfugiée.

Plus loin, j’ai l’intention de mener à bien plusieurs autres reportages au Liban. Voici les sujets que j’aimerais aborder:

-L’avortement

-Les tabous dans la presse moyen-orientale

-La francophonie au Liban

 

Les fonds 

 

En tant que journaliste de 22 ans, mes moyens sont très restreints. Or j’ai besoin d’un élan pour pouvoir compléter ce projet et pour pouvoir rapporter des faits touchants et importants. Je vise d’amasser assez de fonds pour couvrir les dépenses de base du voyage au Liban, voici une liste approximative :

Billets d’avions aller-retour vers Beyrouth : 1300$

Équipement journalistique (appareil photo, caméra, enregistreur etc) : 1000$

Dépenses locales, déplacements, alimentation etc. : 1000$

Total : 3300$

 

Ce que vous obtenez, en faisant un don 

 

Pour un don de 25$ et plus :
-De la gratitude ad vitam aeternam
-Un article que j’ai produit – après publication

Pour un don de 70$ et plus :
-Des photos avec copyright d’enfants et de familles syriennes (en respectant un code d’éthique stricte, je ne prendrai pas de photos indument sensationnalistes) – après publication des articles

OU

-Une version papier d’une des publication dans lequel se retrouvera un de mes articles.

 

Futur et impact 

 

En tant que journaliste issue d’une famille biculturelle, je crois que je pourrai apporter une vision intéressante des conflits à l’étranger, plus précisément au Moyen-Orient. J'espère que la nouvelle génération de journalistes francophones pourra mener des reportages instructifs et objectifs tout en se servant de l'ouverture d'esprit qui la caractérise.

 

--------------------- 

Young journalist: reports in the Middle-East 

 

A journalist:

 

My name is Alex; I am an independent freelance journalist from Montreal, Canada. I have just started my career and I would greatly benefit from a first push to pursue my objectives and offer to the media professional reports. I am passionate about international affairs, especially pertaining to war, social injustice and conflict-zone.

 

A project:

 

North of Lebanon - Syrian refugee camp December 2012: 

 

“My dad will come back, he is not dead I swear! I know it because I heard mamma tell my auntie that he has been buried alive” –Alive?- this very word is the last hope and delusion of a little Syrian girl who now lives in a refugee zone in Lebanon, awaiting for her father to come back.

 

This is only a glimpse of what the Syrian families have been going through, for the last 2 years.

 

One of my goals, during my stay, is to write an article on Syrian refugee children in Lebanon, in a couple of weeks. I intend to visit the zone where the refugee live over 10 days in order to gather information, accounts and stories by interviewing the children themselves, their families, and psychologists working alongside them

  

Having heard about the heart wrenching events that these children have been through, have seen and endured, I believe that it is essential to convey objectively what their world is like.

  

Furthermore, I intend to carry out 4 other reports, on the following topics (with more precise journalistic angles, this is only an overview):

-Abortion

-Taboo in the Middle Eastern press

-Sexual education in refugee camps

-French language in Lebanon 

 

Funding:

 

As a 22-year old journalist, my budget is very limited. Yet, if I want to make this journalistic project possible, I need to be able to travel and to have decent equipment. 

 

Here is an approximate break-down of my project expenses

The round-trip plane ticket to Beirut: 1300$

The equipment (photo/film camera, recording device etc): 1000$

The domestic costs of living including transportation, reporting afferent fees, fixer fees, basic alimentation and basic sleeping facilities (12 days): 1000$

 

Total: 3300$

 

What do you get?

 

For a donation from 25$ to 69$:

 

-Everlasting gratitude :)

-An e-mail from my part, after the trip, with pictures                                                                    of me whilst doing my reports. 

-Free access to one of my written reports after publication

 

For a donation of 70$ and over:

 

-Exclusive copyrighted photos taken in the refugee zones (following strict ethics and approval of the children and their families; the pictures will be grabbed with respect, with no undue sensationalism) after publication of the articles. 

OR

-A hard copy of one of the magazine or newspaper the reports have been published in.  

 

Impact and future

 

I believe a new generation of multi-cultural young jourlnalists will provide the world with a new open-minded, objective and creative vision of international issues.

 

It is through the commitment of young journalists that we can make a difference in the field of international relations. Coming from a bi-cultural family, it is my duty to report facts in a fair and accurate manner, without alteration and without partisanship. It is by encouraging young people like myself to expose international realities to the world that we can be part of a more open-minded and informed society. 

 

Note en français:

Ces reportages seront menés en français. J'ai fait toute la mise en page et la rédaction en anglais car ce site est international et je veux rejoindre le plus de donnateurs éventuels.  

Merci

 

---

story:
sharemorestories.com is a brand new platform that seeks to revolutionize the way storytellers and story seekers create, share and discover great stories. Our vision is to improve human self-expression and connection through story.  We are guided by the wonderful words of Maya Angelou, who said that “there is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.” We imagined a place where fewer and fewer people suffer these untold stories, and the rest of the world rejoices with them upon hearing and sharing what these storytellers have to say and now we've now started to build that place.

WATCH: Why stories?

WATCH: Why should you support this campaign?

sharemorestories.com is based on the ideas that the storytelling experience is meant to be social, and that authors and readers can collaborate together to develop great story experiences. We want to innovate the way stories are created and shared by rekindling the ancient methods of communal, shared storytelling; and, in doing so, also provide new opportunities for creativity, communication and community. We call this concept Socially Connected Story Sharing, and we believe it will enable people to find deeper meaning in their lives and a greater sense of connection to others.

WATCH: What is Socially Connected Story Sharing?

Recently, our founder James Warren shared his personal story behind the journey to launch sharemorestories.com. It is a humble yet powerful testament to the notion that each of us is on a journey and has a purpose to fulfill. The experiences of those journeys are rich with stories and it is those stories that must be told.

We've gotten started, but there is much to do. We hope you’ll collaborate with us as we develop this platform. We have a bold vision and it starts with you. Are You In?

WHAT WE NEED

To take sharemorestories.com to the next level, we need $45,000 to develop the beta version of the platform and introduce features that make it really easy for people to create and discover stories.

We’ll do this by building the following features:

  • Enhanced user interface to improve ability to create, share and discover stories
  • Collaborative writing and content crowdsourcing features
  • Collaborative copyright management and protection tools and features
  • Features to collaborate with a variety of writing and storytelling experts 
  • Features to allow easy promotion of stories on platform and across social media
WATCH: What is Collaborative Storytelling?
WATCH: Why would someone want to collaborate on their story?

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

We have self-funded all of the research and development associated with the launch of the alpha site. In order to take it to the next level, we need your involvement and support. We’re building this platform for storytellers and story seekers just like you. Supporting our campaign not only helps us build a platform for you, it also allows you to help other storytellers share their stories and connect with other story seekers.

WATCH: What will people be able to accomplish on the beta site?

WATCH: How will this be different from the current alpha site?

WATCH: Why crowdfunding?

Every dollar you contribute will go toward making sharemorestories.com a better site for you!  Even if we don’t achieve our entire goal, we’ll prioritize the features based on user input and roll out as much as we can afford with what we raise.

WHAT WE WILL PROVIDE

With your help, we’ll be able to take the next step in building a platform for everyday storytellers and seekers just like you to experience stories in a social way. The features we will be able to provide will help storytellers and seekers create, collaborate, discover and connect, and we think that kind of empowerment is pretty cool!

WATCH: What will these features do for the user?

WE UNDERSTAND THE RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Others are also working on creating unique and compelling storytelling experiences, which we think is fantastic! But so far, it’s a fairly new space, there aren’t a lot of “how to” manuals for this kind of platform, and most of us are trying to figure it out as we go. We’re going to make mistakes as we try to make the future of storytelling and sharing happen a little sooner.  To help mitigate the risks:

  • We’ve put together a team of people who bring diverse and extensive storytelling experiences (as writers, marketers, filmmakers, producers and media makers) and also know how to design great user experiences online.
  • We’ve already engaged with dozens of key stakeholders and experts, and will continue to engage dozens more. We practice what we preach – by developing this platform collaboratively, we believe we can reduce risk and avoid wasting time and money.

WATCH: What's the business model?

We’re pretty disciplined about sticking to our project plan and adding to our team to fill in any weak spots. 

  • We’ve already identified and engaged several possible companies who have deep expertise in developing innovative web platforms on time and on budget
  • We plan to build our beta platform with extensive customer input along the way, to make sure we stay focused on developing and delivering a platform that makes it easy for everyday storytellers and seekers to create, share and discover great stories

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Can’t contribute financially? That’s okay, we’ve still got a job – or two - for you!

  1. Spread the word about our campaign and follow our progress, using the Indiegogo  tools above. 
  2. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn and share our posts, tweets and updates about the campaign and sharemorestories.com.
  3. Visit our site and start sharing YOUR story today. 

THAT'S ALL THERE IS TO IT!  JOIN US, AND LET'S GET STARTED.

To learn more about our new platform and find answers to all of your questions, check out sharemorestories.com and watch answers to our frequently asked questions.
