a brand new platform that seeks to revolutionize the way storytellers and story
seekers create, share and discover great stories. Our vision is to improve
human self-expression and connection through story.  We are guided by the
wonderful words of Maya Angelou, who said that “there is no greater agony than
bearing an untold story inside you.” We imagined a place where fewer and fewer
people suffer these untold stories, and the rest of the world rejoices with
them upon hearing and sharing what these storytellers have to say and now we've
now started to build that place.WATCH: Why stories?WATCH: Why should you support this campaign?sharemorestories.com is based on the ideas that the
storytelling experience is meant to be social, and that authors and readers can
collaborate together to develop great story experiences. We want to innovate
the way stories are created and shared by rekindling the ancient methods of
communal, shared storytelling; and, in doing so, also provide new opportunities
for creativity, communication and community. We call this concept Socially
Connected Story Sharing, and we believe it will enable people to find
deeper meaning in their lives and a greater sense of connection to others.WATCH: What is Socially Connected Story Sharing?Recently, our founder James Warren shared his personal story behind the journey to launch sharemorestories.com. It is a humble yet powerful testament to the notion that each of us is on a journey and has a purpose to fulfill. The experiences of those journeys are rich with stories and it is those stories that must be told.We've gotten started, but there is much to do. We hope you’ll
collaborate with us as we develop this platform. We have a bold vision and it
starts with you. Are You In?WHAT WE NEEDTo take sharemorestories.com to the next level, we need $45,000 to develop
the beta version of the platform and introduce features that make it really
easy for people to create and discover stories.We’ll do this by
building the following features:


Enhanced user
interface to improve ability to create, share and discover stories


Collaborative writing
and content crowdsourcing features


Collaborative
copyright management and protection tools and features


Features to
collaborate with a variety of writing and storytelling experts 

Features to allow easy
promotion of stories on platform and across social media
WATCH: What is Collaborative Storytelling?WATCH: Why would someone want to collaborate on their story?WHY WE NEED YOUR
SUPPORT
We have self-funded
all of the research and development associated with the launch of the alpha site.
In order to take it to the next level, we need your involvement and support.
We’re building this platform for storytellers and story seekers just like you.
Supporting our campaign not only helps us build a platform for you, it also
allows you to help other storytellers share their stories and connect with
other story seekers.WATCH: What will people be able to accomplish on the beta site?WATCH: How will this be different from the current alpha site?WATCH: Why crowdfunding?
Every dollar you
contribute will go toward making sharemorestories.com a better site for you!  Even if we don’t achieve our entire goal, we’ll prioritize the
features based on user input and roll out as much as we can afford with what we
raise.WHAT WE WILL PROVIDE
With your help, we’ll
be able to take the next step in building a platform for everyday storytellers
and seekers just like you to experience stories in a social way. The features
we will be able to provide will help storytellers and seekers create,
collaborate, discover and connect, and we think that kind of empowerment is
pretty cool!WATCH: What will these features do for the user?WE UNDERSTAND THE
RISKS AND CHALLENGES
Others are also
working on creating unique and compelling storytelling experiences, which we
think is fantastic! But so far, it’s a fairly new space, there aren’t a lot of
“how to” manuals for this kind of platform, and most of us are trying to figure
it out as we go. We’re going to make mistakes as we try to make the future of
storytelling and sharing happen a little sooner.  To help mitigate the
risks:

We’ve put together a
team of people who bring diverse and extensive storytelling experiences (as
writers, marketers, filmmakers, producers and media makers) and also know how
to design great user experiences online.


We’ve already engaged
with dozens of key stakeholders and experts, and will continue to engage dozens
more. We practice what we preach – by developing this platform collaboratively,
we believe we can reduce risk and avoid wasting time and money.


WATCH: What's the business model?We’re pretty
disciplined about sticking to our project plan and adding to our team to fill
in any weak spots. 


We’ve already
identified and engaged several possible companies who have deep expertise in
developing innovative web platforms on time and on budget


We plan to build our
beta platform with extensive customer input along the way, to make sure we stay
focused on developing and delivering a platform that makes it easy for everyday
storytellers and seekers to create, share and discover great stories

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN
HELP
Can’t contribute
financially? That’s okay, we’ve still got a job – or two - for you!

Spread the word
     about our campaign and follow our progress, using the Indiegogo  tools above. 
Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn and share our posts, tweets and updates
     about the campaign and sharemorestories.com.

Visit our site and start sharing YOUR story today. 

THAT'S ALL THERE IS TO IT!  JOIN US, AND LET'S GET STARTED.To learn more about our new platform and find answers to all of your questions, check out sharemorestories.com and watch answers to our frequently asked questions.

story:
CHILDREN'S STORYBOOKS

                             BY

  JULIA "GRANDMA JUPE" SHANNON


The purpose of the Grandma Jupe Children's Storybooks Project is to raise funds to publish a select number of stories from a collection of children's stories and songs I wrote over a span of twenty plus years.  To date, I have published five children's stories, *three of which were published as a part of my master's thesis in creative writing.  I have begun to have a sense of urgency about getting the remainder of my stories published.  The ones that I like the most, of course!  Publishing the stories is like breathing life into the characters.  I am excited to have the potential for doing this through the Indiegogo Crowd Funding Platform.

Previously Published Stories:
Scruffy Scrappy Dog (About animal abuse, stranger danger and responsibility)
The Knockout Punch (About bullying, fighting and conflict resolution)
*Canopy, Up to his Neck in Trouble (Consequences for acting out of character)
*Baby Elephant Makes Friends (About making friends)
*Calvin Crocodile (About pride, strengths, weaknesses, and little things that take you down)

The "Grandma Jupe Children's Storybooks Project"
1. Take Me to the Farm Stand Here Stories, a series of stories about a family of farmers and their farm and woodland animals is the heart of this project.  These stories are narrated by a young girl who lives in the city but loves to visit the farm.  She enjoys taking visitors to the farm on a tour as she tells them where to stand for the best view of the animals and recites stories that have been told to her by the farmers.  These stories are told in rhyming verse and are sure to be entertaining to children who will find the animal characters endearing.  There are fourteen stories in the series.  (Some adjustments may be made if the layout requires.)

The titles for the stories in this series are as follows:
Take Me to the Farm Today! (This story introduces the child narrator)
Latonia, Sir Galahad and Baby Duck (About friendship and dealing with loss)
Bobby Smith (About responsible pet ownership and work ethics)
Wise Ollie Owl (About farm animal antics and paying attention)
Annie Goat (About a special goat with a special tail)
Alf the Calf (About a calf devoted to both his mother and her twin sister)
Karen Crow (This crow watches over the farm and warns about danger)
Frisco Fox (Although a wild animal, it enjoys the protection of farmer Smith)
Horace Horse (Bobby Smith's handsome horse that has name issues)
Prentice Hog (This fine hog won first prize at the county fair)
Donnell Donkey (Donnell ran away from the circus and retired on the farm)
Naming Animal Babies (Will generate discussion about baby animal's names)
Tomato Worm (Oblivious to scary activity Worm keeps date with tomato plant)
No Ducks! (Where do ducks go each winter?  When and why do they return?)
Granny Smith (Sells farm products, including her beautiful handmade quilts)

If the entire Grandma Jupe Children's Storybooks Project is funded there will be one big Take Me to the Farm Stand Here Stories book and select stand-alone storybooks from the big book such as Latonia, Sir Galahad and Baby Duck; Wise Ollie Owl; and Donnell Donkey. (Little books from the big book)

2. A revision of The Knockout Punch. This story was self-published in 1992.  Tyrone is an aggressive squirrel that engages Cancoon, another squirrel, in a fight over a walnut that Cancoon had found.  The story provides a great opportunity for children to learn life lessons about bullying, fighting and conflict resolution.   The story is written in rhyme and flows with good cadence.  I have set the story to music.  If this project is funded, I will have the music professionally scored and include it with the storybook.  The revised edition will be done in color this time rather than in half-tones as was done with the previous publication.  The story has been enhanced by an increased storyline.

3. A revision of Scruffy Scrappy Dog. (This storybook was also self-published in the early 1990's.  It is a heart-warming story about a little dog that was abandoned by its owners and cared for by two brothers and their friends.  The irony is that the little dog later protects the younger brother and his friend from a dangerous stranger.  This book was once selected and purchased by a local animal shelter representative for handouts to children who participated in its outreach program.  The revised edition of this storybook will be published in color rather than half-tones as originally published.  There are also some changes in the text.

4. Wake Up Sun.   A new story/poem/song about a child waiting for the sun to come out so that the events planned for a special day can take place.  Most everyone can relate to wishing rain clouds away.  This story/poem/song has also been set to music.  If this project is fully funded the music will be professionally scored and included in the storybook.  The story includes Hello Sun and Goodnight Sun.

5. A selection of poems/stories for children set to music waiting to be professionally scored.  Do Bee Do Bee Do; Especially for Love; This Year/If Only I Believe; No Ducks; etc. With full funding these music compositions will be professionally scored and made available to the public through a scored music sheet, disc, or something similar to what is used for musical greeting cards.

The following is a portion of the "No Ducks!" poem/story/song.

Of all the luck
There are no ducks
Upon the farmer's pond

They flew away
One autumn day
When nature waved her wand

With hints of snow
T'was time to go
To places warmed by sun

They filled the sky
When passing by
To watch was such great fun . . .

When I am writing for children I have several things in mind.  Is the story interesting?  If it doesn't capture the child's attention, nothing else matters.  Does the story capture the child's imagination?  Will the child learn something that he or she didn't know and/or is he/she left with something significant to think about?  At the end of the story I want it to be memorable.  Will the child enjoy reading it or hearing it read again?  One of my most gratifying remarks from a parent was passed on to me by my sister, Shirley.  Her co-worker said "Since purchasing the Scruffy Scrappy Dog book, my little boy meets me at the door each day when I get home from work, hands me the Scruffy Scrappy Dog book, and asks me to read him the story again."  That feedback made me very happy and inspired me to continue writing.

Sometimes I am questioned about vocabulary.  My storybooks are not textbooks.  I am not opposed to using words and ideas that are challenging.  If children can learn to say 'supercalifragilisticexpialidocious' along with Mary Poppins, they can handle my little vocabulary challenges.

These stories illustrated by William Curtis, a talented St. Louis, Missouri artist, are designed to delight children and inspire a love of reading.  His illustrations have an appeal that transcends the story.  Little ones, not yet readers, will find the books appealing. Through the actions of the characters they will be able to follow the story line. Stories for the Grandma Jupe Children's Storybooks Project have been tested in the classroom and warmly received by both students and teachers.  Parents who purchased the original versions of Scruffy Scrappy Dog and The Knockout Punch reported favorable reactions to both of these stories.  Through the Take Me to the Farm Stand Here Stories, children will learn about such important aspects of farm life as; crops, work ethics, private property, trespassing, county fairs, types of animals, naming animals, birth and death of animals.

I am a very passionate and diligent writer; therefore, I have a large collection of
original material that has accumulated over the years.  I am confident that the stories and music that I have selected for this project will be appealing to the public and marketable.  If funded, I am committed to seeing this project through.  Even if the project is not fully funded, I will complete as much of the project as possible. If this campaign is successful, it will afford me the opportunity to:  1. Encourage children to read by providing stimulating material. It is commonly accepted that the reading level of many children in the United States has declined resulting in poor academic performance and school dropouts.  2. Donate books to schools and libraries and provide story telling services for children. (I have experience as a teacher, professional storyteller, and volunteer in the St. Louis Ready Readers program.)  3. Assist other authors by freely sharing my knowledge as an author and publisher.

Expenses for Grandma Jupe Children's Storybooks Project:
$30,000 is needed to publish this collection of books in color and score the music.  This is an expensive undertaking.  I need a crowd! If funded, we are ready to complete the project and deliver the rewards by the established deadline date of April 30, 2014.

The perks/rewards that I am offering are sure to delight children and please contributors. At the $15 level, (Baby Duck Award) contributors who give a helping hand will receive a certificate of appreciation and a bookmark. I cannot over emphasize the importance of the impact that this group of contributors as well as those who may contribute less can make on the success of this campaign.  Any combination could very well bring about success.

Receiving the rewards should be exciting; and I shall strive to meet that expectation.  When I send the rewards, I envision a smile on my face because I believe there will be a smile on your face reflecting pleasure and appreciation as you receive what was promised. If I exceed my goal, I will publish other writing projects in my portfolio. If I fail to reach my goal, the Take Me to the Farm/Stand Here Stories will be my priority. If I can't do all of the stories in that collection, I will do as many as possible. Donnell Donkey, Latonia, Sr. Galahad, Baby Duck, plus other characters from this collection must see the light of day.

The Impact

I have confidence in my creative work as well as my ability to bring the creative work to a finished product that will have good market value. The illustrations, professionally done, will be as appealing to children who can not read, as they are to readers. I am hopeful that these stories will encourage children to be more aware of the animals with whom we share the planet and will be encouraged to visit our farms and zoos. Some of my other stories about giraffes, hippos, and elephants, etc. may encourage them when they are older to learn more about animals that live in unusual habitats in faraway lands. Those stories are also waiting to be published. Our children of today will become the adults of tomorrow charged with responsibility for preserving the diversity of Earth's animal and plant life in familiar and comfortable environments for their species. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Everyone who receives information regarding this campaign will not be able or have interest in contributing to the campaign at this time. There are other ways to help! Although the Earth has begun to feel much smaller due to the speed with which information and people travel, it's still a very big place and I only know a few people.  The number of contacts that can be made on behalf of my campaign can be greatly increased by the number of people you are willing to contact and they in turn are willing to contact. All contributions must be received by the deadline date, February 10, 2014. Please help in any way you can. Your involvement is important and will be sincerely appreciated. Thanks for visiting my campaign site.

BE SURE TO VIEW THIS CAMPAIGN ON FACE BOOK AND YOU TUBE.

And that's all there is to it!

story:
Hello. My name is Tyler, i'm 18, and I was diagnosed with SMA. Spinal Muscular Atrophy is a condition that lowers the strength of muscles to near infantile, if you have my type.

Our wheelchair accessible van had broken down a few years back, and besides school, i've been bound to my house, completely. Only able to roll myself a few blocks down, until stopped with incredibly steep curbs. Much more time for video games is a nice silver lining, unfortunately it's the only silver lining.

The repairs for our current van are astronomically expensive (Engine, and electrical), so we're shooting for buying a used van, and using a program to get our current lift transferred over.

I myself have talked to countless program directors, and they've all told me the same thing. "We can't help you get a van, but we can help you transfer your current adaptations"

I can't go anywhere with my friends, nor family unless carted around in my manual chair, which is far more uncomfortable than my powered chair. The pain caused by my manual chair is almost unbearable after only a half hour of using it. I've got Scoliosis (Curvature of the spine), Kyphosis (Outward curvature of the upper spine), and Lordosis (Inward curvature of the lower spine) which prompted us to get my powered chair with a custom fit backing to alleviate my pain, and I can't even use it outside of my home.

Every single donation is deep heartedly appreciated. I put the donation at 10,000 because it'd be great to get a nice used van, but if this somehow makes it past the goal, every single cent will be put toward a better van.

I recently found out that with the right adaptations, I could drive. This is absolutely amazing to me, because I never thought that was possible. Now more than ever I need your help! This would be COMPLETELY life changing for me.

Thank you for your time :)

story:
Summary

Between Demons and Deities is about a mage who embarks upon a journey to the neighboring empire to save her friend, all while reckoning with newfound powers, recovering some of her lost history, and stumbling upon a sinister plot that threatens the fate of the mortal realm.

My name is Bianca Wang-Polendo and I am the author of Between Demons and Deities. I started writing this book after being sent back home from school due to the pandemic. With everything that was going on in the world, I needed to process major events and trends, so I turned toward the arts, namely writing. As a fan of fantasy, I naturally decided to use fantasy as my tool of abstract exploration, and was reminded of something I read on a writing blog: Write what you want to read. So I reflected on what exactly that meant to me: what is missing that I feel would be valuable reading? And that planted the seed to the story and some of its topics.

As a fantasy aficionado, I wanted to read about magic and deities and supernatural creatures. As a biracial person, I wanted to read more about multicultural identities in fantasy settings and see more characters whom I can relate to, and I also wanted to see more representation of underrepresented groups and histories. As a person who is in their early twenties, I wanted to read more about the continual process of self-reflection that extends beyond YA settings. As a citizen of the world, I wanted to read about the hope for a better world that stems from our connections to one another.

And so my hope is that, in reading this book, you might discover a new perspective, or perhaps see your own experiences validated. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside the characters about the importance of actively engaging in your own identity through the cycle of learning and reflecting.

The novel takes place in two realms: the mortal and spirit realms. Within the spirit realms, demons and ghosts roam around. In the mortal realm, we get to explore parts of Atonaco, a tropical empire surrounded by the crescent-shaped Moonstone Mountains; the Wei Empire, an expanding empire that encompasses both desert and hollow forests south of the mountain range; and the Eastern Isles, a chain of islands in the Sapphire Sea. Throughout the novel, we follow Esme, a biracial mage who specializes in fire magic and who woke up from a coma two years ago with missing memories. The other two major characters are Raiden, a mysterious and deadly former assassin in the Wei Empire, and Dacio, Esme’s closest friend and a person who specializes in spirit magic.

Preliminary Synopsis:

A missing past, boundless secrets, and a secret weapon that threatens the boundary between the mortal and spirit realms...

Fire mage Esmeralda has always struggled with her missing memories ever since she woke up from her coma two years ago, but Esme had her quiet life in Atonaco and her best friend and spirit mage Dacio by her side to keep her internal conflict at bay. Everything begins to crumble when Dacio is accused of a crime they couldn’t have committed, and is taken south to the Wei Empire for judgement.

With the help of Dacio’s mysterious friend, Esme embarks on a quest to prove Dacio’s innocence. However, things down south are not as they seem, as ominous and powerful beings lurk in the shadows, and she begins to develop magical abilities that are linked to her lost history. As she begins to piece together the mystery of her past, she stumbles upon a sinister plan that threatens the fate of the mortal realm...

You will love this book if you enjoy reading about magic and supernatural creatures, want to read a standalone high fantasy novel that is inspired by a mixture of East Asian and Mesoamerican cultures, and/or if you want to explore the topic of identity through a multicultural lens.

Ultimately, I hope that Between Demons and Deities inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Where does identity come from?
  • How do our circumstances and environment shape our beliefs and actions? How do they influence what is considered moral or justified?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers as discussing them will change us all for the better.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook (one that I would be narrating myself — super cool!).


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Bianca Wang-Polendo is a senior at MIT majoring in mathematics and minoring in economics. Bianca spent much of her childhood and adolescent years reading historical and fantasy novels (to a point where she would read during class, much to the dismay of her teachers). From writing short, incomplete scribbles as an elementary school student to writing retellings of fairy tales during middle and high school, she now is hoping to use fantasy to explore themes relevant to current world trends and to those who may be underrepresented in media.

When she has free time, she is probably scrolling through memes, watching Asian dramas, playing piano, or cuddling with her Shiba Inu. Bianca also enjoys learning foreign languages and traveling internationally.

For more information, you can connect with Bianca at @biancalovesbooks (Instagram) or on LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BetweenDemons&Deities and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Bianca Wang-Polendo

story:
the evolution of a book...

If you've been following #WAWADIA so far, you'll know this book-in-progress is too big a project to describe in this window. So I made the video above. 

I've also published a 52-page prospectus to help you see the future book more clearly. 

You can open the prospectus in a new window by clicking here.

The prospectus is easy to browse, with a linked Table of Contents. You can dip in at any point. It contains:

  • a working thesis
  • a mission statement
  • a descriptions of the book's audiences and intentions 
  • the book structure so far
  • a rough roadmap of sections and chapters
  • a projected budget for the target fundraising amount
  • the starting lineup of my production team (research assistance, editorial, design, and more)
  • four draft excerpts: "The Cremation of B.K.S. Iyengar", "Meeting Nancy Cochren", "My Left Hand: I Am That", and "Six Lenses for Studying Modern Postural Yoga". (Starts on p. 16, if you're eager to get to it...)
  • a list of emergent themes
  • a "Dramatis Personae" (list of on-record informants)
  • answers to some early objections
  • testimonials
  • my bibliography so far
Here's a beautiful draft of the book's cover. Thank you to designer Laura Shaw.



why is this book important? 

Millions benefit from Modern Postural Yoga (MPY) every day. But many are also injuring themselves, or being injured by their teachers. Just how many is hard to know, but it is happening at a higher rate than either yoga marketing or its spiritual pedigree would suggest.
  
Yoga injuries occur for many interweaving reasons. Obvious factors include prior conditioning, poor education in biomechanics, overbearing instruction, sacrificial attitudes towards pain, and group pressures to fulfill presumably shared spiritual ideals.

More subtly, many people are first driven to asana by feelings of inadequacy or shame, and trauma. These experiences can motivate the desire for bodily reclamation and redemption, but they can also acidify practice with anxiety and impulsiveness. Asana is a crucible in which some attempt to forge new selves, and in the process, burn their bodies.

Shining light on this shadowy process can only help current and future practitioners make more mindful and sustainable choices on their path.

There is no way to prevent all injury. But I do believe that this book can model the skills of self-inquiry that will lead to more lucid understandings of practice, the flesh, experiences of pain, the studio, and the relationships of learning and teaching. My hope is that this work may help prevent the worst kind of injury: the injury one cannot digest or understand; the injury that leaves one feeling broken and embittered. 

I also hope it will help those who teach become more aware of and humble before the beautiful tensions of this embodied journey, and to be clearer on where they need to learn more. 


what I'm asking for...

  • 30K for the 20 months of work ahead.
  • Expenses include research assistance, investigative travel, editorial support and design. Oh, and time to write.
  • A detailed and transparent budget is laid out in the prospectus.
  • (I have a proven record of making good on these campaigns. Threads of Yoga and Family Wakes Us Up have found their readership, and acclaim. There will be bumps along the road, for sure. But I have an amazing story to follow, a lot of fire, and a ton of good help.)

support by pre-ordering!

  • Single copies
  • Gift amounts
  • Wholesale amounts
  • You can also invite me to your studio or conference event to present from my ongoing findings, and facilitate community discussion. Makes for a very rich evening.

    or, you can support by:

    • Chipping in whatever you'd like.
    • Making noise about the campaign. (See the share tools.)
    • Sending along thoughts/feedback...

    my intentions for this book:

    • To produce an accurate, contemplative, and hopeful account of modern yoga practice that will serve a maturing community. 
    • To help shift yoga culture into a more self-reflective era. To help reach beyond the fading paradigms of faith, charismatic authority, and the transcendent and often self-harming view of the body as something that must be perfected, instead of simply made more functional, enjoyed and explored with curiosity.   
    • To shine light on the innovative pathways that are emerging as earnest yogis recover from the injuries of yoga’s adolescence.

    an early testimonial :

    Matthew Remski's WAWADIA research digs beneath the statistics of yoga injuries to examine the stories we tell ourselves about our bodies, perfection, inadequacy and freedom. We all know that repetitive strain or too much flexibility creates the conditions for injury. But what we haven't brought to light yet are the consequences of the narratives we tell ourselves - how they set us up for physical trouble in practice and how they influence the way we go through life. This research will help you pay attention to the strange unconscious intentions that get all mixed up in a life-long practice, so you can clear out unhelpful motivations and follow through on what's truly good for you. 

    -- Michael Stone, teacher, author

    ________

    Thank you for your support.

    warmly,

    Matthew Remski

story:
About Me

My name is Nicki Daniels, author of a new children’s book called Junebug: No Life Too Small. I'm a vegan mother who enjoys cooking, occupational therapy, wildlife rehabilitation, and supporting farm animal sanctuaries. For as long as I can remember, I have always cared deeply about other animals including the littlest creatures. 

Meet Junebug!

My idea for Junebug came from things I used to do as a child to save bugs. If I ever saw a bug struggling in water, trapped in a small space or on its back, my instinct was to help them.

Junebug is an introduction for kids to see the smallest forms of life as tiny beings who are just trying to live their lives. If we can teach children to respect the tiniest, most vulnerable creatures, this can give them a great start in developing compassion for all living beings. 

With all that's going on in the world today, we should all be aware that every bug, every tree, every plant, every animal relies on each other, and we should respect that.

About the Book

In this book, the main character June helps her friends recognize that we should not harm those who have every much of a right to be here as we do. She shows her friends that these little insects work hard to build their homes, that they can get hot and tired just like us, and they have important functions in our ecosystem. She helps teach them to appreciate how cool and beautiful these little beings are. 

How You Can Help

I’m partnering with Vegan Publishers and the amazing illustrator Addy Rivera Sonda (below) to create a book that I’m very proud of, but I need your help to finalize the book. Our goal is to receive enough pre-orders and contributions so that we can cover costs related to completing, printing, and distributing the book. This project cannot be completed without your support, which will also help bring this book to many children. Books will be shipped 2-3 months after the campaign ends. 

Thank you for your support!!!

story:
Expect the Unexpected - OFF I 40 år!

Danmarks ældste filmfestival, Odense International Film Festival runder et skarpt hjørne, da festivalen i år kan fejre 40 års fødselsdag. I den forbindelse ønsker OFF af hele sit hjerte at dele den fantastiske rejse og vilde udvikling med sit publikum. 

Derfor vil vi udgive en smuk og sigende jubilæumsbog, der i ord og billeder kan portrættere OFF og alle de, der har været med til at gøre OFF til det, den er i dag - nemlig en publikumsfest uden lige.


OFFs vilde udvikling

OFF er en filmfestival, der har været under konstant forandring gennem de sidste 40 år fra at være en festival, der hyldede H.C. Andersen inspirerede animationskortfilm til nu at være en festival der dækker hele kortfilmsspectret. I 1975 deltog 58 kortfilm i konkurrencen. I dag modtager festivalen mere end 3200 film fra hele verden, har mere end 23.000 besøgende og hele 150 fantastiske frivillige i den sidste uge i august, hvor festivalen foregår.

OFF blev started i 1975 i forbindelse med 100 året for H.C Andersens død og er derfor Danmarks ældste filmfestival. Siden 2013 er OFF også Danmarks eneste Oscar kvalificerende filmfestival og i år kan festivalen således sende hele tre vindere videre til præ-selektionsjuryen for det prestigefyldte Oscar Akademi. Dette er naturligvis et resultat, som vi er yderst stolte af og bl.a. derfor ønsker vi at lave denne jubilæumsbog. 


Din fortjeneste

Vi har ikke mulighed for at lave denne jubilæumsbog uden opbakning og støtte. Vi ser jubilæumsbogen - ikke kun som et monument for OFFs udvikling - men i høj grad også som et bevis på den opbakning vores publikum altid har bidraget med. Der ville ikke være en kortfilmsfestival i Odense, hvis ikke de mange filmskabere leverede film og hvis ikke vores trofaste publikum og vores mange frivillige deltog aktivt i festivalen. 

Det er JERES fortjeneste, at OFF klarer sig så godt og at der en grund til at lave en jubilæumsbog. Vi håber I vil være med til at realisere drømmen.


Coffee table book - visuelt smuk 

Den støtte du bidrager med vil gå til at realisere bogen i form af design, layout og tryk. Vi har forelsket os ideen om et coffee-table format, der på en lækker og mere grafisk måde vil lave et portræt af OFF i smukke billeder, grafiske detaljer, citater, funny facts og interviews med personligheder, der har haft deres gang på festivalen. Det skal være en bog, der ikke kommer ind på hylden ved siden af de andre, men en bog, som man har lyst til at have liggende fremme og som har så meget elegance og visuel ”lækkerhed", at man har lyst til at se, røre og føle den igen og igen. 


OFF-people er hele drivkraften bag bogen

Odense International Film Festival er ikke udelukkende filmkunst i mørket og sæder af rødt velour. Det er en begivenhed, som åbner dørene til en verden fyldt med inspiration, overraskelser og følelser. Og i tiden op til og hele ugen igennem er Odense gennemsyret af events, workshops, musik, fester, foredrag, spændende gæster og indtryk fra hele verden.

Vi skal have hele dette stemningsbillede ind i bogen. Vi skal fremhæve OFF som festival og hele ”festen” OFF og vi skal fremhæve de mange filmskabere og de film der gennem tiden har været udvalgt til at være en del af konkurrencen på OFF. Vi skal fremhæve vores publikum, vores mange frivillige og alle de andre der har været drivkraften bag OFF, for uden filmskabere, publikum og frivillige var der ingen OFF.


Tak for hjælpen

Jeres støtte er uvurderlig og vi er taknemmelige for hvert eneste bidrag. Al støtte vi modtager vil gå til at få realiseret drømmen om vores jubilæumsbog.

Skulle vi lande langt fra målet, og være tvunget at sætte vores forventninger ned, så vil vi være nødt til at lave en online version, for en jubilæumsbog skal vi have. 

På forhånd mange tusinde tak for dit bidrag.

Kortfilm, Kys og Kærlighed

Odense International Film Festival

Film Festival runder et skarpt hjørne, da festivalen i år kan fejre 40 års
fødselsdag. I den forbindelse ønsker OFF af hele sit hjerte at dele den fantastiske
rejse og vilde udvikling med sit publikum. 
Derfor vil vi udgive en smuk og sigende jubilæumsbog,
der i ord og billeder kan portrættere OFF og alle de, der har været med til at
gøre OFF til det, den er i dag - nemlig en publikumsfest uden lige.





OFFs vilde udvikling


OFF er en filmfestival, der har været
under konstant forandring gennem de sidste 40 år fra at være en festival, der
hyldede H.C. Andersen inspirerede animationskortfilm til nu at være en festival
der dækker hele kortfilmsspectret. I 1975 deltog 58 kortfilm i konkurrencen. I
dag modtager festivalen mere end 3200 film fra hele verden, har mere end 23.000
besøgende og hele 150 fantastiske frivillige i den sidste uge i august, hvor
festivalen foregår. 
OFF blev started i 1975 i forbindelse
med 100 året for H.C Andersens død og er derfor Danmarks ældste filmfestival.
Siden 2013 er OFF også Danmarks eneste Oscar kvalificerende filmfestival og i
år kan festivalen således sende hele tre vindere videre til
præ-selektionsjuryen for det prestigefyldte Oscar Akademi. Dette er naturligvis
et resultat, som vi er yderst stolte af og bl.a. derfor ønsker vi at lave denne
jubilæumsbog.  








Din fortjeneste


Vi har ikke mulighed for at lave denne jubilæumsbog
uden opbakning og støtte. Vi ser jubilæumsbogen - ikke kun som et monument for
OFFs udvikling - men i høj grad også som et bevis på den opbakning
vores publikum altid har bidraget med. Der ville ikke være en
kortfilmsfestival i Odense, hvis ikke de mange filmskabere leverede film og
hvis ikke vores trofaste publikum og vores mange frivillige deltog aktivt
i festivalen. 
Det er JERES fortjeneste, at OFF klarer sig så
godt og at der en grund til at lave en jubilæumsbog. Vi håber I vil være
med til at realisere drømmen.


   Coffee table book - visuelt smuk  

Den støtte du bidrager med vil gå til at realisere
bogen i form af design, layout og tryk. Vi har forelsket os ideen om et
coffee-table format, der på en lækker og mere grafisk måde vil lave et portræt
af OFF i smukke billeder, grafiske detaljer, citater, funny facts og interviews
med personligheder, der har haft deres gang på festivalen. Det skal være en
bog, der ikke kommer ind på hylden ved siden af de andre, men en bog, som man
har lyst til at have liggende fremme og som har så meget elegance og visuel ”lækkerhed",
at man har lyst til at se, røre og føle den igen og igen. 
OFF-people er hele drivkraften bag bogen
Odense
International Film Festival er ikke udelukkende filmkunst i mørket og sæder af
rødt velour. Det er en begivenhed, som åbner dørene til en verden fyldt med
inspiration, overraskelser og følelser. Og i tiden op til og hele ugen igennem
er Odense gennemsyret af events, workshops, musik, fester, foredrag, spændende gæster
og indtryk fra hele verden. 
Vi skal have hele dette stemningsbillede ind i bogen. Vi skal fremhæve OFF som festival og hele ”festen” OFF og vi skal fremhæve de mange filmskabere og de film der gennem tiden har været udvalgt
til at være en del af konkurrencen på OFF. Vi skal fremhæve vores publikum,
vores mange frivillige og alle de andre der har været drivkraften bag OFF, for
uden filmskabere, publikum og frivillige var der ingen OFF.

Tak for hjælpen
Jeres støtte er uvurderlig og vi er taknemmelige for
hvert eneste bidrag. Al støtte vi modtager vil gå til at få realiseret drømmen
om vores jubilæumsbog. Skulle vi lande langt fra målet, og være tvunget at
sætte vores forventninger ned, så vil vi være nødt til at lave en online
version, for en jubilæumsbog skal vi have.
